attributes.name: expanded
attributes.description: A list of expanded child collapsibles.

attributes.name: multiple
attributes.description: Specifies whether multiple collapsibles can be open at the same time.

attributes.name: translations
attributes.description: A collection of translated resources from the translation bundle, or null if this component has no resources.

attributes.name: on-expanded-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'expanded' attribute

attributes.name: on-multiple-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'multiple' attribute

attributes.name: on-translations-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'translations' attribute

attributes.name: on-oj-before-expand
attributes.description: Triggered immediately before any collapsible in the accordion is expanded.

attributes.name: on-oj-expand
attributes.description: Triggered after any collapsible in the accordion is expanded.

attributes.name: on-oj-before-collapse
attributes.description: Triggered immediately before any collapsible in the accordion is collapsed.

attributes.name: on-oj-collapse
attributes.description: Triggered after any collapsible in the accordion has been collapsed.

tags.name: oj-accordion
tags.description: Displays a set of Collapsible child elements.

attributes.name: initials
attributes.description: Specifies the initials of the avatar.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Specifies the size of the avatar.

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: Specifies the src for the image of the avatar.

attributes.name: on-initials-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'initials' attribute

attributes.name: on-size-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'size' attribute

attributes.name: on-src-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'src' attribute

tags.name: oj-avatar
tags.description: An icon capable of displaying a custom image, initials, or a placeholder image.

attributes.name: config
attributes.description:
Configuration object that defines a view and a data available to the oj-bind-dom element.
See details for each attribute. The configuration object can be specified
either directly or via a Promise.

attributes.name: config.data
attributes.description: The data available to the oj-bind-dom view.

attributes.name: config.view
attributes.description: Defines oj-bind-dom view.

attributes.name: on-config-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'config' attribute

tags.name: oj-bind-dom
tags.description: Renders HTML content with access to passed in data properties.

attributes.name: as
attributes.description:
An alias for the array item. This can be especially useful
if multiple oj-bind-for-each elements are nested to provide access to the data
for each level of iteration.

attributes.name: data
attributes.description:
The array or an oj.DataProvider that you wish to iterate over. Required property.
Note that the <oj-bind-for-each> will dynamically update the generated
DOM in response to changes if the value is an observableArray.

attributes.name: on-as-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'as' attribute

attributes.name: on-data-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'data' attribute

tags.name: oj-bind-for-each
tags.description: Binds items of an array to the specified markup section. The markup section is duplicated for each array item when element is rendered.

attributes.name: test
attributes.description:
The test condition for the if clause. The children of the element will
only be rendered if the test is true.

attributes.name: on-test-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'test' attribute

tags.name: oj-bind-if
tags.description: Conditionally render its contents only if a provided test returns true.

attributes.name: index
attributes.description: An index value allowing the slot children to be individually slotted. This is useful when the composite needs to add additional DOM around slotted children.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the slot.

attributes.name: on-index-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'index' attribute

attributes.name: on-name-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'name' attribute

tags.name: oj-bind-slot
tags.description: A placeholder for child DOM to appear in a specified slot.

attributes.name: as
attributes.description:
An optional alias for $current that can be referenced inside the default template DOM. Note
that application $current aliasing should be done with the
data-oj-as attribute on the
template element.

attributes.name: data
attributes.description:
The object containing additional context variables to extend the stamped template nodes'
binding context. These variables will be exposed as variables on $current and aliases.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the slot.

attributes.name: on-as-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'as' attribute

attributes.name: on-data-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'data' attribute

attributes.name: on-name-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'name' attribute

tags.name: oj-bind-template-slot
tags.description: A placeholder for stamped child DOM to appear in a specified slot.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of the text node.

attributes.name: on-value-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'value' attribute

tags.name: oj-bind-text
tags.description: Binds a text node to an expression.

attributes.description: Indicates in what states the button has chrome (background and border).

attributes.name: display

attributes.name: on-oj-action
attributes.description: Triggered when a button is clicked. This will be triggered by keyboard events as well as mouse/touch events. To ensure keyboard accessibility, the only correct, supported way to react to the click of a button is to listen for this event. Click listeners and href navigation should not be used.

tags.name: oj-button
tags.description: A clickable button.

attributes.name: focus-management

attributes.name: translations
attributes.description: A collection of translated resources from the translation bundle, or null if this component has no resources.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: Indicates which oj-options in the buttonset are selected.

attributes.name: on-chroming-changed

attributes.name: display

attributes.name: focus-management

attributes.name: on-chroming-changed

attributes.name: animation-on-data-change
attributes.description: Defines the animation that is applied on data changes. Animation is automatically disabled when there are a large number of data items.

attributes.name: animation-on-display
attributes.description: Defines the animation that is shown on initial display. Animation is automatically disabled when there are a large number of data items.

attributes.name: as
attributes.description: An alias for the $current context variable when referenced inside the item, series or group templates when using a DataProvider.

attributes.name: coordinate-system
attributes.description: The coordinate system of the chart. Only applies to bar, line, area, combo, scatter, and bubble charts.

attributes.name: data
attributes.description: An object with the following properties, used to define the series and groups when using a DataProvider to provide data to the chart. Also accepts a Promise for deferred data rendering.

attributes.name: data-cursor
attributes.description: Defines whether the data cursor is enabled. If set to "auto", the data cursor is shown only for line or area charts on touch devices. The data cursor is not shown when the tooltip is null and it is not supported on polar charts.

attributes.name: data-cursor-behavior
attributes.description: Defines the behavior of the data cursor when moving between data items.

attributes.name: data-cursor-position
attributes.description: Speficies the position of the data cursor. Used for synchronizing data cursors across multiple charts. Null if the data cursor is not displayed.

attributes.name: data-label
attributes.description: A function that returns a custom data label. The function takes a dataContext argument, provided by the chart, with the following properties: id: The id of the data item. series: The id of the series the data item belongs to. group: The id or an array of ids of the group(s) the data item belongs to. For hierarchical groups, it will be an array of outermost to innermost group ids. value, targetValue, x, y, z, low, high, open, close, volume: The values of the data item. label: The label for the data item if the dataLabel callback is ignored. The dataLabel callback can concatenate this with another string to easily enhance the default label. totalValue: The total of all values in the chart. This will only be included for pie charts. data: The data object of the data item. For nested items, it will be an array containing the parent item data and nested item data. itemData: The row data object for the data item. This will only be set if a DataProvider is being used. seriesData: The data for the series the data item belongs to. groupData: An array of data for the group the data item belongs to. For hierarchical groups, it will be an array of outermost to innermost group data related to the data item. componentElement: The chart element. The function may return a number or a string or in the case of range charts, an array of numbers or strings. If any label is a number, it will be formatted by the valueFormat of the type 'label' before being used as labels.

attributes.name: dnd
attributes.description: Provides support for HTML5 Drag and Drop events. Please refer to third party documentation on HTML5 Drag and Drop to learn how to use it.

attributes.name: drag-mode
attributes.description: The action that is performed when a drag occurs on the chart. Pan and marquee zoom are only available if zoom and scroll is turned on. Marquee select is only available if multiple selection is turned on. If the value is set to "user" and multiple actions are available, buttons will be displayed on the plot area to let users switch between modes.

attributes.name: drilling
attributes.description: Whether drilling is enabled. Drillable objects will show a pointer cursor on hover and fire an ojDrill event on click (double click if selection is enabled). Use "on" to enable drilling for all series objects (legend items), group objects (x-axis labels), and data items. Use "seriesOnly" or "groupsOnly" to enable drilling for series objects or group objects only. To enable or disable drilling on individual series, group, or data item, use the drilling attribute in each series, group, or data item.

attributes.name: group-comparator
attributes.description: A comparator function that determines the ordering of the chart groups when using a DataProvider. If undefined, the group will follow the order in which they are found in the data. The group objects will have the same properties as the context for groupTemplate's $current.

attributes.name: groups
attributes.description:
An array of objects with the following properties, used to define series labels and override series styles.
Only a single series is supported for stock charts. Also accepts a Promise for deferred data rendering.

attributes.name: hidden-categories
attributes.description: An array of category strings used for filtering. Series or data items with any category matching an item in this array will be filtered.

attributes.name: hide-and-show-behavior
attributes.description: Defines the hide and show behavior that is performed when clicking on a legend item. When data items are hidden, the y axes can be optionally rescaled to fit to the remaining data.

attributes.name: highlight-match
attributes.description: The matching condition for the highlightedCategories property. By default, highlightMatch is 'all' and only items whose categories match all of the values specified in the highlightedCategories array will be highlighted. If highlightMatch is 'any', then items that match at least one of the highlightedCategories values will be highlighted.

attributes.name: highlighted-categories
attributes.description: An array of category strings used for highlighting. Series or data items matching all categories in this array will be highlighted.

attributes.name: hover-behavior
attributes.description: Defines the behavior applied when hovering over data items.

attributes.name: initial-zooming
attributes.description: Whether automatic initial zooming is enabled. The valid values are "first" to initially zoom to the first data points (after the viewportMin) that can fit in the plot area, "last" to initially zoom to the last data points (before the viewportMax), and "none" to disable initial zooming. Only applies to bar, line, area, and combo charts with zoomAndScroll turned on.

attributes.name: legend
attributes.description: An object defining the style, positioning, and behavior of the legend.

attributes.name: orientation
attributes.description: The chart orientation. Only applies to bar, line, area, combo, box plot, and funnel charts.

attributes.name: other-threshold
attributes.description: Specifies the fraction of the whole pie under which a slice would be aggregated into an "Other" slice. Valid values range from 0 (default) to 1. For example, a value of 0.1 would cause all slices which are less than 10% of the pie to be aggregated into the "Other" slice. Only applies to pie chart.

attributes.name: overview
attributes.description: An object defining the overview scrollbar. Only applies if zoomAndScroll is not off. Currently only supported for vertical bar, line, area, stock, and combo charts.

attributes.name: pie-center
attributes.description: An object defining the center content of a pie chart. Either a label can be displayed at the center of the pie chart or custom HTML content.

attributes.name: plot-area
attributes.description: An object defining the style of the plot area.

attributes.name: polar-grid-shape
attributes.description: Defines whether the grid shape of the polar chart is circle or polygon. Only applies to polar line and area charts.

attributes.name: selection
attributes.description:
An array used to define the ids of the initially selected objects.
When the selection is changed, the event.detail of the selectionChanged event will contain the following additional properties: Name Type Description selectionData Object an array containing objects describing the selected data items Properties Name Type Description data object the data of the item, if one was specified groupData Array the group data of the item seriesData object the series data of the item endGroup string the end group of a marquee selection on a chart with categorical axis startGroup string the start group of a marquee selection on a chart with categorical axis xMax number the maximum x value of a marquee selection xMin number the minimum x value of a marquee selection yMax number the maximum y value of a marquee selection yMin number the minimum y value of a marquee selection

attributes.name: selection-mode
attributes.description: The type of selection behavior that is enabled on the chart.

attributes.name: series
attributes.description:
An array of objects with the following properties, used to define series labels and override series styles.
Only a single series is supported for stock charts. Also accepts a Promise for deferred data rendering.

attributes.name: series-comparator
attributes.description: A comparator function that determines the ordering of the chart series when using a DataProvider. If undefined, the series will follow the order in which they are found in the data. The series objects will have the same properties as the context for seriesTemplate's $current.

attributes.name: sorting
attributes.description: Specifies the sorting of the data. It should only be used for pie charts, bar/line/area charts with one series, or stacked bar/area charts. Sorting will not apply when using a hierarchical group axis.

attributes.name: split-dual-y
attributes.description: Defines whether the plot area is split into two sections, so that sets of data assigned to the different Y-axes appear in different parts of the plot area. Stock charts do not support "off".

attributes.name: splitter-position
attributes.description: In a split dual-Y chart, specifies the fraction of the space that is given to the Y-axis subchart. Valid values are numbers from 0 to 1.

attributes.name: stack
attributes.description: Defines whether the data items are stacked. Only applies to bar, line, area, and combo charts. Does not apply to range series.

attributes.name: stack-label
attributes.description: Defines whether or not the total values of stacked data items should be displayed. Only applies to bar charts. It can be formatted by the valueFormat of the type 'label'.

attributes.name: style-defaults
attributes.description: An object defining the default styles for series colors, marker shapes, and other style attributes. Properties specified on this object may be overridden by specifications on the data object.

attributes.name: time-axis-type
attributes.description: The type of time axis to display in the chart. Time axis is only supported for Cartesian bar, line, area, stock, box plot, and combo charts. If the type is "enabled" or "skipGaps", the time values must be provided through the "groups" attribute and stacking is supported. If the type is "skipGaps", the groups will be rendered at a regular interval regardless of any time gaps that may exist in the data. If the type is "mixedFrequency", the time values must be provided through the "x" attribute of the the data items and stacking is not supported.

attributes.name: tooltip
attributes.description: An object containing an optional callback function for tooltip customization.

attributes.name: touch-response
attributes.description: Data visualizations require a press and hold delay before triggering tooltips, marquee selection, and rollover effects on mobile devices to avoid interfering with page panning, but these hold delays can make applications seem slower and less responsive. For a better user experience, the application can remove the touch and hold delay when data visualizations are used within a non scrolling container or if there is sufficient space outside of the visualization for panning. If touchResponse is touchStart the element will instantly trigger the touch gesture and consume the page pan events if the element does not require an internal feature that requires a touch start gesture like panning, zooming, or when marquee selection is initiated. If touchResponse is auto, the element will behave like touchStart if it determines that it is not rendered within scrolling content and if panning is not available for those elements that support the feature.

attributes.name: track-resize
attributes.description: Defines whether the element will automatically render in response to changes in size. If set to off, then the application is responsible for calling refresh to render the element at the new size.

attributes.name: translations
attributes.description: A collection of translated resources from the translation bundle, or null if this component has no resources.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The chart type.

attributes.name: value-formats
attributes.description: An object specifying value formatting and tooltip behavior, whose keys generally correspond to the attribute names on the data items.

attributes.name: x-axis
attributes.description: An object defining properties for the axis, tick marks, tick labels, and axis titles.

attributes.name: y2-axis
attributes.description: An object defining properties for the axis, tick marks, tick labels, and axis titles. Y2 axis is only supported for Cartesian bar, line, area, and combo charts.

attributes.name: y-axis
attributes.description: An object defining properties for the axis, tick marks, tick labels, and axis titles.

attributes.name: zoom-and-scroll
attributes.description: Specifies the zoom and scroll behavior of the chart. "Live" behavior means that the chart will be updated continuously as it is being manipulated, while "delayed" means that the update will wait until the zoom/scroll action is done. While "live" zoom and scroll provides the best end user experience, no guarantess are made about the rendering performance or usability for large data sets or slow client environments. If performance is an issue, "delayed" zoom and scroll should be used instead.

attributes.name: zoom-direction
attributes.description: Specifies the zoom direction of bubble and scatter charts. "Auto" zooms in both x and y direction. Use "x" or "y" for single direction zooming.

attributes.name: data-cursor-position.x
attributes.description: The x value of the data cursor.

attributes.name: data-cursor-position.y
attributes.description: The y value of the data cursor. If both y and y2 are defined, y will take precedence.

attributes.name: data-cursor-position.y2
attributes.description: The y2 value of the data cursor. If both y and y2 are defined, y will take precedence.

attributes.name: data-label.id
attributes.description: The id of the data item.

attributes.name: data-label.series
attributes.description: The id of the series the data item belongs to.

attributes.name: data-label.group
attributes.description: The id or an array of ids of the group(s) the data item belongs to. For hierarchical groups, it will be an array of outermost to innermost group ids.

attributes.name: data-label.value
attributes.description: The values of the data item.

attributes.name: data-label.target-value
attributes.description: The values of the data item.

attributes.name: data-label.x
attributes.description: The values of the data item.

attributes.name: data-label.y
attributes.description: The values of the data item.

attributes.name: data-label.z
attributes.description: The values of the data item.

attributes.name: data-label.low
attributes.description: The values of the data item.

attributes.name: data-label.high
attributes.description: The values of the data item.

attributes.name: data-label.open
attributes.description: The values of the data item.

attributes.name: data-label.close
attributes.description: The values of the data item.

attributes.name: data-label.volume
attributes.description: The values of the data item.

attributes.name: data-label.label
attributes.description: The label for the data item if the dataLabel callback is ignored. The dataLabel callback can concatenate this with another string to easily enhance the default label.

attributes.name: data-label.total-value
attributes.description: The total of all values in the chart. This will only be included for pie charts.

attributes.name: data-label.data
attributes.description: The data object of the data item. For nested items, it will be an array containing the parent item data and nested item data.

attributes.name: data-label.item-data
attributes.description: The row data object for the data item. This will only be set if a DataProvider is being used.

attributes.name: data-label.series-data
attributes.description: The data for the series the data item belongs to.

attributes.name: data-label.group-data
attributes.description: An array of data for the group the data item belongs to. For hierarchical groups, it will be an array of outermost to innermost group data related to the data item.

attributes.name: data-label.dimensions
attributes.description: The height and width of the data item. This will only be set for bar series types.

attributes.name: data-label.component-element
attributes.description: The chart element.

attributes.name: data-label.dimensions.width
attributes.description: The width of the data item.

attributes.name: data-label.dimensions.height
attributes.description: The height of the data item.

attributes.name: dnd.drag
attributes.description: An object that describes drag functionality.

attributes.name: dnd.drop
attributes.description: An object that describes drop functionality.

attributes.name: dnd.drag.groups
attributes.description: Allows dragging of chart groups from the categorical axis labels.

attributes.name: dnd.drag.items
attributes.description: Allows dragging of chart data items, including bars, line/area/scatter markers, bubbles, and pie/funnel/pyramid slices.

attributes.name: dnd.drag.series
attributes.description: Allows dragging of chart series from the legend items.

attributes.name: dnd.drag.groups.data-types
attributes.description: The MIME types to use for the dragged data in the dataTransfer object. This can be a string if there is only one type, or an array of strings if multiple types are needed. For example, if selected employee data items are being dragged, dataTypes could be "application/employees+json". Drop targets can examine the data types and decide whether to accept the data. For each type in the array, dataTransfer.setData will be called with the specified type and the data. The data is an array of the dataContexts of the selected groups. The dataContext is the JSON version of the dataContext that we use for "tooltip" and "dataLabels" properties, excluding componentElement and parentElement. This property is required unless the application calls setData itself in a dragStart callback function.

attributes.name: dnd.drag.groups.drag
attributes.description: An optional callback function that receives the "drag" event as argument.

attributes.name: dnd.drag.groups.drag-end
attributes.description: An optional callback function that receives the "dragend" event as argument.

attributes.name: dnd.drag.groups.drag-start
attributes.description: An optional callback function that receives the "dragstart" event and context information as arguments. The context information is as follows: groups {Array.(object)}: An array of dataContexts of the dragged groups. The dataContext is the same as what we use for "tooltip" and "dataLabels" properties. This function can set its own data and drag image as needed. When this function is called, event.dataTransfer is already populated with the default data and drag image.

attributes.name: dnd.drag.items.data-types
attributes.description: The MIME types to use for the dragged data in the dataTransfer object. This can be a string if there is only one type, or an array of strings if multiple types are needed. For example, if selected employee data items are being dragged, dataTypes could be "application/employees+json". Drop targets can examine the data types and decide whether to accept the data. For each type in the array, dataTransfer.setData will be called with the specified type and the data. The data is an array of the dataContexts of the selected data items. The dataContext is the JSON version of the dataContext that we use for "tooltip" and "dataLabels" properties, excluding componentElement and parentElement. This property is required unless the application calls setData itself in a dragStart callback function.

attributes.name: dnd.drag.items.drag
attributes.description: An optional callback function that receives the "drag" event as argument.

attributes.name: dnd.drag.items.drag-end
attributes.description: An optional callback function that receives the "dragend" event as argument.

attributes.name: dnd.drag.items.drag-start
attributes.description: An optional callback function that receives the "dragstart" event and context information as arguments. The context information is as follows: item {Array.(object)}: An array of dataContexts of the dragged data items. The dataContext is the same as what we use for "tooltip" and "dataLabels" properties. This function can set its own data and drag image as needed. When this function is called, event.dataTransfer is already populated with the default data and drag image.

attributes.name: dnd.drag.series.data-types
attributes.description: The MIME types to use for the dragged data in the dataTransfer object. This can be a string if there is only one type, or an array of strings if multiple types are needed. For example, if selected employee data items are being dragged, dataTypes could be "application/employees+json". Drop targets can examine the data types and decide whether to accept the data. For each type in the array, dataTransfer.setData will be called with the specified type and the data. The data is an array of the dataContexts of the selected series. The dataContext is the JSON version of the dataContext that we use for "tooltip" and "dataLabels" properties, excluding componentElement and parentElement. This property is required unless the application calls setData itself in a dragStart callback function.

attributes.name: dnd.drag.series.drag
attributes.description: An optional callback function that receives the "drag" event as argument.

attributes.name: dnd.drag.series.drag-end
attributes.description: An optional callback function that receives the "dragend" event as argument.

attributes.name: dnd.drag.series.drag-start
attributes.description: An optional callback function that receives the "dragstart" event and context information as arguments. The context information is as follows: series {Array.(object)}: An array of dataContexts of the dragged series. The dataContext is the same as what we use for "tooltip" and "dataLabels" properties. This function can set its own data and drag image as needed. When this function is called, event.dataTransfer is already populated with the default data and drag image.

attributes.name: dnd.drop.legend
attributes.description: Allows dropping on the legend.

attributes.name: dnd.drop.plot-area
attributes.description: Allows dropping on the plot area.

attributes.name: dnd.drop.x-axis
attributes.description: Allows dropping on the X axis.

attributes.name: dnd.drop.y2-axis
attributes.description: Allows dropping on the Y2 axis.

attributes.name: dnd.drop.y-axis
attributes.description: Allows dropping on the Y axis.

attributes.name: dnd.drop.legend.data-types
attributes.description: An array of MIME data types this element can accept. This property is required unless dragEnter, dragOver, and drop callback functions are specified to handle the corresponding events.

attributes.name: dnd.drop.legend.drag-enter
attributes.description: An optional callback function that receives the "dragenter" event and empty context information as arguments. This function should call event.preventDefault() to indicate the dragged data can be accepted. Otherwise, dataTypes will be matched against the drag data types to determine if the data is acceptable.

attributes.name: dnd.drop.legend.drag-leave
attributes.description: An optional callback function that receives the "dragleave" event and empty context information as arguments.

attributes.name: dnd.drop.legend.drag-over
attributes.description: An optional callback function that receives the "dragover" event and empty context information as arguments. This function should call event.preventDefault() to indicate the dragged data can be accepted. Otherwise, dataTypes will be matched against the drag data types to determine if the data is acceptable.

attributes.name: dnd.drop.legend.drop
attributes.description: An optional callback function that receives the "drop" event and emtpy context information as arguments. This function should call event.preventDefault() to indicate the dragged data can be accepted.

attributes.name: dnd.drop.plot-area.data-types
attributes.description: An array of MIME data types this element can accept. This property is required unless dragEnter, dragOver, and drop callback functions are specified to handle the corresponding events.

attributes.name: dnd.drop.plot-area.drag-enter
attributes.description: An optional callback function that receives the "dragenter" event and context information as arguments. The context information is as follows: x {number}: The X axis value at the event position. y {number}: The Y axis value at the event position. y2 {number}: The Y2 axis value at the event position. This function should call event.preventDefault() to indicate the dragged data can be accepted. Otherwise, dataTypes will be matched against the drag data types to determine if the data is acceptable.

attributes.name: dnd.drop.plot-area.drag-leave

The context information is as follows: x {number}: The X axis value at the event position. y {number}: The Y axis value at the event position. y2 {number}: The Y2 axis value at the event position.

attributes.name: legend.background-color
attributes.description: The color of the legend background.

attributes.name: legend.border-color
attributes.description: The border color of the legend.

attributes.name: legend.max-size
attributes.description: Defines the maximum size of the legend in pixels (e.g. '50px') or percent (e.g. '15%').

attributes.name: legend.position
attributes.description: The position of the legend within the chart. By default, the legend will be placed on the side or bottom, based on the size of the chart and the legend contents.

attributes.name: legend.reference-object-section
attributes.description: An object with the following properties for the reference object section in the legend.

attributes.name: legend.rendered
attributes.description: Defines whether the legend is displayed. If set to auto, the legend will be hidden for charts with a large number of series. To ensure that the legend is always displayed, set this attribute to 'on'. To turn on legend for stock, funnel and pyramid charts, set the displayInLegend property for the series items to 'on'.

attributes.name: legend.scrolling
attributes.description: Defines whether scrolling is enabled for the legend.

attributes.name: legend.sections
attributes.description: An array of objects with the following properties defining the additional legend sections, other than the default series and reference object sections.

attributes.name: legend.series-section
attributes.description: An object with the following properties for the series section in the legend.

attributes.name: legend.size
attributes.description: Defines the size of the legend in pixels (e.g. '50px') or percent (e.g. '15%').

attributes.name: legend.symbol-height
attributes.description: The height of the legend symbol (line or marker) in pixels.

attributes.name: legend.symbol-width
attributes.description: The width of the legend symbol (line or marker) in pixels.

attributes.name: legend.text-style
attributes.description: The CSS style object defining the style of the legend text.

attributes.name: legend.title
attributes.description: The legend title.

attributes.name: legend.title-halign
attributes.description: The horizontal alignment of the title.

attributes.name: legend.title-style
attributes.description: The CSS style object defining the style of the title.

attributes.name: legend.reference-object-section.title
attributes.description: The title of the reference object section.

attributes.name: legend.reference-object-section.title-halign
attributes.description: The horizontal alignment of the section title. If the section is collapsible or nested, only start alignment is supported.

attributes.name: legend.reference-object-section.title-style
attributes.description: The CSS style object defining the style of the section title.

attributes.name: legend.series-section.title
attributes.description: The title of the series section.

attributes.name: legend.series-section.title-halign
attributes.description: The horizontal alignment of the section title. If the section is collapsible or nested, only start alignment is supported.

attributes.name: legend.series-section.title-style
attributes.description: The CSS style object defining the style of the section title.

attributes.name: overview.content
attributes.description: An object containing the property override for the overview chart. The API is the same as the chart property API, and the property provided here will be merged on top of the default property of the overview chart. This can be used to customize the style or the type of the overview chart.

attributes.name: overview.height
attributes.description: Specifies the height of the overview scrollbar in pixels (e.g. '50px') or percent (e.g. '15%').

attributes.name: overview.rendered
attributes.description: Specifies whether the overview scrollbar is rendered. If not, simple scrollbar will be used.

attributes.name: pie-center.converter
attributes.description: The converter (an object literal or instance that duck types oj.Converter) to format the label if it is numeric. When using a converter, scaling should be set to none, as the formatted result may not be compatible with the scaling suffixes.

attributes.name: pie-center.label
attributes.description: Specifies the text for the label. When a innerRadius is specified, the label will automatically be scaled to fit within the inner circle. If the innerRadius is 0, the default font size will be used.

attributes.name: pie-center.label-style
attributes.description: The CSS style object defining the style of the label.

attributes.name: pie-center.renderer
attributes.description:
A function that returns custom center content. The function takes a dataContext argument,
provided by the chart, with the following properties: insert: HTMLElement - An HTML element, which will be overlaid on top of the pie chart. This HTML element will block interactivity of the chart by default, but the CSS pointer-events property can be set to 'none' on this element if the chart's interactivity is desired.

attributes.name: pie-center.scaling
attributes.description: The scaling behavior of the label if it is numeric. When using a converter, scaling should be set to none, as the formatted result may not be compatible with the scaling suffixes.

attributes.name: pie-center.renderer.outer-bounds
attributes.description: Object containing (x, y, width, height) of the rectangle circumscribing the center area. The x and y coordinates are relative to the top, left corner of the element.

attributes.name: pie-center.renderer.inner-bounds
attributes.description: Object containing (x, y, width, height) of the rectangle inscribed in the center area. The x and y coordinates are relative to the top, left corner of the element. * @property {Object} labelStyle The CSS style object defining the style of the label.

attributes.name: pie-center.renderer.label
attributes.description: The pieCenter label.

attributes.name: pie-center.renderer.component-element
attributes.description: The chart element.

attributes.name: plot-area.background-color
attributes.description: The color of the plot area background.

attributes.name: plot-area.border-color
attributes.description: The border color to be set on the chart's plot area.

attributes.name: plot-area.border-width
attributes.description: The border width to be set on the chart's plot area.

attributes.name: plot-area.rendered
attributes.description: Specifies whether the plot area is rendered.

attributes.name: style-defaults.animation-down-color
attributes.description: The color of the indicator shown for a decreasing data change animation.

attributes.name: style-defaults.animation-duration
attributes.description: The duration of the animations, in milliseconds.

attributes.name: style-defaults.animation-indicators
attributes.description: Defines whether data change indicators are displayed during animation.

attributes.name: style-defaults.animation-up-color
attributes.description: The color of the indicator shown for an increasing data change animation.

attributes.name: style-defaults.bar-gap-ratio
attributes.description: Specifies the width of the bar group gap as a ratio of the group width. The valid value is a number from 0 to 1.

attributes.name: style-defaults.border-color
attributes.description: The default border color for the data items. For funnel and pyramid charts, it is used for the slice border.

attributes.name: style-defaults.border-width
attributes.description: The default border width for the data items. For funnel and pyramid charts, it is used for the slice border.

attributes.name: style-defaults.box-plot
attributes.description: An object containing the style properties of the box plot items.

attributes.name: style-defaults.colors
attributes.description: The array defining the default color ramp for the series.

attributes.name: style-defaults.data-cursor
attributes.description: An object defining the data cursor style.

attributes.name: style-defaults.data-item-gaps
attributes.description: Specifies the presence and size of the gaps between data items, such as bars, markers, and areas. Valid values are a percentage string from 0% to 100%, where 100% produces the maximum supported gaps.

attributes.name: style-defaults.data-label-position
attributes.description: The position of the data label. For range series, if an array of two values are provided, the first and second value will apply to the low and high point respectively. The 'outsideSlice' value only applies to pie charts. The 'aboveMarker', 'belowMarker', 'beforeMarker', and 'afterMarker' values only apply to line, area, scatter, and bubble series. The 'insideBarEdge' and 'outsideBarEdge' values only apply to non-polar bar series. Stacked bars do not support 'outsideBarEdge'. The chart does not currently adjust layout to fit labels within the plot area or deal with any overlaps between labels.

attributes.name: style-defaults.data-label-style
attributes.description: The CSS style object defining the style of the data label text. For range series, if an array of two values are provided, the first and second value will apply to the low and high point respectively.

attributes.name: style-defaults.funnel-background-color
attributes.description: The default background color of funnel slices that show actual/target values.

attributes.name: style-defaults.group-separators
attributes.description: An object defining the style for hierarchical label separators.

attributes.name: style-defaults.hover-behavior-delay
attributes.description: Specifies initial hover delay in ms for highlighting items in chart.

attributes.name: style-defaults.line-style
attributes.description: The line style of the data line. Only applies to line, lineWithArea, scatter, and bubble series.

attributes.name: style-defaults.line-type
attributes.description: The line type of the data line or area. Only applies to line, area, scatter, and bubble series. centeredStepped and centeredSegmented are not supported for polar, scatter, and bubble charts.

attributes.name: style-defaults.line-width
attributes.description: The width of the data line. Only applies to line, lineWithArea, scatter, and bubble series.

attributes.name: style-defaults.marker-color
attributes.description: The color of the data markers, if different from the series color.

attributes.name: style-defaults.marker-displayed
attributes.description: Defines whether the data markers should be displayed. Only applies to line, area, scatter, and bubble series. If auto, the markers will be displayed whenever the data points are not connected by a line.

attributes.name: style-defaults.marker-shape
attributes.description: The shape of the data markers. In addition to the built-in shapes, it may also take SVG path commands to specify a custom shape. The chart will style the custom shapes the same way as built-in shapes, supporting properties like color and borderColor and applying hover and selection effects. Only 'auto' is supported for range series.

attributes.name: style-defaults.marker-size
attributes.description: The size of the data markers in pixels.

attributes.name: style-defaults.marquee-border-color
attributes.description: The border color of the marquee. Applies to marquee selection and marquee zoom.

attributes.name: style-defaults.marquee-color
attributes.description: The fill color of the marquee. Applies to marquee selection and marquee zoom.

attributes.name: style-defaults.max-bar-width
attributes.description: Specifies the maximum width of each bar in pixels.

attributes.name: style-defaults.other-color
attributes.description: Specifies the color of the "Other" slice. Only applies to pie chart.

attributes.name: style-defaults.patterns
attributes.description: The array defining the default pattern ramp for the series. This is used only when seriesEffect is 'pattern'.

attributes.name: style-defaults.pie-feeler-color
attributes.description: The color of the line extending from the pie slice to the slice label.

attributes.name: style-defaults.pie-inner-radius
attributes.description: Specifies the radius of the inner circle that can be used to create a donut chart. Valid values range from 0 (default) to 1. Not supported if 3D effect is on.

attributes.name: style-defaults.selection-effect
attributes.description: The selection effect that is applied to selected items. The values explode and highlightAndExplode only apply to pie charts.

attributes.name: style-defaults.series-effect
attributes.description: Defines the fill effect for the data items.

attributes.name: style-defaults.shapes
attributes.description: The array defining the default shape ramp for the series. Valid values are defined in the markerShape attribute.

attributes.name: style-defaults.stack-label-style
attributes.description: The CSS style object defining the style of the stack label. Only applies to stacked bar charts.

attributes.name: style-defaults.stock-falling-color
attributes.description: In stock charts, the color of the candlestick when the 'open' value is greater than the 'close' value.

attributes.name: style-defaults.stock-range-color
attributes.description: In stock charts, the color of the range bars for candlestick.

attributes.name: style-defaults.stock-rising-color
attributes.description: In stock charts, the color of the candlestick when the 'close' value is greater than the 'open' value.

attributes.name: style-defaults.stock-volume-color
attributes.description: In stock charts, the color of the volume bars. If specified, overrides the default rising and falling colors used by the volume bars.

attributes.name: style-defaults.three-deffect
attributes.description: Defines whether the chart is displayed with a 3D effect. Only applies to pie, funnel and pyramid charts.

attributes.name: style-defaults.tooltip-label-style
attributes.description: The CSS style object defining the style of the labels in the tooltip.

attributes.name: style-defaults.tooltip-value-style
attributes.description: The CSS style object defining the style of the values in the tooltip.

attributes.name: style-defaults.box-plot.median-svg-class-name
attributes.description: The CSS style class to apply to the median line.

attributes.name: style-defaults.box-plot.median-svg-style
attributes.description: The CSS inline style to apply to the median line.

attributes.name: style-defaults.box-plot.whisker-end-length
attributes.description: Specifies the length of the whisker ends in pixels (e.g. '9px') or as a percentage of the box width (e.g. '50%').

attributes.name: style-defaults.box-plot.whisker-end-svg-class-name
attributes.description: The CSS style class to apply to the whisker ends.

attributes.name: style-defaults.box-plot.whisker-end-svg-style
attributes.description: The CSS inline style to apply to the whisker ends.

attributes.name: style-defaults.box-plot.whisker-svg-class-name
attributes.description: The CSS style class to apply to the whisker stems.

attributes.name: style-defaults.box-plot.whisker-svg-style
attributes.description: The CSS inline style to apply to the whisker stems.

attributes.name: style-defaults.data-cursor.line-color
attributes.description: The color of the data cursor line.

attributes.name: style-defaults.data-cursor.line-style
attributes.description: The line style of the data cursor line.

attributes.name: style-defaults.data-cursor.line-width
attributes.description: The width of the data cursor line in pixels.

attributes.name: style-defaults.data-cursor.marker-color
attributes.description: The color of the data cursor marker. Defaults to the data series color.

attributes.name: style-defaults.data-cursor.marker-displayed
attributes.description: Whether the data cursor marker is displayed. Marker should only be hidden if the data cursor is displaying information for the entire group.

attributes.name: style-defaults.data-cursor.marker-size
attributes.description: The size of the data cursor marker in pixels.

attributes.name: style-defaults.group-separators.color
attributes.description: The color of the separators lines.

attributes.name: style-defaults.group-separators.rendered
attributes.description: Defines whether the group separators are displayed.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer
attributes.description:
A function that returns a custom tooltip for chart. The function takes a dataContext argument
provided by the chart with the following properties: insert: HTMLElement | string - An HTML element, which will be appended to the tooltip, or a tooltip string. preventDefault: true - Indicates that the tooltip should not be displayed. It is not necessary to return {preventDefault:false} to display tooltip, since this is a default behavior.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.parent-element
attributes.description: The tooltip element. This can be used to change the tooltip border or background color.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.id
attributes.description: The id of the hovered item.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.series
attributes.description: The id of the series the hovered item belongs to.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.group
attributes.description: The ids or an array of ids of the group(s) the hovered item belongs to. For hierarchical groups, it will be an array of outermost to innermost group ids.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.label
attributes.description: The data label of the hovered item.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.value
attributes.description: The values of the hovered item.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.x
attributes.description: The values of the hovered item.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.y
attributes.description: The values of the hovered item.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.z
attributes.description: The values of the hovered item.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.low
attributes.description: The values of the hovered item.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.high
attributes.description: The values of the hovered item.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.open
attributes.description: The values of the hovered item.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.close
attributes.description: The values of the hovered item.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.volume
attributes.description: The values of the hovered item.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.target-value
attributes.description: The values of the hovered item.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.data
attributes.description: The data object of the hovered item. For nested items, it will be an array containing the parent item data and nested item data.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.item-data
attributes.description: The row data object for the hovered item. This will only be set if a DataProvider is being used.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.series-data
attributes.description: The data for the series the hovered item belongs to.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.group-data
attributes.description: An array of data for the group the hovered item belongs to. For hierarchical groups, it will be an array of outermost to innermost group data related to the hovered item.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.component-element
attributes.description: The chart element.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.color
attributes.description: The color of the hovered item.

Used to describe the data visualization type for accessibility.

attributes.name: translations.label-no-data

attributes.name: x-axis.axis-line
attributes.description: An object defining properties for the axis line.

attributes.name: x-axis.baseline-scaling
attributes.description: Defines whether the axis baseline starts at the minimum value of the data or at zero. Only applies to numerical data axes.

attributes.name: x-axis.data-max
attributes.description: The maximum data value corresponding to an axis. If specified, the automatic axis extent calculation will use this value. Only applies to numerical axes.

attributes.name: x-axis.data-min
attributes.description: The minimum data value corresponding to an axis. If specified, the automatic axis extent calculation will use this value. Only applies to numerical axes.

attributes.name: x-axis.major-tick
attributes.description: An object defining properties for the major tick marks.

attributes.name: x-axis.max
attributes.description: The maximum value of the axis. Defaults to null for automatic calculation based on the data. For categorical axes, the value represents the group index. For example, 0 is the position of the first group, and 1.5 is the position half way between the second and the third group.

attributes.name: x-axis.max-size
attributes.description: Defines the maximum size of the axis in pixels (e.g. '50px') or percent (e.g. '15%').

attributes.name: x-axis.min
attributes.description: The minimum value of the axis. Defaults to null for automatic calculation based on the data. For categorical axes, the value represents the group index. For example, 0 is the position of the first group, and 1.5 is the position half way between the second and the third group.

attributes.name: x-axis.min-step
attributes.description: The minimum increment between major tick marks. This is typically used to prevent fractional axis values for discrete measures. Only applies to numerical axes.

attributes.name: x-axis.minor-step
attributes.description: The increment between minor tick marks. Defaults to null for automatic calculation based on the data. Only applies to numerical axes. For log axis, the step is a multiplier, so for example, if the minorStep is 2, the minor tick marks will be rendered at 1, 2, 4, 8, and so on.

attributes.name: x-axis.minor-tick
attributes.description: An object defining properties for the minor tick marks.

attributes.name: x-axis.reference-objects
attributes.description: The array of reference objects associated with the axis.

attributes.name: x-axis.rendered
attributes.description: Defines whether the axis is rendered.

attributes.name: x-axis.scale
attributes.description: Defines the axis scale. Only applies to numerical axes.

attributes.name: x-axis.size
attributes.description: Defines the size of the axis in pixels (e.g. '50px') or percent (e.g. '15%').

attributes.name: x-axis.step
attributes.description: The increment between major tick marks. Defaults to null for automatic calculation based on the data. Only applies to time and numerical axes. For log axis, the step is a multiplier, so for example, if the step is 2, the major tick marks will be rendered at 1, 2, 4, 8, and so on.

attributes.name: x-axis.tick-label
attributes.description: An object defining the properties of the tick labels.

attributes.name: x-axis.title
attributes.description: The axis title. Does not apply to polar charts.

attributes.name: x-axis.title-style
attributes.description: The CSS style object defining the style of the axis title. The CSS white-space property can be defined with value "nowrap" to disable default text wrapping of the title.

attributes.name: x-axis.viewport-end-group
attributes.description: Specifies the end group of the current viewport. Only applies to charts with group or time axis. If not specified, the default end group is the last group in the data set.

attributes.name: x-axis.viewport-max
attributes.description: Specifies the maximum x coordinate of the current viewport for zoom and scroll. For group axis, the group index will be treated as the axis coordinate. If both viewportEndGroup and viewportMax are specified, then viewportMax takes precedence. If not specified, this value will be the axis max.

attributes.name: x-axis.viewport-min
attributes.description: Specifies the minimum x coordinate of the current viewport for zoom and scroll. For group axis, the group index will be treated as the axis coordinate. If both viewportStartGroup and viewportMin are specified, then viewportMin takes precedence. If not specified, this value will be the axis min.

attributes.name: x-axis.viewport-start-group
attributes.description: Specifies the start group of the current viewport. Only applies to charts with group or time axis. If not specified, the default start group is the first group in the data set.

attributes.name: x-axis.axis-line.line-color
attributes.description: The color of the axis line.

attributes.name: x-axis.axis-line.line-width
attributes.description: The width of the axis line.

attributes.name: x-axis.axis-line.rendered
attributes.description: Defines whether the axis line is rendered.

attributes.name: x-axis.major-tick.baseline-color
attributes.description: The color of the major tick mark at the baseline (x = 0). Valid values are auto, inherit, or a custom color. If set to inherit, it will follow the lineColor attribute.

attributes.name: x-axis.major-tick.baseline-style
attributes.description: The line style of the major tick mark at the baseline (x = 0). If not specified, it will follow the lineStyle attribute.

attributes.name: x-axis.major-tick.baseline-width
attributes.description: The width of the major tick mark at the baseline (x = 0) If not specified, it will follow the lineWidth attribute.

attributes.name: x-axis.major-tick.line-color
attributes.description: The color of the major tick marks.

attributes.name: x-axis.major-tick.line-style
attributes.description: The line style of the major tick marks.

attributes.name: x-axis.major-tick.line-width
attributes.description: The width of the major tick marks.

attributes.name: x-axis.major-tick.rendered
attributes.description: Defines whether the major tick marks are rendered.

attributes.name: x-axis.minor-tick.line-color
attributes.description: The color of the minor tick marks.

attributes.name: x-axis.minor-tick.line-style
attributes.description: The line style of the minor tick marks.

attributes.name: x-axis.minor-tick.line-width
attributes.description: The width of the minor tick marks.

attributes.name: x-axis.minor-tick.rendered
attributes.description: Defines whether the minor tick marks are rendered.

attributes.name: x-axis.tick-label.converter
attributes.description: The converter (an object literal or instance that duck types oj.Converter) to format the labels. When using a time axis, this attribute also takes an array of two converters, which apply respectively to the first and second label levels. When using a converter, scaling should be set to none, as the formatted result may not be compatible with the scaling suffixes.

attributes.name: x-axis.tick-label.rendered
attributes.description: Defines whether the tick labels are rendered.

attributes.name: x-axis.tick-label.rotation
attributes.description: Defines whether the chart will automatically rotate the labels by 90 degrees in order to fit more labels on the axis. The rotation will only be applied to categorical labels for a horizontal axis.

attributes.name: x-axis.tick-label.scaling
attributes.description: The scaling behavior of the labels. When using a converter, scaling should be set to none, as the formatted result may not be compatible with the scaling suffixes.

attributes.name: x-axis.tick-label.style
attributes.description: The CSS style object defining the style of the labels. The CSS white-space property can be defined with value "nowrap" to disable default text wrapping of categorical labels.

attributes.name: y2-axis.align-tick-marks
attributes.description: Defines whether the tick marks of the y1 and y2 axes are aligned. Not supported for logarithmic axes.

attributes.name: y-axis.viewport-max
attributes.description: Specifies the maximum y coordinate of the current viewport for zoom and scroll. Only applies to bubble and scatter charts. If not specified, this value will be the axis max.

attributes.name: y-axis.viewport-min
attributes.description: Specifies the minimum y coordinate of the current viewport for zoom and scroll. Only applies to bubble and scatter charts. If not specified, this value will be the axis min.

attributes.name: y-axis.axis-line.line-color
attributes.description: The color of the axis line.

attributes.name: y-axis.axis-line.line-width
attributes.description: The width of the axis line.

attributes.name: y-axis.axis-line.rendered
attributes.description: Defines whether the axis line is rendered.

attributes.name: y-axis.major-tick.baseline-color
attributes.description: The color of the major tick mark at the baseline (y = 0). Valid values are auto, inherit, or a custom color. If set to inherit, it will follow the lineColor attribute.

attributes.name: y-axis.major-tick.baseline-style
attributes.description: The line style of the major tick mark at the baseline (y = 0). If not specified, it will follow the lineStyle attribute.

attributes.name: y-axis.major-tick.baseline-width
attributes.description: The width of the major tick mark at the baseline (y = 0) If not specified, it will follow the lineWidth attribute.

attributes.name: y-axis.major-tick.line-color
attributes.description: The color of the major tick marks.

attributes.name: y-axis.major-tick.line-style
attributes.description: The line style of the major tick marks.

attributes.name: y-axis.major-tick.line-width
attributes.description: The width of the major tick marks.

attributes.name: y-axis.major-tick.rendered
attributes.description: Defines whether the major tick marks are rendered.

attributes.name: y-axis.minor-tick.line-color
attributes.description: The color of the minor tick marks.

attributes.name: y-axis.minor-tick.line-style
attributes.description: The line style of the minor tick marks.

attributes.name: y-axis.minor-tick.line-width
attributes.description: The width of the minor tick marks.

attributes.name: y-axis.minor-tick.rendered
attributes.description: Defines whether the minor tick marks are rendered.

attributes.name: y-axis.tick-label.converter
attributes.description: The converter (an object literal or instance that duck types oj.Converter) to format the labels. When using a converter, scaling should be set to none, as the formatted result may not be compatible with the scaling suffixes.

attributes.name: y-axis.tick-label.position
attributes.description: Defines the position of the tick labels relative to the plot area. Inside position is not supported for scatter and bubble charts.

attributes.name: y-axis.tick-label.rendered
attributes.description: Defines whether the tick labels are rendered.

attributes.name: y-axis.tick-label.scaling
attributes.description: The scaling behavior of the labels. When using a converter, scaling should be set to none, as the formatted result may not be compatible with the scaling suffixes.

attributes.name: y-axis.tick-label.style
attributes.description: The CSS style object defining the style of the labels.

attributes.name: on-oj-select-input
attributes.description: Triggered during a selection gesture, such as a change in the marquee selection rectangle.

attributes.name: on-oj-viewport-change
attributes.description: Triggered after the viewport is changed due to a zoom or scroll operation.

attributes.name: on-oj-viewport-change-input
attributes.description:
Triggered during a viewport change gesture, such as a drag operation on the overview window. Note: There are
situations where the chart cannot determine whether the viewport change gesture is still in progress, such
as with mouse wheel zoom interactions. Standard viewportChange events are fired in these cases.

attributes.name: on-oj-drill
attributes.description: Triggered during a drill gesture (double click if selection is enabled, single click otherwise).

tags.name: oj-chart
tags.description: Displays information graphically, making relationships among the data easier to understand.

attributes.name: drilling
attributes.description: Whether drilling is enabled on the group label. Drillable objects will show a pointer cursor on hover and fire an ojDrill event on click. To enable drilling for all group labels at once, use the drilling attribute in the top level.

attributes.name: label-style
attributes.description: The CSS style object defining the style of the group label text. Supports color, fontFamily, fontSize, fontStyle, fontWeight, textDecoration, cursor, backgroundColor, borderColor, borderRadius, and borderWidth properties. Only applies to a categorical axis.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the group.

attributes.name: short-desc
attributes.description: The description of the group. This is used for customizing the tooltip text and only applies to a categorical axis.

attributes.name: on-drilling-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'drilling' attribute

attributes.name: on-label-style-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'labelStyle' attribute

attributes.name: on-name-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'name' attribute

attributes.name: on-short-desc-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'shortDesc' attribute

tags.name: oj-chart-group
tags.description: ojChartGroup

attributes.name: border-color
attributes.description: The border color of the data item. For funnel and pyramid charts, it is used for the slice border.

attributes.name: border-width
attributes.description: The border width of the data item. For funnel and pyramid charts, it is used for the slice border.

attributes.name: box-plot
attributes.description: An object containing the style properties of the box plot item.

attributes.name: categories
attributes.description: An optional array of category strings corresponding to this data item. This enables highlighting and filtering of individual data items through interactions with the legend or other visualization elements. If not defined, series categories are used.

attributes.name: close
attributes.description: The close value for stock candlestick. When bar, line, or area series type are used on a stock chart, this value is displayed.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description: The color of the data item.

attributes.name: drilling
attributes.description: Whether drilling is enabled for the data item. Drillable objects will show a pointer cursor on hover and fire an ojDrill event on click (double click if selection is enabled). To enable drilling for all data items at once, use the drilling attribute in the top level.

attributes.name: group-id
attributes.description: The array of id(s) for the group(s) the item belongs to. For hierarchical groups, it will be an array of outermost to innermost group ids.

attributes.name: high
attributes.description: The high value for range bar/area, stock candlestick, or box plot item. Define 'low' and 'high' instead of 'value' or 'y' to create a range bar/area chart.

attributes.name: items
attributes.description: An array of nested data items to be used for defining the markers for outliers or additional data items of a box plot.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The label for the data item. For range series, if an array of two values are provided, the first and second value will apply to the low and high point respectively. Not supported for box plot or candlestick.

attributes.name: label-position
attributes.description: The position of the data label. For range series, if an array of two values are provided, the first and second value will apply to the low and high point respectively. The 'outsideSlice' value only applies to pie charts. The 'aboveMarker', 'belowMarker', 'beforeMarker', and 'afterMarker' values only apply to line, area, scatter, and bubble series. The 'insideBarEdge' and 'outsideBarEdge' values only apply to non-polar bar series. Stacked bars do not support 'outsideBarEdge'. The chart does not currently adjust layout to fit labels within the plot area or deal with any overlaps between labels.

attributes.name: label-style
attributes.description: The CSS style object defining the style of the data label. For range series, if an array of two values are provided, the first and second value will apply to the low and high point respectively.

attributes.name: low
attributes.description: The low value for range bar/area, stock candlestick, or box plot item. Define 'low' and 'high' instead of 'value' or 'y' to create a range bar/area chart.

attributes.name: marker-displayed
attributes.description: Defines whether the data marker is displayed. Only applies to line, area, scatter, and bubble series. If auto, the markers will be displayed whenever the data points are not connected by a line.

attributes.name: marker-shape
attributes.description: The shape of the data markers. In addition to the built-in shapes, it may also take SVG path commands to specify a custom shape. The chart will style the custom shapes the same way as built-in shapes, supporting properties like color and borderColor and applying hover and selection effects. Only 'auto' is supported for range series.

attributes.name: marker-size
attributes.description: The size of the data markers. Does not apply to bubble charts, which calculate marker size based on the z values.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: The open value for stock candlestick.

attributes.name: pattern
attributes.description: The pattern used to fill the data item. A solid fill is used by default, unless the seriesEffect is 'pattern'.

attributes.name: q1
attributes.description: The first quartile value for box plot.

attributes.name: q2
attributes.description: The second quartile (median) value for box plot.

attributes.name: q3
attributes.description: The third quartile value for box plot.

attributes.name: series-id
attributes.description: The id for the series the item belongs to.

attributes.name: short-desc
attributes.description: The description of this object. This is used for accessibility and also for customizing the tooltip text.

attributes.name: source
attributes.description: The URI of the custom image. If specified, it takes precedence over shape.

attributes.name: source-hover
attributes.description: The optional URI for the hover state. If not specified, the source image will be used.

attributes.name: source-hover-selected
attributes.description: The optional URI for the hover selected state. If not specified, the source image will be used.

attributes.name: source-selected
attributes.description: The optional URI for the selected state. If not specified, the source image will be used.

attributes.name: svg-class-name
attributes.description: The CSS style class to apply to the data item. The style class and inline style will override any other styling specified through the properties. For tooltips and hover interactivity, it's recommended to also pass a representative color to the item color attribute.

attributes.name: svg-style
attributes.description: The inline style to apply to the data item. The style class and inline style will override any other styling specified through the properties. For tooltips and hover interactivity, it's recommended to also pass a representative color to the item color attribute.

attributes.name: target-value
attributes.description: The target value for a funnel chart. When this is set, the value attribute defines the filled area within the slice and this represents the value of the whole slice.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value for this data item. Corresponding to the y value for bar, line, area, and combo charts and the slice values for pie, funnel and pyramid charts. Null can be specified to skip a data point.

attributes.name: volume
attributes.description: The value for stock volume bar. When this value is provided, the volume bar is displayed on the y2 axis.

attributes.name: x
attributes.description: The x value. Mainly used for scatter and bubble chart and to specify the date for mixed-frequency time axis. For categorical axis, if the x value is not specified, it will default to the item index. For regular time axis, if the x value is not specified, it will default to the group name of the item.

attributes.name: y
attributes.description: The y value. Also the primary value for charts without a y-Axis, such as pie charts.

attributes.name: z
attributes.description: The z value. Defines the bubble radius for a bubble chart, as well as the width of a bar or a box plot item.

attributes.name: box-plot.median-svg-class-name
attributes.description: The CSS style class to apply to the median line.

attributes.name: box-plot.median-svg-style
attributes.description: The CSS inline style to apply to the median line.

attributes.name: box-plot.q2-color
attributes.description: The color of the Q2 segment of the box.

attributes.name: box-plot.q2-svg-class-name
attributes.description: The CSS style class to apply to the Q2 segment of the box. The style class and inline style will override any other styling specified through the properties. For tooltips and hover interactivity, it's recommended to also pass a representative color to the q2Color attribute.

attributes.name: box-plot.q2-svg-style
attributes.description: The CSS inline style to apply to the Q2 segment of the box. The style class and inline style will override any other styling specified through the properties. For tooltips and hover interactivity, it's recommended to also pass a representative color to the q2Color attribute.

attributes.name: box-plot.q3-svg-class-name
attributes.description: The CSS style class to apply to the Q3 segment of the box. The style class and inline style will override any other styling specified through the properties. For tooltips and hover interactivity, it's recommended to also pass a representative color to the q3Color attribute.

attributes.name: box-plot.q3-svg-style
attributes.description: The CSS inline style to apply to the Q3 segment of the box. The style class and inline style will override any other styling specified through the properties. For tooltips and hover interactivity, it's recommended to also pass a representative color to the q3Color attribute.

attributes.name: box-plot.whisker-end-length
attributes.description: Specifies the length of the whisker ends in pixels (e.g. '9px') or as a percentage of the box width (e.g. '50%'). The specified length will be rounded down to an odd number of pixels to ensure symmetry.

attributes.name: box-plot.whisker-end-svg-class-name
attributes.description: The CSS style class to apply to the whisker ends.

attributes.name: box-plot.whisker-end-svg-style
attributes.description: The CSS inline style to apply to the whisker ends.

attributes.name: box-plot.whisker-svg-class-name
attributes.description: The CSS style class to apply to the whisker stems.

attributes.name: box-plot.whisker-svg-style
attributes.description: The CSS inline style to apply to the whisker stems.
