tags.name: oj-chart-item
tags.description: ojChartItem

attributes.name: area-color
attributes.description: The area color of the series. Only applies if series type is area or lineWithArea.

attributes.name: area-svg-class-name
attributes.description: The CSS style class to apply if series type is area or lineWithArea. The style class and inline style will override any other styling specified through the properties. For tooltips and hover interactivity, it's recommended to also pass a representative color to the color attribute.

attributes.name: area-svg-style
attributes.description: The inline style to apply if series type is area or lineWithArea. The style class and inline style will override any other styling specified through the properties. For tooltips and hover interactivity, it's recommended to also pass a representative color to the color attribute.

attributes.name: assigned-to-y2
attributes.description: Defines whether the series is associated with the y2 axis. Only applies to Cartesian bar, line, area, and combo charts.

attributes.name: border-color
attributes.description: The border color of the series.

attributes.name: border-width
attributes.description: The border width of the series.

attributes.name: box-plot
attributes.description: An object containing the style properties of the box plot series.

attributes.name: categories
attributes.description: An optional array of category strings corresponding to this series. This allows highlighting and filtering of a series through interactions with legend sections. If not defined, the series id is used.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description: The color of the series.

attributes.name: display-in-legend
attributes.description: Defines whether the series should be shown in the legend. When set to 'auto', the series will not be displayed in the legend if it has null data or if it is a stock, funnel, or pyramid series.

attributes.name: drilling
attributes.description: Whether drilling is enabled on the series item. Drillable objects will show a pointer cursor on hover and fire an ojDrill event on click. To enable drilling for all series items at once, use the drilling attribute in the top level.

attributes.name: line-style
attributes.description: The line style of the data line. Only applies to line, lineWithArea, scatter, and bubble series.

attributes.name: line-type
attributes.description: The line type of the data line or area. Only applies to line, area, scatter, and bubble series. centeredStepped and centeredSegmented are not supported for polar, scatter, and bubble charts.

attributes.name: line-width
attributes.description: The width of the data line. Only applies to line, lineWithArea, scatter, and bubble series.

attributes.name: marker-color
attributes.description: The color of the data markers, if different from the series color.

attributes.name: marker-displayed
attributes.description: Defines whether the data markers should be displayed. Only applies to line, area, scatter, and bubble series. If auto, the markers will be displayed whenever the data points are not connected by a line.

attributes.name: marker-shape
attributes.description: The shape of the data markers. In addition to the built-in shapes, it may also take SVG path commands to specify a custom shape. The chart will style the custom shapes the same way as built-in shapes, supporting properties like color and borderColor and applying hover and selection effects. Only 'auto' is supported for range series.

attributes.name: marker-size
attributes.description: The size of the data markers.

attributes.name: marker-svg-class-name
attributes.description: The CSS style class to apply to the data markers.The style class and inline style will override any other styling specified through the properties. For tooltips and hover interactivity, it's recommended to also pass a representative color to the marker color attribute.

attributes.name: marker-svg-style
attributes.description: The inline style to apply to the data markers. The style class and inline style will override any other styling specified through the properties. For tooltips and hover interactivity, it's recommended to also pass a representative color to the marker color attribute.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the series, displayed in the legend and tooltips.

attributes.name: pattern
attributes.description: The pattern used to fill the series. A solid fill is used by default, unless the seriesEffect is 'pattern'.

attributes.name: pie-slice-explode
attributes.description: A number from 0 to 1 indicating the amount to explode the pie slice. Only applies to pie charts.

attributes.name: short-desc
attributes.description: The description of this series. This is used for accessibility and for customizing the tooltip text on the corressponding legend item for the series.

attributes.name: source
attributes.description: The URI of the custom image. If specified, it takes precedence over shape.

attributes.name: source-hover
attributes.description: The optional URI for the hover state. If not specified, the source image will be used.

attributes.name: source-hover-selected
attributes.description: The optional URI for the hover selected state. If not specified, the source image will be used.

attributes.name: source-selected
attributes.description: The optional URI for the selected state. If not specified, the source image will be used.

attributes.name: stack-category
attributes.description: In stacked charts, groups series together for stacking. All series without a stackCategory will be assigned to the same stack.

attributes.name: svg-class-name
attributes.description: The CSS style class to apply to the series. For series of type lineWithArea, this style will only be applied to the line if areaClassName is also specified. The style class and inline style will override any other styling specified through the properties. For tooltips and hover interactivity, it's recommended to also pass a representative color to the color attribute.

attributes.name: svg-style
attributes.description: The inline style to apply to the series. For series of type lineWithArea, this style will only be applied to the line if areaStyle is also specified.The style class and inline style will override any other styling specified through the properties. For tooltips and hover interactivity, it's recommended to also pass a representative color to the color attribute.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The type of data objects to display for this series. Only applies to bar, line, area, stock, box plot, and combo charts.

attributes.name: box-plot.median-svg-class-name
attributes.description: The CSS style class to apply to the median line.

attributes.name: box-plot.median-svg-style
attributes.description: The CSS inline style to apply to the median line.

attributes.name: box-plot.q2-color
attributes.description: The color of the Q2 segment of the box.

attributes.name: box-plot.q2-svg-class-name
attributes.description: The CSS style class to apply to the Q2 segment of the box. The style class and inline style will override any other styling specified through the properties. For tooltips and hover interactivity, it's recommended to also pass a representative color to the q2Color attribute.

attributes.name: box-plot.q2-svg-style
attributes.description: The CSS inline style to apply to the Q2 segment of the box. The style class and inline style will override any other styling specified through the properties. For tooltips and hover interactivity, it's recommended to also pass a representative color to the q2Color attribute.

attributes.name: box-plot.q3-color
attributes.description: The color of the Q3 segment of the box.

attributes.name: box-plot.q3-svg-class-name
attributes.description: The CSS style class to apply to the Q3 segment of the box. The style class and inline style will override any other styling specified through the properties. For tooltips and hover interactivity, it's recommended to also pass a representative color to the q3Color attribute.

attributes.name: box-plot.q3-svg-style
attributes.description: The CSS inline style to apply to the Q3 segment of the box. The style class and inline style will override any other styling specified through the properties. attributes.description:
Form component help information.

The properties supported on the help option are:

attributes.name: help-hints
attributes.description: Represents hints for an oj-form-layout element to render help information on the label of the editable component.

attributes.name: label-hint
attributes.description: Represents a hint for oj-form-layout element to render a label on the editable component.

attributes.name: labelled-by
attributes.description: labelled-by is used to establish a relationship between this component and another element. A common use is to tie the oj-label and the oj-checkboxset together. The oj-label custom element has an id, and you use the labelled-by attribute to tie the two components together.

attributes.name: messages-custom
attributes.description: List of messages an app would add to the component

attributes.name: option-renderer
attributes.description: The renderer function that renders the content of each option.

attributes.name: options
attributes.description: The option items for the Checkboxset.

attributes.name: options-keys
attributes.description: Specify the key names to use in the options array. Depending on options-keys means that the signature of the data does not match what is supported by the options attribute.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: Whether the component is readonly. The readOnly property sets or returns whether an element is readOnly, or not. A readOnly element cannot be modified. However, a user can tab to it, highlight it, focus on it, and copy the text from it. If you want to prevent the user from interacting with the element, use the disabled property instead.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Whether the component is required or optional. When required is set to true, an implicit required validator is created using the validator factory - oj.Validation.validatorFactory(oj.ValidatorFactory.VALIDATOR_TYPE_REQUIRED).createValidator(). Translations specified using the translations.required attribute and the label associated with the component, are passed through to the options parameter of the createValidator method. When required property changes due to programmatic intervention, the component may clears message and run validation, based on the current state it's in. Running Validation if component is valid when required is set to true, then it runs deferred validation on the value property. This is to ensure errors are not flagged unnecessarily. if component is invalid and has deferred messages when required is set to false, then component messages are cleared but no deferred validation is run. if component is invalid and currently showing invalid messages when required is set, then component messages are cleared and normal validation is run using the current display value. if there are validation errors, then value property is not updated and the error is shown. if no errors result from the validation, the value property is updated; page author can listen to the onValueChanged event to clear custom errors. Clearing Messages Only messages created by the component are cleared. messagesCustom property is not cleared. This property set to false implies that a value is not required to be provided by the user. This is the default. This property set to true implies that a value is required to be provided by user and the input's label will render a required icon. Additionally a required validator - RequiredValidator - is implicitly used if no explicit required validator is set. An explicit required validator can be set by page authors using the validators option. when the option is not set, the element's required property is used as its initial value if it exists.

attributes.name: translations
attributes.description: A collection of translated resources from the translation bundle, or null if this component has no resources.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: The validity state of the component

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of the component. When value property changes due to programmatic intervention, the component always clears all messages and runs deferred validation, and always refreshes UI display value. When the option is not set, value is set to an array built from the checked checkboxes, if any are checked. Clearing Messages All messages are cleared. This includes the messagesCustom property. Running Validation component always runs deferred validation

tags.name: oj-combobox-many
tags.description: A dropdown list that supports multiple selections, text input, and search filtering.

attributes.name: async-validators
attributes.description: Specifies a list of async validators for performing async validation by the element.

attributes.name: converter
attributes.description: An object to convert value.

attributes.name: described-by
attributes.description: described the relationship between this component and another element.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the component is disabled. The default is false.

attributes.name: display-options
attributes.description: Customize how to display to the user the form field's messages, converter and validator hints and help instruction text.

attributes.name: filter-on-open
attributes.description: Whether to filter the drop down list on open.

attributes.name: help
attributes.description:
Form component help information.

The properties supported on the help option are:

attributes.name: help-hints
attributes.description: Represents hints for an oj-form-layout element to render help information on the label of the editable component.

attributes.name: label-hint
attributes.description: Represents a hint for oj-form-layout element to render a label on the editable component.

attributes.name: messages-custom
attributes.description: List of messages an app would add to the component

attributes.name: min-length
attributes.description: The minimum number of characters a user must type before search filtering is performed.

attributes.name: option-renderer
attributes.description: The renderer function that renders the content of each option.

attributes.name: options
attributes.description: The option items for the Combobox.

attributes.name: options-keys
attributes.description: Specify the key names to use in the options array. Depending on options-keys means that the signature of the data does not match what is supported by the options attribute.

attributes.name: picker-attributes
attributes.description: The style attributes for the drop down.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: A short hint that can be displayed before user selects or enters a value.

attributes.name: raw-value
attributes.description: The currently displayed text retrieved from the input field.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: Specifies whether a value is readonly

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Specifies whether a value is required.

attributes.name: translations
attributes.description: A collection of translated resources from the translation bundle, or null if this component has no resources.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: The validity state of the component

attributes.name: validators
attributes.description: Specifies a list of validators for performing validation by the element.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of the element.

attributes.name: value-option
attributes.description: The current value of the element and its associated display label.

attributes.name: converter.type
attributes.description: the conveter type registered with the oj.ConverterFactory. Supported types are 'number' and 'datetime'. See ConverterFactory for details. E.g., {converter: {type: 'number'}

attributes.name: converter.options
attributes.description: optional Object literal of options that the converter expects. See IntlNumberConverter for options supported by the number converter. E.g., {converter: {type: 'number', options: {style: 'decimal'}}

attributes.name: display-options.converter-hint
attributes.description: Display options for auxilliary converter hint text that determines where it should be displayed in relation to the component.

attributes.name: display-options.help-instruction
attributes.description:
Display options for auxilliary help instruction text that determines where it should be displayed
in relation to the component.

attributes.name: display-options.messages
attributes.description:
Display options for auxilliary message text that determines where it should be displayed
in relation to the component.

attributes.name: display-options.validator-hint
attributes.description:
Display options for auxilliary validator hint text that determines where it should be displayed
in relation to the component.

attributes.name: help.instruction
attributes.description:
this represents advisory information for the component
The default value is "".

attributes.name: help-hints.definition
attributes.description: Hint for help definition text associated with the label.

attributes.name: help-hints.source
attributes.description: Hint for help source URL associated with the label.

attributes.name: option-renderer.component
attributes.description: A reference to the combobox element.

attributes.name: option-renderer.parent
attributes.description: The parent of the data item. The parent is null for root node.

attributes.name: option-renderer.index
attributes.description: The index of the option, where 0 is the index of the first option. In the hierarchical case the index is relative to its parent.

attributes.name: option-renderer.depth
attributes.description: The depth of the option. The depth of the first level children under the invisible root is 0.

attributes.name: option-renderer.leaf
attributes.description: Whether the option is a leaf or a group.

attributes.name: option-renderer.data
attributes.description: The data object for the option.

attributes.name: option-renderer.parent-element
attributes.description: The option label element. The renderer can use this to directly append content.

attributes.description: The key name for the children.

attributes.description: The maximum number of columns which will be displayed before fetching more rows will be stopped. See the scroll-policy-options attribute for usage examples.

attributes.description: the horizontal position in pixel

attributes.name: scroll-position.y
attributes.description: the vertical position in pixel

attributes.name: scroll-position.row-index
attributes.description: the zero-based row index of the cell at the origin of the grid. If scrollPolicy is set to 'loadMoreOnScroll' and the index is greater than maxCount set in scrollPolicyOptions, then it will scroll and fetch until the end of the list is reached and there's no more items to fetch.

attributes.name: scroll-position.column-index
attributes.description: the zero-based column index of the cell at the origin of the grid. If scrollPolicy is set to 'loadMoreOnScroll' and the index is greater than maxCount set in scrollPolicyOptions, then it will scroll and fetch until the end of the list is reached and there's no more items to fetch.

attributes.name: scroll-position.row-key
attributes.description: the row key of the cell at the origin of the grid. If DataGridDataSource is used for data and the key does not exist in the DataGridDataSource, then the value is ignored. If it is unknown in the data source then the grid will fetch and scroll until the item is found or the end of the axis is reached and there's no more items to fetch.

attributes.name: scroll-position.column-key
attributes.description: the column key of the cell at the origin of the grid. If DataGridDataSource is used for data and the key does not exist in the DataGridDataSource, then the value is ignored. If it is unknown in the data source then the grid will fetch and scroll until the item is found or the end of the axis is reached and there's no more items to fetch.

attributes.name: scroll-position.offset-x
attributes.description: the horizontal offset in pixel relative to the cell identified by key/index.

attributes.name: scroll-position.offset-y
attributes.description: the vertical offset in pixel relative to the cell identified by key/index.

attributes.name: async-validators
attributes.description:
List of asynchronous validators used by the component when performing validation.
Use async-validators when you need to
perform some validation work on the server. Otherwise, use
validators, which are synchronous.

Each item in the Array is an instance that duck types AsyncValidator.
Implicit validators created by a component when certain attributes
are present (e.g. required attribute) are separate from
validators specified through the async-validators
attribute and the validators attribute.
At runtime when the component runs validation, it
combines the implicit validators with the list specified through the
validators
attribute and also the list specified through the
async-validators attribute.
Error messages are shown as soon as each async validator returns;
we do not wait until all the async validators finish to show errors.
If the component's valid state changes for the worse, it is also updated
as each validator returns so valid will be invalidShown
as soon as the first validator has an Error. It is recommended that you show the
value you are validating in the error message because if the async operation takes a while,
the user could be typing in a new value when the error message comes back
and might be confused what value the error is for. However, if the user enters a new value
(like presses Enter or Tab), a new validation lifecycle will start
and validation errors for the previous value will not be shown to the user.
If you need to format the value for the error message,
you can use
oj.IntlConverterUtils.getConverterInstance(converterOption)
to get the converter instance,
then call converter.format(value).


Hints exposed by async-validators and validators are shown in the notewindow by default,
or as determined by the 'validatorHint' property set on the
display-options attribute.

Since async validators are run asynchronously, you should wait on the BusyContext before
you check valid property or the value property. Alternatively you can add a callback to
the onValidChanged or ojValueChanged events.


The steps performed always, running validation and clearing messages is the same as
for the inputBase#validators attribute.

attributes.name: autofocus
attributes.description:
Autofocus is a Boolean that reflects the autofocus attribute, If it is set to true
then the associated component will get input focus when the page is loaded.
Setting this property doesn't set the focus to the component:
it tells the browser to focus to it when the element is inserted in the document.

attributes.name: converter
attributes.description:
A datetime converter instance that duck types DateTimeConverter. Or an object literal containing the properties listed below. The converter used for InputDate. Page authors can set a custom converter by creating one using the datetime converter factory and providing custom options - oj.Validation.converterFactory(oj.ConverterFactory.CONVERTER_TYPE_DATETIME).createConverter(customOptions). 
When converter property changes due to programmatic
intervention, the element performs various tasks based on the current state it is in. 

Steps Performed Always

Any cached converter instance is cleared and new converter created. The converter hint is
pushed to messaging. E.g., notewindow displays the new hint(s).



Running Validation

if element is valid when converter property changes, the
display value is refreshed.
if element is invalid and is showing messages when
converter property changes then all element messages are
cleared and full validation run using the current display value on the element. if there are validation errors, then value property is not updated, and the error is shown. The display value is not refreshed in this case. if no errors result from the validation, the value property is updated; page author can listen to the onValueChanged event to clear custom errors. The display value is refreshed with the formatted value provided by converter.


if element is invalid and has deferred messages when converter property changes, the display value is again refreshed with the formatted value provided by converter.


Clearing Messages

Only messages created by the element are cleared.
messagesCustom property is not cleared.
Page authors can
choose to clear it explicitly when setting the converter option.

attributes.name: date-picker
attributes.description: Note that Jet framework prohibits setting subset of properties which are object types. For example myInputDate.datePicker = {footerLayout: "today"}; is prohibited as it will wipe out all other sub-properties for "datePicker" object. If one wishes to do this [by above syntax or knockout] one will have to get the "datePicker" object, modify the necessary sub-property and pass it to above syntax. Default values for the datePicker sub-properties can also be overridden with the theming variable $inputDateTimeDatePickerOptionDefault, which is merged with other defaults. Note that all of the datePicker sub-properties except showOn are not available when renderMode is 'native'.

attributes.name: day-formatter
attributes.description: Additional info to be used when rendering the day This should be a JavaScript Function reference which accepts as its argument the following JSON format {fullYear: Date.getFullYear(), month: Date.getMonth()+1, date: Date.getDate()} and returns null or all or partial JSON data of {disabled: true|false, className: "additionalCSS", tooltip: 'Stuff to display'}

attributes.name: day-meta-data
attributes.description: Additional info to be used when rendering the day This should be in the following JSON format with the year, month, day based on Date.getFullYear(), Date.getMonth()+1, and Date.getDate(): {year: {month: {day: {disabled: true|false, className: "additionalCSS", tooltip: 'Stuff to display'}}} There also exists a special '*' character which represents ALL within that field [i.e. * within year, represents for ALL year]. Note that this property will override the value of the dayFormatter property. Setting both dayFormatter and dayMetaData properties is not supported.

attributes.name: described-by
attributes.description: described the relationship between this component and another element.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the component is disabled. The default is false.

attributes.name: display-options
attributes.description: Customize how to display to the user the form field's messages, converter and validator hints and help instruction text.

attributes.name: help
attributes.description:
Form component help information.

The properties supported on the help option are:

attributes.name: help-hints
attributes.description: Represents hints for an oj-form-layout element to render help information on the label of the editable component.

attributes.name: keyboard-edit
attributes.description: Determines if keyboard entry of the text is allowed. When the datepicker is inline, the only supported value is "disabled".

attributes.name: label-hint
attributes.description: Represents a hint for oj-form-layout element to render a label on the editable component.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: The maximum selectable date (in ISO string format). When set to null, there is no maximum.

attributes.name: messages-custom
attributes.description: List of messages an app would add to the component

attributes.name: min
attributes.description: The minimum selectable date (ISO string format). When set to null, there is no minimum.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: It indicates the name of the component.

attributes.name: picker-attributes
attributes.description: Attributes specified here will be set on the picker DOM element when it's launched. The supported attributes are class and style, which are appended to the picker's class and style, if any. Note: 1) pickerAttributes is not applied in the native theme. 2) setting this property after element creation has no effect.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: The placeholder text to set on the element.

attributes.name: raw-value
attributes.description:
The rawValue is the read-only property for retrieving
the current value from the input field in string form. The main consumer of
rawValue is a converter.

The rawValue updates on the 'input' javascript event,
so the rawValue changes as the value of the input is changed.
If the user types in '1,200' into the field, the rawValue will be '1', then '1,', then '1,2',
..., and finally '1,200'. Then when the user blurs or presses
Enter the value property gets converted and validated
(if there is a converter or validators) and then gets updated if valid.

This is a read-only attribute so page authors cannot set or change it directly.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: Dictates component's readonly state.

attributes.name: render-mode
attributes.description: Allows applications to specify whether to render date picker in JET or render as a native picker control. In inline mode, the only value supported is "jet"

attributes.name: required
attributes.description:
Whether the component is required or optional. When required is set to true, an implicit
required validator is created using the validator factory -
oj.Validation.validatorFactory(oj.ValidatorFactory.VALIDATOR_TYPE_REQUIRED).createValidator().

Translations specified using the translations.required attribute
and the label associated with the component, are passed through to the options parameter of the
createValidator method.


When required property changes due to programmatic intervention,
the component may clear messages and run validation, based on the current state it's in. 

Running Validation

if component is valid when required is set to true, then it runs deferred validation on
the value property. This is to ensure errors are not flagged unnecessarily.

if component is invalid and has deferred messages when required is set to false, then
component messages are cleared but no deferred validation is run.

if component is invalid and currently showing invalid messages when required is set, then
component messages are cleared and normal validation is run using the current display value. if there are validation errors, then value property is not updated and the error is shown. if no errors result from the validation, the value property is updated; page author can listen to the valueChanged event on the component to clear custom errors.




Clearing Messages

Only messages created by the component are cleared.
messagesCustom property is not cleared.




This property set to false implies that a value is not required to be provided by the user.
This is the default.
This property set to true implies that a value is required to be provided by user and the
input's label will render a required icon. Additionally a required validator -
RequiredValidator - is implicitly used if no explicit required validator is set.
An explicit required validator can be set by page authors using the validators attribute.

attributes.name: translations
attributes.description: A collection of translated resources from the translation bundle, or null if this component has no resources.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: The validity state of the component

attributes.name: validators
attributes.description: List of validators used by element along with the implicit component validators when performing validation. Each item is either an instance that duck types Validator, or is an Object literal containing the properties listed below. Implicit validators are created by the element when certain attributes are present. For example, if the required attribute is set, an implicit RequiredValidator is created. If the min and/or max attribute is set, an implicit DateTimeRangeValidator is created. If the dayFormatter attribute is set, an implicit DateRestrictionValidator is created. At runtime when the component runs validation, it combines all the implicit validators with all the validators specified through this validators attribute, and runs all of them. Hints exposed by validators are shown in the notewindow by default, or as determined by the 'validatorHint' property set on the displayOptions property. When validators property changes due to programmatic intervention, the element may decide to clear messages and run validation, based on the current state it is in. Steps Performed Always The cached list of validator instances are cleared and new validator hints is pushed to messaging. E.g., notewindow displays the new hint(s). Running Validation if element is valid when validators changes, element does nothing other than the steps it always performs. if element is invalid and is showing messages when validators changes then all element messages are cleared and full validation run using the display value on the element. if there are validation errors, then value property is not updated and the error is shown. if no errors result from the validation, the value property is updated; page author can listen to the valueChanged event to clear custom errors. if element is invalid and has deferred messages when validators changes, it does nothing other than the steps it performs always. Clearing Messages Only messages created by the element are cleared. messagesCustom property is not cleared.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of the DatePicker element which should be an ISOString. When the attribute is not set, the element's value attribute is used as its initial value if it exists. This value must be an ISOString.

attributes.name: converter.type
attributes.description: the converter type registered with the oj.ConverterFactory. Usually 'datetime'. See DateTimeConverterFactory for details. E.g., {converter: {type: 'datetime'}

attributes.name: converter.options
attributes.description: optional Object literal of options that the converter expects. See IntlDateTimeConverter for options supported by the jet datetime converter. E.g., {converter: {type: 'datetime', options: {formatType: 'date'}}

attributes.name: date-picker.change-year

attributes.name: date-picker.days-outside-month

attributes.name: date-picker.footer-layout

attributes.name: date-picker.number-of-months
attributes.description: The number of months to show at once. Note that if one is using a numberOfMonths > 4 then one should define a CSS rule for the width of each of the months. For example if numberOfMonths is set to 6 then one should define a CSS rule .oj-datepicker-multi-6 .oj-datepicker-group providing the width each month should take in percentage. See the date-picker attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: date-picker.show-on
attributes.description: When the datepicker should be shown. See the date-picker attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: date-picker.step-big-months
attributes.description: Number of months to step back/forward for the (Alt + Page up) + (Alt + Page down) key strokes. See the date-picker attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: date-picker.step-months
attributes.description: How the prev + next will step back/forward the months. The following are the valid values: "numberOfMonths" - When set to this string, will use numberOfMonths property value as value. <number> - Number of months to step back/forward. See the date-picker attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: date-picker.week-display
attributes.description: Whether week of the year will be shown. See the date-picker attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: date-picker.year-range
attributes.description: The range of years displayed in the year drop-down: either relative to today's year ("-nn:+nn"), relative to the currently selected year ("c-nn:c+nn"), absolute ("nnnn:nnnn"), or combinations of these formats ("nnnn:-nn"). See the date-picker attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.date-restriction
attributes.description:

attributes.name: async-validators
attributes.description:
List of asynchronous validators used by the component when performing validation.
Use async-validators when you need to
perform some validation work on the server. Otherwise, use
validators, which are synchronous.

Each item in the Array is an instance that duck types AsyncValidator.
Implicit validators created by a component when certain attributes
are present (e.g. required attribute) are separate from
validators specified through the async-validators
attribute and the validators attribute.
At runtime when the component runs validation, it
combines the implicit validators with the list specified through the
validators
attribute and also the list specified through the
async-validators attribute.
Error messages are shown as soon as each async validator returns;
we do not wait until all the async validators finish to show errors.
If the component's valid state changes for the worse, it is also updated
as each validator returns so valid will be invalidShown
as soon as the first validator has an Error. It is recommended that you show the
value you are validating in the error message because if the async operation takes a while,
the user could be typing in a new value when the error message comes back
and might be confused what value the error is for. However, if the user enters a new value
(like presses Enter or Tab), a new validation lifecycle will start
and validation errors for the previous value will not be shown to the user.
If you need to format the value for the error message,
you can use
oj.IntlConverterUtils.getConverterInstance(converterOption)
to get the converter instance,
then call converter.format(value).


Hints exposed by async-validators and validators are shown in the notewindow by default,
or as determined by the 'validatorHint' property set on the
display-options attribute.

Since async validators are run asynchronously, you should wait on the BusyContext before
you check valid property or the value property. Alternatively you can add a callback to
the onValidChanged or ojValueChanged events.


The steps performed always, running validation and clearing messages is the same as
for the inputBase#validators attribute.

attributes.name: autofocus
attributes.description:
Autofocus is a Boolean that reflects the autofocus attribute, If it is set to true
then the associated component will get input focus when the page is loaded.
Setting this property doesn't set the focus to the component:
it tells the browser to focus to it when the element is inserted in the document.

attributes.name: converter
attributes.description:
Default converter for InputDateTime

If one wishes to provide a custom converter for the InputDateTime override the factory returned for
oj.Validation.converterFactory(oj.ConverterFactory.CONVERTER_TYPE_DATETIME)

When converter property changes due to programmatic
intervention, the element performs various tasks based on the current state it is in. 

Steps Performed Always

Any cached converter instance is cleared and new converter created. The converter hint is
pushed to messaging. E.g., notewindow displays the new hint(s).



Running Validation

if element is valid when converter property changes, the
display value is refreshed.
if element is invalid and is showing messages when
converter property changes then all element messages are
cleared and full validation run using the current display value on the element. if there are validation errors, then value property is not updated, and the error is shown. The display value is not refreshed in this case. if no errors result from the validation, the value property is updated; page author can listen to the onValueChanged event to clear custom errors. The display value is refreshed with the formatted value provided by converter.


if element is invalid and has deferred messages when converter property changes, the display value is again refreshed with the formatted value provided by converter.


Clearing Messages

Only messages created by the element are cleared.
messagesCustom property is not cleared.
Page authors can
choose to clear it explicitly when setting the converter option.

attributes.name: date-picker
attributes.description: Note that Jet framework prohibits setting subset of properties which are object types. For example myInputDate.datePicker = {footerLayout: "today"}; is prohibited as it will wipe out all other sub-properties for "datePicker" object. If one wishes to do this [by above syntax or knockout] one will have to get the "datePicker" object, modify the necessary sub-property and pass it to above syntax. Default values for the datePicker sub-properties can also be overridden with the theming variable $inputDateTimeDatePickerOptionDefault, which is merged with other defaults. Note that all of the datePicker sub-properties except showOn are not available when renderMode is 'native'.

attributes.name: day-formatter
attributes.description: Additional info to be used when rendering the day This should be a JavaScript Function reference which accepts as its argument the following JSON format {fullYear: Date.getFullYear(), month: Date.getMonth()+1, date: Date.getDate()} and returns null or all or partial JSON data of {disabled: true|false, className: "additionalCSS", tooltip: 'Stuff to display'}

attributes.name: day-meta-data
attributes.description: Additional info to be used when rendering the day This should be in the following JSON format with the year, month, day based on Date.getFullYear(), Date.getMonth()+1, and Date.getDate(): {year: {month: {day: {disabled: true|false, className: "additionalCSS", tooltip: 'Stuff to display'}}} There also exists a special '*' character which represents ALL within that field [i.e. * within year, represents for ALL year]. Note that this property will override the value of the dayFormatter property. Setting both dayFormatter and dayMetaData properties is not supported.

attributes.name: described-by
attributes.description: described the relationship between this component and another element.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the component is disabled. The default is false.

attributes.name: display-options
attributes.description: Customize how to display to the user the form field's messages, converter and validator hints and help instruction text.

attributes.name: help
attributes.description:
Form component help information.

The properties supported on the help option are:

attributes.name: help-hints
attributes.description: Represents hints for an oj-form-layout element to render help information on the label of the editable component.

attributes.name: keyboard-edit
attributes.description:
Determines if keyboard entry of the text is allowed.
When the datepicker is inline, the only supported value is "disabled".

attributes.name: label-hint
attributes.description: Represents a hint for oj-form-layout element to render a label on the editable component.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: The maximum selectable datetime. When set to null, there is no maximum. type string - ISOString null - no limit

attributes.name: messages-custom
attributes.description: List of messages an app would add to the component

attributes.name: min
attributes.description: The minimum selectable date. When set to null, there is no minimum. type string - ISOString null - no limit

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: It indicates the name of the component.

attributes.name: picker-attributes
attributes.description: Attributes specified here will be set on the picker DOM element when it's launched. The supported attributes are class and style, which are appended to the picker's class and style, if any. Note: 1) pickerAttributes is not applied in the native theme. 2) setting this property after element creation has no effect.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: The placeholder text to set on the element.

attributes.name: raw-value
attributes.description:
The rawValue is the read-only property for retrieving
the current value from the input field in string form. The main consumer of
rawValue is a converter.

The rawValue updates on the 'input' javascript event,
so the rawValue changes as the value of the input is changed.
If the user types in '1,200' into the field, the rawValue will be '1', then '1,', then '1,2',
..., and finally '1,200'. Then when the user blurs or presses
Enter the value property gets converted and validated
(if there is a converter or validators) and then gets updated if valid.

This is a read-only attribute so page authors cannot set or change it directly.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: Dictates component's readonly state.

attributes.name: render-mode
attributes.description:
Allows applications to specify whether to render date picker in JET or
as a native picker control. In inline mode, the only value supported is "jet"

attributes.name: required
attributes.description:
Whether the component is required or optional. When required is set to true, an implicit
required validator is created using the validator factory -
oj.Validation.validatorFactory(oj.ValidatorFactory.VALIDATOR_TYPE_REQUIRED).createValidator().

Translations specified using the translations.required attribute
and the label associated with the component, are passed through to the options parameter of the
createValidator method.


When required property changes due to programmatic intervention,
the component may clear messages and run validation, based on the current state it's in. 

Running Validation

if component is valid when required is set to true, then it runs deferred validation on
the value property. This is to ensure errors are not flagged unnecessarily.

if component is invalid and has deferred messages when required is set to false, then
component messages are cleared but no deferred validation is run.

if component is invalid and currently showing invalid messages when required is set, then
component messages are cleared and normal validation is run using the current display value. if there are validation errors, then value property is not updated and the error is shown. if no errors result from the validation, the value property is updated; page author can listen to the valueChanged event on the component to clear custom errors.




Clearing Messages

Only messages created by the component are cleared.
messagesCustom property is not cleared.




This property set to false implies that a value is not required to be provided by the user.
This is the default.
This property set to true implies that a value is required to be provided by user and the
input's label will render a required icon. Additionally a required validator -
RequiredValidator - is implicitly used if no explicit required validator is set.
An explicit required validator can be set by page authors using the validators attribute.

attributes.name: time-picker
attributes.description: Note that Jet framework prohibits setting subset of properties which are object types. For example myInputDate.datePicker = {footerLayout: "today"}; is prohibited as it will wipe out all other sub-properties for "datePicker" object. If one wishes to do this [by above syntax or knockout] one will have to get the "datePicker" object, modify the necessary sub-property and pass it to above syntax. Default values for the datePicker sub-properties can also be overridden with the theming variable $inputDateTimeDatePickerOptionDefault, which is merged with other defaults. Note that all of the datePicker sub-properties except showOn are not available when renderMode is 'native'.

attributes.name: translations
attributes.description: A collection of translated resources from the translation bundle, or null if this component has no resources.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: The validity state of the component

attributes.name: validators
attributes.description:
List of validators used by element when performing validation. Each item is either an
instance that duck types Validator, or is an Object literal containing the
properties listed below.

Implicit validators are created by the element when certain attributes are present.
For example, if the required
attribute is set, an implicit RequiredValidator is created. If the
min and/or max attribute
is set, an implicit DateTimeRangeValidator is created. If the
dayFormatter attribute is set,
an implicit DateRestrictionValidator is created.
At runtime when the component runs validation, it
combines all the implicit validators with all the validators
specified through this validators attribute, and runs
all of them.


Hints exposed by validators are shown in the notewindow by default, or as determined by the
'validatorHint' property set on the displayOptions
property.



When validators property changes due to programmatic
intervention, the element may decide to clear messages and run validation, based on the
current state it is in. 

Steps Performed Always

The cached list of validator instances are cleared and new validator hints is pushed to
messaging. E.g., notewindow displays the new hint(s).



Running Validation

if element is valid when validators changes, element does nothing other than the
steps it always performs.
if element is invalid and is showing messages when
validators changes then all element messages are cleared
and full validation run using the display value on the element. if there are validation errors, then value property is not updated and the error is shown. if no errors result from the validation, the value property is updated; page author can listen to the valueChanged event to clear custom errors.


if element is invalid and has deferred messages when validators changes, it does
nothing other than the steps it performs always.



Clearing Messages

Only messages created by the element are cleared.
messagesCustom property is not cleared.

hint.max is shown when max is set and min is not set, and is used
to tell the user the allowed maximum.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.date-time-range.hint.min
attributes.description:
Hint text used by the implicit datetime range validator associated to the InputDateTime, InputDate, and InputTime components.
hint.min is shown when min is set and max is not set, and is used
to tell the user the allowed minimum.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.date-time-range.message-detail.range-overflow
attributes.description:
Error message text used by the implicit datetime range validator associated to the InputDateTime, InputDate, and InputTime components.
messageDetail.rangeOverflow is shown when max is set, and the
value is greater than the maximum.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.date-time-range.message-detail.range-underflow
attributes.description:
Error message text used by the implicit datetime range validator associated to the InputDateTime, InputDate, and InputTime components.
messageDetail.rangeUnderflow is shown when min is set, and the
value is less than the minimum.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.date-time-range.message-summary.range-overflow
attributes.description:
Error message summary text used by the implicit datetime range validator associated to the InputDateTime, InputDate, and InputTime components.
messageSummary.rangeOverflow is shown when max is set, and the
value is greater than the maximum.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.date-time-range.message-summary.range-underflow
attributes.description:
Error message summary text used by the implicit datetime range validator associated to the InputDateTime, InputDate, and InputTime components.
messageSummary.rangeUnderflow is shown when min is set, and
the value is less than the minimum.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.regexp.message-detail
attributes.description:
Provides properties to customize the error message detail used by the
implicit regexp validator associated to the InputText and TextArea components.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.regexp.message-summary
attributes.description:
Provides properties to customize the error message summary used by the
implicit regexp validator associated to the InputText and TextArea components.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.required.hint
attributes.description:
Hint text used by required validation error.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.required.message-detail
attributes.description:
Message text that describes the details of the required validation error.

attributes.name: translations.required.message-summary

attributes.description: The SVG CSS style object defining link style. The style class and style object will be applied directly on the link and override any other styling specified through the properties.

attributes.description: The SVG CSS style class defining link style. The style class and style object will be applied directly on the link and override any other styling specified through the properties.

attributes.description: Link width in pixels.

attributes.name: link-properties.start-connector-type
attributes.description: Specifies the type of start connector on the link. Supported values are "arrowOpen", "arrow", "arrowConcave", "circle", "rectangle", "rectangleRounded", "none". Default value is "none".

attributes.name: link-properties.end-connector-type
attributes.description: Specifies the type of end connector on the link. Supported values are "arrowOpen", "arrow", "arrowConcave", "circle", "rectangle", "rectangleRounded", "none". Default value is "none".

attributes.description: Determines when to display the expand/collapse button.Supported values are "on", "off". Default value is "on".

attributes.description: The border color of the icon.

attributes.description: The border radius of the icon. CSS border-radius values accepted. Note that non-% values (including unitless) get interpreted as 'px'.

attributes.description: The border width in pixels.

attributes.name: node-properties.icon.color
attributes.description: The fill color of the icon.

attributes.description: The fill pattern of the icon.Supported values are "smallChecker", "smallCrosshatch", "smallDiagonalLeft", "smallDiagonalRight", "smallDiamond", "smallTriangle", "largeChecker", "largeCrosshatch", "largeDiagonalLeft", "largeDiagonalRight", "largeDiamond", "largeTriangle", "none".Default value is "none".

attributes.name: node-properties.icon.opacity
attributes.description: The opacity of the icon.

attributes.name: node-properties.icon.shape
attributes.description: The shape of the icon. Can take the name of a built-in shape or the svg path commands for a custom shape.Supported built-in shapes:"ellipse", "square", "plus", "diamond", "triangleUp", "triangleDown", "human", "rectangle", "star", "circle".Default value is "circle".

attributes.name: node-properties.icon.source
attributes.description: The URI of the node image.

attributes.name: node-properties.icon.source-hover
attributes.description: The optional URI of the node hover image. If not defined, the source image will be used.

attributes.name: node-properties.icon.source-hover-selected
attributes.description: The optional URI of the selected image on hover. If not defined, the sourceSelected image will be used. If the sourceSelected image is not defined, the source image will be used.

attributes.name: node-properties.icon.source-selected
attributes.description: The optional URI of the selected image. If not defined, the source image will be used.

attributes.name: node-properties.icon.width

attributes.description: The CSS style object defining the style of the icon. The style class and style object will be applied directly on the icon and override any other styling specified through the properties.

attributes.description: The CSS style class defining the style of the icon. The style class and style object will be applied directly on the icon and override any other styling specified through the properties.

attributes.name: node-properties.overview.icon
attributes.description: Specifies an icon for the node in the overview window. The following properties can be used to customize the overview node. The width and height of the overview node is determined from the rendered node in the diagram.

attributes.name: node-properties.overview.icon.shape
attributes.description: The shape of the icon in the overview window. Can take one of the following values for the shape name or the svg path commands for a custom shape.Supported built-in shapes:"inherit", "ellipse", "square", "plus", "diamond", "triangleUp", "triangleDown", "human", "rectangle", "star", "circle". The default value is always "inherit", but that means different things for custom nodes and default nodes. When "inherit" value is specified for a default node, the shape is determined from the node in the diagram. When "inherit" value is specified for a custom node, "rectangle" shape will be used.This property doesn't apply at all to containers (custom or default).

attributes.description: Specifies overview node shape.

attributes.description: Specifies whether or not the node will be selectable.

attributes.name: short-desc
attributes.description: The text that displays in the node's tooltip.

attributes.description: Determines when to display the expand/collapse button.

attributes.description: The border color of the icon.

attributes.description: The border radius of the icon. CSS border-radius values accepted. Note that non-% values (including unitless) get interpreted as 'px'.

attributes.description: The border width in pixels.

attributes.name: icon.color
attributes.description: The fill color of the icon.

attributes.name: icon.height

attributes.name: icon.opacity
attributes.description: The opacity of the icon.

attributes.name: icon.pattern
attributes.description: The fill pattern of the icon.

attributes.name: icon.shape
attributes.description: The shape of the icon. Can take the name of a built-in shape or the svg path commands for a custom shape.

attributes.name: icon.source
attributes.description: The URI of the node image.

attributes.name: icon.source-hover
attributes.description: The optional URI of the node hover image. If not defined, the source image will be used.

attributes.name: icon.source-hover-selected
attributes.description: The optional URI of the selected image on hover. If not defined, the sourceSelected image will be used. If the sourceSelected image is not defined, the source image will be used.

attributes.name: icon.source-selected
attributes.description: The optional URI of the selected image. If not defined, the source image will be used.

attributes.name: icon.svg-class-name
attributes.description: The CSS style class defining the style of the icon. The style class and style object will be applied directly on the icon and override any other styling specified through the properties.

attributes.name: icon.svg-style
attributes.description: The CSS style object defining the style of the icon. The style class and style object will be applied directly on the icon and override any other styling specified through the properties.

attributes.description: The width of the icon.

attributes.name: overview.icon

attributes.name: overview.icon.shape
attributes.description: The shape of the icon in the overview window. Can take one of the following values for the shape name or the svg path commands for a custom shape. The default value is always "inherit", but that means different things for custom nodes and default nodes. When "inherit" value is specified for a default node, the shape is determined from the node in the diagram. When "inherit" value is specified for a custom node, "rectangle" shape will be used. This property doesn't apply at all to containers (custom or default).

attributes.description: The CSS style class defining the style of the node icon in the overview.

attributes.name: cancel-behavior
attributes.description:
Specifies the cancel behavior of the dialog.
The default value depends on the theme.
In the alta-web theme, the default is "icon",
and in alta-android, alta-ios and alta-windows themes, the
default is "none". Note that the cancelBehavior applies to both automatic and user-defined headers.
So by default, a user-defined header in the alta-web theme will have a system generated close icon.

attributes.name: dialog-title
attributes.description: Specify the title of the dialog. null is the default.

attributes.name: drag-affordance
attributes.description:
Specifies the drag affordance.
The default value depends on the theme.
In the alta-web theme, the default is "title-bar",
and in alta-android, alta-ios and alta-windows themes, the
default is "none".

attributes.name: initial-visibility
attributes.description: Set the initial visibility of the dialog.

attributes.name: modality
attributes.description: Defines the modality of the dialog.

attributes.name: position
attributes.description:
Position object is used to establish the location the dialog will appear relative to
another element. ojDialog.Position defines "my" alignment "at" the alignment
"of" some other thing which can be "offset" by so many pixels.

The "my" and "at" properties defines aligment points relative to the dialog and other
element. The "my" property represents the dialog's alignment where the "at" property
represents the other element that can be identified by "of". The values of these properties
describe horizontal and vertical alignments.


Deprecated v3.0.0 jQuery UI position syntax; Use of a percent unit with
"my" or "at" is not supported.

attributes.name: resize-behavior
attributes.description:
Defines the resizeBehavior of the dialog.
The default value depends on the theme.
In the alta-web theme, the default is "resizable",
and in alta-android, alta-ios and alta-windows themes, the
default is "none".

attributes.name: role
attributes.description:
The WAI-ARIA role of the dialog. By default, role="dialog" is added to the generated HTML markup that surrounds the dialog.
When used as an alert dialog, the user should set role to "alertdialog".

attributes.name: translations
attributes.description: A collection of translated resources from the translation bundle, or null if this component has no resources.

attributes.name: position.at
attributes.description:
Defines which position on the target element ("of") to align the positioned element
against.

attributes.name: position.collision
attributes.description: Rule for alternate alignment.

attributes.name: position.my
attributes.description: Defines which edge on the dialog to align with the target ("of") element.

attributes.name: position.of
attributes.description:
Which element to position the dialog against.
If the value is a string, it should be a selector or the literal string value
of window. Otherwise, a point of x,y. When a point
is used, the values are relative to the whole document. Page horizontal and vertical
scroll offsets need to be factored into this point - see UIEvent
pageX,
pageY.

attributes.name: position.offset
attributes.description: Defines a point offset in pixels from the ("my") alignment.

attributes.name: position.offset.x
attributes.description: Horizontal aligment offset.

attributes.name: position.offset.y
attributes.description: Vertical alignment offset.

attributes.name: translations.label-close-icon
attributes.description:
Label for the dialog close button.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: on-cancel-behavior-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'cancelBehavior' attribute

attributes.name: on-dialog-title-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'dialogTitle' attribute

attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'dragAffordance' attribute

attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'initialVisibility' attribute
