attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'modality' attribute

attributes.name: on-position-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'position' attribute

attributes.name: on-resize-behavior-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'resizeBehavior' attribute

attributes.name: on-role-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'role' attribute

attributes.name: on-translations-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'translations' attribute

attributes.name: on-oj-before-close
attributes.description:
Triggered before the dialog is dismissed via the
close() method. The close can be cancelled by calling
event.preventDefault().

attributes.name: on-oj-before-open
attributes.description:
Triggered before the dialog is launched via the open()
method. The open can be cancelled by calling
event.preventDefault().

attributes.name: on-oj-close
attributes.description:
Triggered after the dialog is dismissed via the
close() method.

attributes.name: on-oj-focus
attributes.description: Triggered after focus has been transfered to the dialog.

attributes.name: on-oj-open
attributes.description:
Triggered after the dialog is launched via the open()
method.

attributes.name: on-oj-resize
attributes.description: Triggered when the dialog is being resized.

attributes.name: on-oj-resize-start
attributes.description: Triggered when the user starts resizing the dialog.

attributes.name: on-oj-resize-stop
attributes.description: Triggered when the user stops resizing the dialog.

attributes.name: on-oj-animate-start
attributes.description:
Triggered when a default animation is about to start, such as when the component is
being opened/closed or a child item is being added/removed. The default animation can
be cancelled by calling event.preventDefault.

attributes.name: on-oj-animate-end
attributes.description:
Triggered when a default animation has ended, such as when the component is being
opened/closed or a child item is being added/removed. This event is not triggered if
the application has called preventDefault on the animateStart
event.

tags.name: oj-dialog
tags.description: Displays a popup window that provides information and gathers input from the application user.

attributes.name: accept
attributes.description: An array of strings of allowed MIME types or file extensions that can be uploaded. If not specified, accept all file types

attributes.name: select-on
attributes.description: The type of event to select the files.

attributes.name: selection-mode
attributes.description: Whether to allow single or multiple file selection.

attributes.name: on-accept-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'accept' attribute

attributes.name: on-select-on-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'selectOn' attribute

attributes.name: on-selection-mode-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'selectionMode' attribute

attributes.name: on-oj-select
attributes.description: Triggered after the files are selected

tags.name: oj-file-picker
tags.description: Displays a clickable dropzone for selecting files from the device storage.

attributes.name: arrow-placement
attributes.description: Specifies the placement of the navigation arrows.

attributes.name: arrow-visibility
attributes.description: Specifies the visibility of the navigation arrows.

attributes.name: current-item
attributes.description: Specifies the child item whose logical page should be displayed.

attributes.name: looping
attributes.description: Specifies the navigation looping behavior

attributes.name: max-items-per-page
attributes.description: Specifies the maximum number of child items shown in a logical page.

attributes.name: orientation
attributes.description: Specifies the orientation of the FilmStrip.

attributes.name: translations
attributes.description: A collection of translated resources from the translation bundle, or null if this component has no resources.

attributes.name: current-item.id
attributes.description: string id of the item

attributes.name: current-item.index
attributes.description: numeric 0-based index of the item

attributes.name: translations.label-acc-arrow-next-page
attributes.description:
Accessible label for the next page navigation arrow.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.label-acc-arrow-previous-page
attributes.description:
Accessible label for the previous page navigation arrow.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.label-acc-film-strip
attributes.description:
Accessible page information label for the filmstrip element.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.tip-arrow-next-page
attributes.description:
Tooltip for the next page navigation arrow.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.tip-arrow-previous-page
attributes.description:
Tooltip for the previous page navigation arrow.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: on-arrow-placement-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'arrowPlacement' attribute

attributes.name: on-arrow-visibility-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'arrowVisibility' attribute

attributes.name: on-current-item-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'currentItem' attribute

attributes.name: on-looping-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'looping' attribute

attributes.name: on-max-items-per-page-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'maxItemsPerPage' attribute

attributes.name: on-orientation-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'orientation' attribute

attributes.name: on-translations-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'translations' attribute

tags.name: oj-film-strip
tags.description: Container element that lays out its children in a single row or column across logical pages and allows navigating through them.

attributes.name: direction
attributes.description: Specifies the layout direction of the form layout children.

attributes.name: label-edge
attributes.description: Specifies how the label is aligned with its editable value component.

attributes.name: label-width
attributes.description: Specifies the label width. This specifies the width of the oj-label elements. This can be any legal CSS width.

attributes.name: label-wrapping
attributes.description: Specifies if the label text should wrap or truncate.

attributes.name: max-columns
attributes.description: Specifies the maximum number of columns. The actual number of columns may be less, depending on the [direction]ojFormLayout#direction attribute. If direction is "column", the layout is responsive and browsers automatically reduce the number of columns to fit the width of the viewport. If direction is "row", the number of columns is fixed to the max-columns value. Applications can choose to make it responsive by using ResponsiveKnockoutUtils to adjust the value. See the oj-form-layout - Across demo for an example.

attributes.name: on-direction-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'direction' attribute

attributes.name: on-label-edge-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'labelEdge' attribute

attributes.name: on-label-width-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'labelWidth' attribute

attributes.name: on-label-wrapping-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'labelWrapping' attribute

attributes.name: on-max-columns-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'maxColumns' attribute

tags.name: oj-form-layout
tags.description: Used to group child elements in an organized layout that can be optimized for multiple display sizes.

attributes.name: animation-on-data-change
attributes.description: Defines the animation that is applied on data changes.

attributes.name: animation-on-display
attributes.description: Defines the animation that is shown on initial display.

attributes.name: as
attributes.description: An alias for the $current context variable passed to slot content for the dependencyTemplate, taskTemplate, or rowTemplate slots.

attributes.name: axis-position
attributes.description: The position of the major and minor axis.

attributes.name: dependencies
attributes.description: An array of objects that defines dependencies between tasks. Also accepts a Promise that will resolve with an array for deferred data rendering. No data will be rendered if the Promise is rejected.

attributes.name: dependency-data
attributes.description: The oj.DataProvider for the dependencies of the gantt. It should provide data rows where each row maps data for a single gantt dependency line. The row key will be used as the id for dependency lines. Note that when using this attribute, a template for the dependencyTemplate slot should be provided.

attributes.name: dnd
attributes.description: Enables drag and drop functionality.

attributes.name: end
attributes.description: The end time of the Gantt. A valid value is required in order for the Gantt to properly render. See Date and Time Formats for more details on the required string formats.

attributes.name: gridlines
attributes.description: An object specifying whether to display or hide the horizontal and vertical grid lines.

attributes.name: major-axis
attributes.description: An object with the following properties, used to define the major time axis. If not specified, no major time axis is shown.

attributes.name: minor-axis
attributes.description: An object with the following properties, used to define the minor time axis. This is required in order for the Gantt to properly render.

attributes.name: reference-objects
attributes.description: The array of reference objects associated with the gantt. For each reference object, a line is rendered at the specified value. Currently only the first reference object in the array is supported. Any additional objects supplied in the array will be ignored.

attributes.name: row-axis
attributes.description: An object defining properties for the row labels region.

attributes.name: row-defaults
attributes.description: An object with the following properties, used to define default styling for rows in the Gantt.

attributes.name: rows
attributes.description: An array of objects with the following properties, used to define rows and tasks within rows. Also accepts a Promise that will resolve with an array for deferred data rendering. No data will be rendered if the Promise is rejected.

attributes.name: scroll-position
attributes.description: The current scroll position of Gantt. The scroll position is updated when the vertical scroll position has changed. The value contains the y scroll position, the index of the row closest to the top of the viewport, and the vertical offset from the position of the row to the actual scroll position. The default value contains just the scroll position. If there is no data then the 'rowIndex' sub-property will not be available. When setting the scrollPosition property, applications can change any combination of the sub-properties. If multiple sub-properties are set at once they will be used in rowIndex, pixel order where the latter serves as hints. If offsetY is specified, it will be used to adjust the scroll position from the position where the index of the row is located. If a sparse object is set the other sub-properties will be populated and updated once Gantt has scrolled to that position.

attributes.name: selection
attributes.description: An array of strings containing the ids of the initially selected tasks.

attributes.name: selection-mode
attributes.description: The type of selection behavior that is enabled on the Gantt. If 'single' is specified, only a single task can be selected at once. If 'multiple', any number of tasks can be selected at once. Otherwise, selection is disabled.

attributes.name: start
attributes.description: The start time of the Gantt. A valid value is required in order for the Gantt to properly render. See Date and Time Formats for more details on the required string formats.

attributes.name: task-data
attributes.description: The oj.DataProvider for the tasks of the gantt. It should provide data rows where each row maps data for a single gantt task. The row key will be used as the id for gantt tasks. Note that when using this attribute, a template for the taskTemplate slot should be provided. Additionally providing a template for the rowTemplate slot for generating the gantt row properties is optional.

attributes.name: task-defaults
attributes.description: An object with the following properties, used to define default styling for tasks in the Gantt. Properties specified on this object may be overridden by specifications on individual tasks.

attributes.name: tooltip
attributes.description: An object containing an optional callback function for tooltip customization.

attributes.name: track-resize
attributes.description: Defines whether the element will automatically render in response to changes in size. If set to off, then the application is responsible for calling refresh to render the element at the new size.

attributes.name: translations
attributes.description: A collection of translated resources from the translation bundle, or null if this component has no resources.

attributes.name: value-formats
attributes.description: An object specifying value formatting and tooltip behavior, whose keys generally correspond to task properties.

attributes.name: viewport-end
attributes.description: The end time of the Gantt's viewport. If not specified or invalid, this will default to a value determined by the initial 'scale' of the minor axis and the width of the Gantt. See Date and Time Formats for more details on the required string formats.

attributes.name: viewport-start
attributes.description: The start time of the Gantt's viewport. If not specified or invalid, this will default to a value determined by the initial 'scale' of the minor axis and the width of the Gantt. See Date and Time Formats for more details on the required string formats.

attributes.name: dnd.move
attributes.description: Defines a subset of high level configurations for moving elements to another location of some row within the gantt. See the dnd attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: dnd.move.tasks
attributes.description: Enable or disable moving the non-baseline portions of tasks to a different location of some row within the same gantt using drag and drop or equivalent keyboard actions (See Keyboard End User Information). See also ojMove. See the dnd attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: gridlines.horizontal
attributes.description: Horizontal gridlines. The default value is "auto", which means Gantt will decide whether the grid lines should be made visible or hidden. See the gridlines attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: gridlines.vertical
attributes.description: Vertical gridlines. The default value is "auto", which means Gantt will decide whether the grid lines should be made visible or hidden. See the gridlines attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: major-axis.converter
attributes.description: A converter (an object literal or instance that duck types Converter) used to format the labels of the major axis for all 'scale' values, or an object literal whose keys are 'scale' values that map specific converters for scale specific formatting (see ojTimeAxis.Converters). See DateTimeConverterFactory for details on creating built-in datetime converters. See the major-axis attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: major-axis.height
attributes.description: Specifies the height of the major axis in pixels. If not specified or if the height specified is less than the inherent minimum height (which is a function of the axis label sizes), a default value will be used. Applications should make sure not to set heights that would make the total axes height too large for the viewport to accomodate. See the major-axis attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: major-axis.scale
attributes.description: The time scale used for the major axis. See the major-axis attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: major-axis.zoom-order
attributes.description: An array of strings containing the names of scales used for zooming from longest to shortest. If not specified, the 'scale' specified on the axis will be used at all zoom levels. See the major-axis attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: major-axis.converter.default
attributes.description: The default converter (an object literal or instance that duck types Converter) to use for all 'scale' values that do not otherwise have a converter object provided. See DateTimeConverterFactory for details on creating built-in datetime converters.

attributes.name: major-axis.converter.seconds
attributes.description: The converter (an object literal or instance that duck types Converter) used for the 'seconds' scale. If not specified, the default converter will be used for this scale. See DateTimeConverterFactory for details on creating built-in datetime converters.

attributes.name: major-axis.converter.minutes
attributes.description: The converter (an object literal or instance that duck types Converter) used for the 'minutes' scale. If not specified, the default converter will be used for this scale. See DateTimeConverterFactory for details on creating built-in datetime converters.

attributes.name: major-axis.converter.hours
attributes.description: The converter (an object literal or instance that duck types Converter) used for the 'hours' scale. If not specified, the default converter will be used for this scale. See DateTimeConverterFactory for details on creating built-in datetime converters.

attributes.name: major-axis.converter.days
attributes.description: The converter (an object literal or instance that duck types Converter) used for the 'days' scale. If not specified, the default converter will be used for this scale. See DateTimeConverterFactory for details on creating built-in datetime converters.

attributes.name: major-axis.converter.weeks
attributes.description: The converter (an object literal or instance that duck types Converter) used for the 'weeks' scale. If not specified, the default converter will be used for this scale. See DateTimeConverterFactory for details on creating built-in datetime converters.

attributes.name: major-axis.converter.months
attributes.description: The converter (an object literal or instance that duck types Converter) used for the 'months' scale. If not specified, the default converter will be used for this scale. See DateTimeConverterFactory for details on creating built-in datetime converters.

attributes.name: major-axis.converter.quarters
attributes.description: The converter (an object literal or instance that duck types Converter) used for the 'quarters' scale. If not specified, the default converter will be used for this scale. See DateTimeConverterFactory for details on creating built-in datetime converters.

attributes.name: major-axis.converter.years
attributes.description: The converter (an object literal or instance that duck types Converter) used for the 'years' scale. If not specified, the default converter will be used for this scale. See DateTimeConverterFactory for details on creating built-in datetime converters.

attributes.name: minor-axis.converter
attributes.description: A converter (an object literal or instance that duck types Converter) used to format the labels of the minor axis for all 'scale' values, or an object literal whose keys are 'scale' values that map specific converters for scale specific formatting (see ojTimeAxis.Converters). See DateTimeConverterFactory for details on creating built-in datetime converters. See the minor-axis attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: minor-axis.height
attributes.description: Specifies the height of the minor axis in pixels. If not specified or if the height specified is less than the inherent minimum height (which is a function of the axis label sizes), a default value will be used. Applications should make sure not to set heights that would make the total axes height too large for the viewport to accomodate. See the minor-axis attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: minor-axis.scale
attributes.description: The time scale used for the minor axis. This is required in order for the Gantt to properly render. See the minor-axis attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: minor-axis.zoom-order
attributes.description: An array of strings containing the names of scales used for zooming from longest to shortest. If not specified, the 'scale' specified on the axis will be used at all zoom levels. See the minor-axis attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: minor-axis.converter.default
attributes.description: The default converter (an object literal or instance that duck types Converter) to use for all 'scale' values that do not otherwise have a converter object provided. See DateTimeConverterFactory for details on creating built-in datetime converters.

attributes.name: minor-axis.converter.seconds
attributes.description: The converter (an object literal or instance that duck types Converter) used for the 'seconds' scale. If not specified, the default converter will be used for this scale. See DateTimeConverterFactory for details on creating built-in datetime converters.

attributes.name: minor-axis.converter.minutes
attributes.description: The converter (an object literal or instance that duck types Converter) used for the 'minutes' scale. If not specified, the default converter will be used for this scale. See DateTimeConverterFactory for details on creating built-in datetime converters.

attributes.name: minor-axis.converter.hours
attributes.description: The converter (an object literal or instance that duck types Converter) used for the 'hours' scale. If not specified, the default converter will be used for this scale. See DateTimeConverterFactory for details on creating built-in datetime converters.

attributes.name: minor-axis.converter.days
attributes.description: The converter (an object literal or instance that duck types Converter) used for the 'days' scale. If not specified, the default converter will be used for this scale. See DateTimeConverterFactory for details on creating built-in datetime converters.

attributes.name: minor-axis.converter.weeks
attributes.description: The converter (an object literal or instance that duck types Converter) used for the 'weeks' scale. If not specified, the default converter will be used for this scale. See DateTimeConverterFactory for details on creating built-in datetime converters.

attributes.name: minor-axis.converter.months
attributes.description: The converter (an object literal or instance that duck types Converter) used for the 'months' scale. If not specified, the default converter will be used for this scale. See DateTimeConverterFactory for details on creating built-in datetime converters.

attributes.name: minor-axis.converter.quarters
attributes.description: The converter (an object literal or instance that duck types Converter) used for the 'quarters' scale. If not specified, the default converter will be used for this scale. See DateTimeConverterFactory for details on creating built-in datetime converters.

attributes.name: minor-axis.converter.years
attributes.description: The converter (an object literal or instance that duck types Converter) used for the 'years' scale. If not specified, the default converter will be used for this scale. See DateTimeConverterFactory for details on creating built-in datetime converters.

attributes.name: row-axis.label
attributes.description: An object defining the properties of the row labels. See the row-axis attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: row-axis.max-width
attributes.description: Defines the maximum width of the region in pixels (e.g. '50px') or percent (e.g. '15%') of the element width. If 'none' is specified, then the width has no maximum value. Default labels will truncate to fit. See the row-axis attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: row-axis.rendered
attributes.description: Defines whether row labels are rendered. See the row-axis attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: row-axis.width
attributes.description: Defines the width of the region in pixels (e.g. '50px') or percent (e.g. '15%') of the element width. If 'max-content' is specified, then the intrinsic width of the widest label content is used. Default labels will truncate to fit. See the row-axis attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: row-axis.label.renderer
attributes.description: An optional function that returns custom content for the row label. The custom content must be an SVG element. See the row-axis attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: row-axis.label.renderer.parent-element
attributes.description: A parent group element that takes a custom SVG fragment as the row label content. Modifications of the parentElement are not supported.

attributes.name: row-axis.label.renderer.row-data
attributes.description: The data for the row.

attributes.name: row-axis.label.renderer.item-data
attributes.description: An array of the data provider row data objects associated with the tasks belonging to the gantt row. This will only be set if an oj.DataProvider for task-data is being used.

attributes.name: row-axis.label.renderer.component-element
attributes.description: The gantt element.

attributes.name: row-axis.label.renderer.max-width
attributes.description: The maximum available width in px, as constrained by the row-axis.width and row-axis.max-width values. If row-axis.width is 'max-content' and row-axis.max-width is 'none', then this is -1, and the component will automatically allocate enough width space to accommodate the content.

attributes.name: row-axis.label.renderer.max-height
attributes.description: The maximum available height in px.

attributes.name: row-defaults.height
attributes.description: The height of the row in pixels. If specified, overlapping tasks do not stagger. Since task heights can also be set, via the task-defaults.height attribute or in the data definition, applications typically should make sure that their task heights are less than the row height. If not specified, a default height is calculated based on the height of the tasks within the row, and overlapping tasks stagger. See the row-defaults attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: scroll-position.offset-y
attributes.description: The vertical offset in pixel relative to the row identified by scroll-position.rowIndex. See the scroll-position attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: scroll-position.row-index
attributes.description: The zero-based index of the row. See the scroll-position attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: scroll-position.y
attributes.description: The vertical position in pixel. See the scroll-position attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: task-defaults.baseline
attributes.description: An object with the following properties, used to define default styling for task baseline elements. See the task-defaults attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: task-defaults.border-radius
attributes.description: The border radius of the task. Accepts values allowed in CSS border-radius attribute. See the task-defaults attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: task-defaults.height
attributes.description: The height of the task in pixels. If not specified, a default height is used depending on the task type, and whether the baseline is specified. Since row heights can also be set via the row-defaults.height attribute, applications typically should make sure that their task heights are less than the row height. See the task-defaults attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: task-defaults.label-position
attributes.description: The position of the label relative to the task, or a priority order of label positions for the component to automatically choose from.

attributes.name: task-defaults.progress
attributes.description: An object with the following properties, used to define default styling for progress bars on non-milestone tasks. See the task-defaults attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: task-defaults.svg-class-name
attributes.description: A space delimited list of CSS style classes defining the style of the task. See the task-defaults attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: task-defaults.svg-style
attributes.description: The CSS style defining the style of the task. See the task-defaults attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: task-defaults.type
attributes.description: The type of task to be rendered.

attributes.name: task-defaults.baseline.border-radius
attributes.description: The border radius of the baseline. Accepts values allowed in CSS border-radius attribute. See the task-defaults attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: task-defaults.baseline.height
attributes.description: The height of the baseline in pixels. If not specified, a default height is used depending on the baseline type. See the task-defaults attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: task-defaults.baseline.svg-class-name
attributes.description: A space delimited list of CSS style classes defining the style of the baseline. See the task-defaults attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: task-defaults.baseline.svg-style
attributes.description: The CSS style defining the style of the baseline. See the task-defaults attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: task-defaults.progress.border-radius
attributes.description: The border radius of the progress bar. Accepts values allowed in CSS border-radius attribute. See the task-defaults attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: task-defaults.progress.height
attributes.description: Specifies the height of the progress bar in pixels (e.g. '50px') or percent of the associated task bar (e.g. '15%'). See the task-defaults attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: task-defaults.progress.svg-class-name
attributes.description: A space delimited list of CSS style classes to apply to the progress bar. Note that only CSS style applicable to SVG elements can be used. See the task-defaults attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: task-defaults.progress.svg-style
attributes.description: The CSS inline style to apply to the progress bar. Only CSS style applicable to SVG elements can be used. See the task-defaults attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer
attributes.description: A function that returns a custom tooltip. Note that the default is for a tooltip to be displayed. See the tooltip attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.parent-element
attributes.description: The tooltip element. This can be used to change the tooltip border or background color.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.data
attributes.description: The data object of the hovered task.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.row-data
attributes.description: The data for the row the hovered task belongs to.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.item-data
attributes.description: The data provider row data object for the hovered task. This will only be set if an oj.DataProvider for task-data is being used.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.component-element
attributes.description: The gantt element.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.color
attributes.description: The color of the hovered task.

attributes.name: translations.accessible-dependency-info
attributes.description:
Provides properties to customize the screen reader text describing a specific dependency.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.accessible-predecessor-info
attributes.description:
Provides properties to customize the screen reader text describing predecessors of a task.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.accessible-successor-info
attributes.description:
Provides properties to customize the screen reader text describing successors of a task.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.accessible-task-type-milestone
attributes.description:
Used to describe milestone task type for accessibility.

See the translations property for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.accessible-task-type-summary
attributes.description:
Used to describe summary task type for accessibility.

See the translations property for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.component-name
attributes.description:
Used to describe the data visualization type for accessibility.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.finish-finish-dependency-aria-desc
attributes.description:
Used to describe finish to finish dependency type for accessibility.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.finish-start-dependency-aria-desc
attributes.description:
Used to describe finish to start dependency type for accessibility.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.label-and-value
attributes.description:
Used to display a label and its value.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.label-baseline-date
attributes.description:
Used for the default tooltip label for baseline milestone information.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.label-baseline-end
attributes.description:
Used for the default tooltip label for baseline end time information.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.label-baseline-start
attributes.description:
Used for the default tooltip label for baseline start time information.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.label-clear-selection
attributes.description:
Text shown for clearing multiple selection on touch devices.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.label-count-with-total
attributes.description:
Used to display a count out of a total.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.label-data-visualization
attributes.description:
Label for data visualizations used for accessibility.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.label-date
attributes.description:
Used for the default tooltip label for milestone information.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.label-end
attributes.description:
Used for the default tooltip label for end time information.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.label-invalid-data
attributes.description:
Text shown when the component receives invalid data.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.label-label
attributes.description:
Used for the default tooltip label for task label information.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.label-move-by
attributes.description:
Used for the default tooltip label for task move scale change.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.label-no-data
attributes.description:
Text shown when the component receives no data.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.label-progress
attributes.description:
Used for the default tooltip label for task progress information.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.label-row
attributes.description:
Used for the default tooltip label for row information.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.label-start
attributes.description:
Used for the default tooltip label for start time information.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.start-finish-dependency-aria-desc
attributes.description:
Used to describe start to finish dependency type for accessibility.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.start-start-dependency-aria-desc
attributes.description:
Used to describe start to start dependency type for accessibility.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.state-collapsed
attributes.description:
Used to describe the collapsed state for accessibility.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.state-drillable
attributes.description:
Used to describe a drillable object for accessibility.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.state-expanded
attributes.description:
Used to describe the expanded state for accessibility.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.state-hidden

attributes.name: baseline
attributes.description:
Specifies the baseline of the task.
When only one of 'start' or 'end' value is specified, or when 'start' and 'end' values are equal, the baseline is considered a milestone baseline.

attributes.name: border-radius
attributes.description:
The border radius of the task. Accepts values allowed in CSS border-radius attribute.
The default value comes from the gantt's [task-defaults.border-radius]ojGantt#taskDefaults.borderRadius.

attributes.name: end
attributes.description:
The end time of this task. Optional if task is a single date event like Milestone.
Either start or end has to be defined in order for the task to properly render.
See [Date and Time Formats]ojGantt#formats-section for more details on the required string formats.

attributes.name: height
attributes.description:
The height of the task in pixels.
Since row heights can also be set via the gantt's [row-defaults.height]ojGantt#rowDefaults.height attribute,
applications typically should make sure that their task heights are less than the row height.
The default value comes from the gantt's [task-defaults.height]ojGantt#taskDefaults.height.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The label associated with the task.

attributes.name: label-position
attributes.description: The position of the label relative to the task, or a priority order of label positions for the component to automatically choose from.

attributes.name: label-style
attributes.description: The CSS style defining the style of the label. Only CSS style applicable to SVG elements can be used.

attributes.name: progress
attributes.description: Specifies the progress of the task. This property is ignored if the task is a milestone.

attributes.name: row-id
attributes.description: The id for the row the task belongs to.

attributes.name: short-desc
attributes.description: The description of the task. This is used for accessibility and for customizing the tooltip text.

attributes.name: start
attributes.description:
The start time of this task. Optional if task is a single date event like Milestone.
Either start or end has to be defined in order for the task to properly render.
See [Date and Time Formats]ojGantt#formats-section for more details on the required string formats.

attributes.name: svg-class-name
attributes.description:
A space delimited list of CSS style classes defining the style of the task.
The default value comes from the gantt's [task-defaults.svg-class-name]ojGantt#taskDefaults.svgClassName.

attributes.name: svg-style
attributes.description: The CSS style defining the style of the task. The default value comes from the gantt's [task-defaults.svg-style]ojGantt#taskDefaults.svgStyle.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description:
Defines the task type to be rendered.
If "milestone", and if 'start' and 'end' values are specified and unequal, the 'start' value is used to evaluate position.
If "auto", the type is inferred from the data: If 'start' and 'end' values are specified and unequal, "normal" type is assumed. Otherwise, "milestone" type is assumed.

The default value comes from the gantt's [task-defaults.type]ojGantt#taskDefaults.type.

attributes.name: baseline.border-radius
attributes.description:
The border radius of the baseline. Accepts values allowed in CSS border-radius attribute.
The default value comes from the gantt's [task-defaults.baseline.border-radius]ojGantt#taskDefaults.baseline.borderRadius.
See the baseline attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: baseline.end
attributes.description:
The end time of the baseline.
Optional if baseline is a milestone.
Either start or end has to be defined in order for the baseline to properly render.
See [Date and Time Formats]ojGantt#formats-section for more details on the required string formats.
See the baseline attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: baseline.height
attributes.description:
The height of the baseline in pixels.
The default value comes from the gantt's [task-defaults.baseline.height]ojGantt#taskDefaults.baseline.height.
See the baseline attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: baseline.start
attributes.description:
The start time of the baseline.
Optional if baseline is a milestone.
Either start or end has to be defined in order for the baseline to properly render.
See [Date and Time Formats]ojGantt#formats-section for more details on the required string formats.
See the baseline attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: baseline.svg-class-name
attributes.description:
A space delimited list of CSS style classes defining the style of the baseline.
The default value comes from the gantt's [task-defaults.baseline.svg-class-name]ojGantt#taskDefaults.baseline.svgClassName.
See the baseline attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: baseline.svg-style
attributes.description:
The CSS style defining the style of the baseline.
The default value comes from the gantt's [task-defaults.baseline.svg-style]ojGantt#taskDefaults.baseline.svgStyle.
See the baseline attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: progress.border-radius
attributes.description:
The border radius of the progress bar. Accepts values allowed in CSS border-radius attribute.
The default value comes from the gantt's [task-defaults.progress.border-radius]ojGantt#taskDefaults.progress.borderRadius.
See the progress attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: progress.height
attributes.description:
Specifies the height of the progress bar in pixels (e.g. '50px') or percent of the associated task bar (e.g. '15%').
The default value comes from the gantt's [task-defaults.progress.height]ojGantt#taskDefaults.progress.height.
See the progress attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: progress.svg-class-name
attributes.description:
A space delimited list of CSS style classes to apply to the progress bar. Note that only CSS style applicable to SVG elements can be used.
The default value comes from the gantt's [task-defaults.progress.svg-class-name]ojGantt#taskDefaults.progress.svgClassName.
See the progress attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: progress.svg-style
attributes.description:
The CSS inline style to apply to the progress bar. Only CSS style applicable to SVG elements can be used.
The default value comes from the gantt's [task-defaults.progress.svg-style]ojGantt#taskDefaults.progress.svgStyle.
See the progress attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: progress.value
attributes.description:
The value of the progress between 0 and 1 inclusive. If not specified or invalid, no progress will be shown.
See the progress attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: async-validators
attributes.description:
List of asynchronous validators used by the component when performing validation.
Use async-validators when you need to
perform some validation work on the server. Otherwise, use
validators, which are synchronous.

Each item in the Array is an instance that duck types AsyncValidator.
Implicit validators created by a component when certain attributes
are present (e.g. required attribute) are separate from
validators specified through the async-validators
attribute and the validators attribute.
At runtime when the component runs validation, it
combines the implicit validators with the list specified through the
validators
attribute and also the list specified through the
async-validators attribute.
Error messages are shown as soon as each async validator returns;
we do not wait until all the async validators finish to show errors.
If the component's valid state changes for the worse, it is also updated
as each validator returns so valid will be invalidShown
as soon as the first validator has an Error. It is recommended that you show the
value you are validating in the error message because if the async operation takes a while,
the user could be typing in a new value when the error message comes back
and might be confused what value the error is for. However, if the user enters a new value
(like presses Enter or Tab), a new validation lifecycle will start
and validation errors for the previous value will not be shown to the user.
If you need to format the value for the error message,
you can use
oj.IntlConverterUtils.getConverterInstance(converterOption)
to get the converter instance,
then call converter.format(value).


Hints exposed by async-validators and validators are shown in the notewindow by default,
or as determined by the 'validatorHint' property set on the
display-options attribute.

Since async validators are run asynchronously, you should wait on the BusyContext before
you check valid property or the value property. Alternatively you can add a callback to
the onValidChanged or ojValueChanged events.


The steps performed always, running validation and clearing messages is the same as
for the inputBase#validators attribute.

attributes.name: autocomplete
attributes.description: Dictates component's autocomplete state.

attributes.name: autofocus
attributes.description:
Autofocus is a Boolean that reflects the autofocus attribute, If it is set to true
then the associated component will get input focus when the page is loaded.
Setting this property doesn't set the focus to the component:
it tells the browser to focus to it when the element is inserted in the document.

attributes.name: converter
attributes.description:
A datetime converter instance that duck types DateTimeConverter. Or an object literal containing the properties listed below. The converter used for InputDate. Page authors can set a custom converter by creating one using the datetime converter factory and providing custom options - oj.Validation.converterFactory(oj.ConverterFactory.CONVERTER_TYPE_DATETIME).createConverter(customOptions). 
When converter property changes due to programmatic
intervention, the element performs various tasks based on the current state it is in. 

Steps Performed Always

Any cached converter instance is cleared and new converter created. The converter hint is
pushed to messaging. E.g., notewindow displays the new hint(s).



Running Validation

if element is valid when converter property changes, the
display value is refreshed.
if element is invalid and is showing messages when
converter property changes then all element messages are
cleared and full validation run using the current display value on the element. if there are validation errors, then value property is not updated, and the error is shown. The display value is not refreshed in this case. if no errors result from the validation, the value property is updated; page author can listen to the onValueChanged event to clear custom errors. The display value is refreshed with the formatted value provided by converter.


if element is invalid and has deferred messages when converter property changes, the display value is again refreshed with the formatted value provided by converter.


Clearing Messages

Only messages created by the element are cleared.
messagesCustom property is not cleared.
Page authors can
choose to clear it explicitly when setting the converter option.

attributes.name: date-picker
attributes.description: Note that Jet framework prohibits setting subset of properties which are object types. For example myInputDate.datePicker = {footerLayout: "today"}; is prohibited as it will wipe out all other sub-properties for "datePicker" object. If one wishes to do this [by above syntax or knockout] one will have to get the "datePicker" object, modify the necessary sub-property and pass it to above syntax. Default values for the datePicker sub-properties can also be overridden with the theming variable $inputDateTimeDatePickerOptionDefault, which is merged with other defaults. Note that all of the datePicker sub-properties except showOn are not available when renderMode is 'native'.

attributes.name: day-formatter
attributes.description: Additional info to be used when rendering the day This should be a JavaScript Function reference which accepts as its argument the following JSON format {fullYear: Date.getFullYear(), month: Date.getMonth()+1, date: Date.getDate()} and returns null or all or partial JSON data of {disabled: true|false, className: "additionalCSS", tooltip: 'Stuff to display'}

attributes.name: day-meta-data
attributes.description: Additional info to be used when rendering the day This should be in the following JSON format with the year, month, day based on Date.getFullYear(), Date.getMonth()+1, and Date.getDate(): {year: {month: {day: {disabled: true|false, className: "additionalCSS", tooltip: 'Stuff to display'}}} There also exists a special '*' character which represents ALL within that field [i.e. * within year, represents for ALL year]. Note that this property will override the value of the dayFormatter property. Setting both dayFormatter and dayMetaData properties is not supported.

attributes.name: described-by
attributes.description: described the relationship between this component and another element.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the component is disabled. The default is false.

attributes.name: display-options
attributes.description: Customize how to display to the user the form field's messages, converter and validator hints and help instruction text.

attributes.name: help
attributes.description:
Form component help information.

The properties supported on the help option are:

attributes.name: help-hints
attributes.description: Represents hints for an oj-form-layout element to render help information on the label of the editable component.

attributes.name: keyboard-edit
attributes.description: Determines if keyboard entry of the text is allowed. When disabled the picker must be used to select a date. Default value depends on the theme. In alta-android, alta-ios and alta-windows themes, the default is "disabled" and it's "enabled" for alta web theme.

attributes.name: label-hint
attributes.description: Represents a hint for oj-form-layout element to render a label on the editable component.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: The maximum selectable date (ISO string). When set to null, there is no maximum.

attributes.name: messages-custom
attributes.description: List of messages an app would add to the component

attributes.name: min
attributes.description: The minimum selectable date (in ISO string format). When set to null, there is no minimum.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: It indicates the name of the component.

attributes.name: picker-attributes
attributes.description: Attributes specified here will be set on the picker DOM element when it's launched. The supported attributes are class and style, which are appended to the picker's class and style, if any. Note: 1) pickerAttributes is not applied in the native theme. 2) setting this property after element creation has no effect.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: The placeholder text to set on the element.

attributes.name: raw-value
attributes.description:
The rawValue is the read-only property for retrieving
the current value from the input field in string form. The main consumer of
rawValue is a converter.

The rawValue updates on the 'input' javascript event,
so the rawValue changes as the value of the input is changed.
If the user types in '1,200' into the field, the rawValue will be '1', then '1,', then '1,2',
..., and finally '1,200'. Then when the user blurs or presses
Enter the value property gets converted and validated
(if there is a converter or validators) and then gets updated if valid.

This is a read-only attribute so page authors cannot set or change it directly.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: Dictates component's readonly state.

attributes.name: render-mode
attributes.description: Allows applications to specify whether to render date picker in JET or as a native picker control. Default value depends on the theme. In alta-android, alta-ios and alta-windows themes, the default is "native" and it's "jet" for alta web theme.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description:
Whether the component is required or optional. When required is set to true, an implicit
required validator is created using the validator factory -
oj.Validation.validatorFactory(oj.ValidatorFactory.VALIDATOR_TYPE_REQUIRED).createValidator().

Translations specified using the translations.required attribute
and the label associated with the component, are passed through to the options parameter of the
createValidator method.


When required property changes due to programmatic intervention,
the component may clear messages and run validation, based on the current state it's in. 

Running Validation

if component is valid when required is set to true, then it runs deferred validation on
the value property. This is to ensure errors are not flagged unnecessarily.

if component is invalid and has deferred messages when required is set to false, then
component messages are cleared but no deferred validation is run.

if component is invalid and currently showing invalid messages when required is set, then
component messages are cleared and normal validation is run using the current display value. if there are validation errors, then value property is not updated and the error is shown. if no errors result from the validation, the value property is updated; page author can listen to the valueChanged event on the component to clear custom errors.




Clearing Messages

Only messages created by the component are cleared.
messagesCustom property is not cleared.




This property set to false implies that a value is not required to be provided by the user.
This is the default.
This property set to true implies that a value is required to be provided by user and the
input's label will render a required icon. Additionally a required validator -
RequiredValidator - is implicitly used if no explicit required validator is set.
An explicit required validator can be set by page authors using the validators attribute.

attributes.name: translations
attributes.description: A collection of translated resources from the translation bundle, or null if this component has no resources.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: The validity state of the component

attributes.name: validators
attributes.description: List of validators used by element along with the implicit component validators when performing validation. Each item is either an instance that duck types Validator, or is an Object literal containing the properties listed below. Implicit validators are created by the element when certain attributes are present. For example, if the required attribute is set, an implicit RequiredValidator is created. If the min and/or max attribute is set, an implicit DateTimeRangeValidator is created. If the dayFormatter attribute is set, an implicit DateRestrictionValidator is created. At runtime when the component runs validation, it combines all the implicit validators with all the validators specified through this validators attribute, and runs all of them. Hints exposed by validators are shown in the notewindow by default, or as determined by the 'validatorHint' property set on the displayOptions property. When validators property changes due to programmatic intervention, the element may decide to clear messages and run validation, based on the current state it is in. Steps Performed Always The cached list of validator instances are cleared and new validator hints is pushed to messaging. E.g., notewindow displays the new hint(s). Running Validation if element is valid when validators changes, element does nothing other than the steps it always performs. if element is invalid and is showing messages when validators changes then all element messages are cleared and full validation run using the display value on the element. if there are validation errors, then value property is not updated and the error is shown. if no errors result from the validation, the value property is updated; page author can listen to the valueChanged event to clear custom errors. if element is invalid and has deferred messages when validators changes, it does nothing other than the steps it performs always. Clearing Messages Only messages created by the element are cleared. messagesCustom property is not cleared.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of the InputDate element which should be an ISOString. When the attribute is not set, the element's value attribute is used as its initial value if it exists. This value must be an ISOString.

attributes.name: converter.type
attributes.description: the converter type registered with the oj.ConverterFactory. Usually 'datetime'. See DateTimeConverterFactory for details. E.g., {converter: {type: 'datetime'}

attributes.name: converter.options
attributes.description: optional Object literal of options that the converter expects. See IntlDateTimeConverter for options supported by the jet datetime converter. E.g., {converter: {type: 'datetime', options: {formatType: 'date'}}

attributes.name: date-picker.change-month
attributes.description: Whether the month should be rendered as a button to allow selection instead of text. See the date-picker attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: date-picker.change-year
attributes.description: Whether the year should be rendered as a button to allow selection instead of text. See the date-picker attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: date-picker.current-month-pos
attributes.description: The position in multipe months at which to show the current month (starting at 0). See the date-picker attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: date-picker.days-outside-month
attributes.description: Dictates the behavior of days outside the current viewing month. See the date-picker attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: date-picker.footer-layout
attributes.description: Will dictate what content is shown within the footer of the calendar. See the date-picker attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: date-picker.number-of-months
attributes.description: The number of months to show at once. Note that if one is using a numberOfMonths > 4 then one should define a CSS rule for the width of each of the months. For example if numberOfMonths is set to 6 then one should define a CSS rule .oj-datepicker-multi-6 .oj-datepicker-group providing the width each month should take in percentage. See the date-picker attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: date-picker.show-on
attributes.description: When the datepicker should be shown. See the date-picker attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: date-picker.step-big-months
attributes.description: Number of months to step back/forward for the (Alt + Page up) + (Alt + Page down) key strokes. See the date-picker attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: date-picker.step-months
attributes.description: How the prev + next will step back/forward the months. The following are the valid values: "numberOfMonths" - When set to this string, will use numberOfMonths property value as value. <number> - Number of months to step back/forward. See the date-picker attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: date-picker.week-display
attributes.description: Whether week of the year will be shown. See the date-picker attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: date-picker.year-range
attributes.description: The range of years displayed in the year drop-down: either relative to today's year ("-nn:+nn"), relative to the currently selected year ("c-nn:c+nn"), absolute ("nnnn:nnnn"), or combinations of these formats ("nnnn:-nn"). See the date-picker attribute for usage examples.

tags.name: oj-input-date
tags.description: Provides basic support for specifying a date value.

attributes.name: async-validators
attributes.description:
List of asynchronous validators used by the component when performing validation.
Use async-validators when you need to
perform some validation work on the server. Otherwise, use
validators, which are synchronous.

Each item in the Array is an instance that duck types AsyncValidator.
Implicit validators created by a component when certain attributes
are present (e.g. required attribute) are separate from
validators specified through the async-validators
attribute and the validators attribute.
At runtime when the component runs validation, it
combines the implicit validators with the list specified through the
validators
attribute and also the list specified through the
async-validators attribute.
Error messages are shown as soon as each async validator returns;
we do not wait until all the async validators finish to show errors.
If the component's valid state changes for the worse, it is also updated
as each validator returns so valid will be invalidShown
as soon as the first validator has an Error. It is recommended that you show the
value you are validating in the error message because if the async operation takes a while,
the user could be typing in a new value when the error message comes back
and might be confused what value the error is for. However, if the user enters a new value
(like presses Enter or Tab), a new validation lifecycle will start
and validation errors for the previous value will not be shown to the user.
If you need to format the value for the error message,
you can use
oj.IntlConverterUtils.getConverterInstance(converterOption)
to get the converter instance,
then call converter.format(value).


Hints exposed by async-validators and validators are shown in the notewindow by default,
or as determined by the 'validatorHint' property set on the
display-options attribute.

Since async validators are run asynchronously, you should wait on the BusyContext before
you check valid property or the value property. Alternatively you can add a callback to
the onValidChanged or ojValueChanged events.


The steps performed always, running validation and clearing messages is the same as
for the inputBase#validators attribute.

attributes.name: autocomplete
attributes.description: Dictates component's autocomplete state.

attributes.name: autofocus
attributes.description:
Autofocus is a Boolean that reflects the autofocus attribute, If it is set to true
then the associated component will get input focus when the page is loaded.
Setting this property doesn't set the focus to the component:
it tells the browser to focus to it when the element is inserted in the document.

attributes.name: converter
attributes.description:
Default converter for InputDateTime

If one wishes to provide a custom converter for the InputDateTime override the factory returned for
oj.Validation.converterFactory(oj.ConverterFactory.CONVERTER_TYPE_DATETIME)

When converter property changes due to programmatic
intervention, the element performs various tasks based on the current state it is in. 

Steps Performed Always

Any cached converter instance is cleared and new converter created. The converter hint is
pushed to messaging. E.g., notewindow displays the new hint(s).



Running Validation

if element is valid when converter property changes, the
display value is refreshed.
if element is invalid and is showing messages when
converter property changes then all element messages are
cleared and full validation run using the current display value on the element. if there are validation errors, then value property is not updated, and the error is shown. The display value is not refreshed in this case. if no errors result from the validation, the value property is updated; page author can listen to the onValueChanged event to clear custom errors. The display value is refreshed with the formatted value provided by converter.


if element is invalid and has deferred messages when converter property changes, the display value is again refreshed with the formatted value provided by converter.


Clearing Messages

Only messages created by the element are cleared.
messagesCustom property is not cleared.
Page authors can
choose to clear it explicitly when setting the converter option.

attributes.name: date-picker
attributes.description: Note that Jet framework prohibits setting subset of properties which are object types. For example myInputDate.datePicker = {footerLayout: "today"}; is prohibited as it will wipe out all other sub-properties for "datePicker" object. If one wishes to do this [by above syntax or knockout] one will have to get the "datePicker" object, modify the necessary sub-property and pass it to above syntax. Default values for the datePicker sub-properties can also be overridden with the theming variable $inputDateTimeDatePickerOptionDefault, which is merged with other defaults. Note that all of the datePicker sub-properties except showOn are not available when renderMode is 'native'.

attributes.name: day-formatter
attributes.description: Additional info to be used when rendering the day This should be a JavaScript Function reference which accepts as its argument the following JSON format {fullYear: Date.getFullYear(), month: Date.getMonth()+1, date: Date.getDate()} and returns null or all or partial JSON data of {disabled: true|false, className: "additionalCSS", tooltip: 'Stuff to display'}

attributes.name: day-meta-data
attributes.description: Additional info to be used when rendering the day This should be in the following JSON format with the year, month, day based on Date.getFullYear(), Date.getMonth()+1, and Date.getDate(): {year: {month: {day: {disabled: true|false, className: "additionalCSS", tooltip: 'Stuff to display'}}} There also exists a special '*' character which represents ALL within that field [i.e. * within year, represents for ALL year]. Note that this property will override the value of the dayFormatter property. Setting both dayFormatter and dayMetaData properties is not supported.

The rawValue updates on the 'input' javascript event,

attributes.name: render-mode
attributes.description:
Allows applications to specify whether to render date and time pickers
in JET or as a native picker control.

Valid values: jet, native

Default value depends on the theme. In alta-android, alta-ios and alta-windows themes, the
default is "native" and it's "jet" for alta web theme. jet - Applications get full JET functionality. native - Applications get the functionality of the native picker. Note that the native picker support is limited to Cordova plugin published at 'https://github.com/VitaliiBlagodir/cordova-plugin-datepicker'. With native renderMode, the functionality that is sacrificed compared to jet renderMode are: Date and time pickers cannot be themed Accessibility is limited to what the native picker supports pickerAttributes is not applied Sub-IDs are not available hide() and hideTimePicker() functions are no-op translations sub properties pertaining to the picker is not available All of the 'datepicker' sub-properties except 'showOn' are not available 'timePicker.timeIncrement' property is limited to iOS and will only take a precision of minutes

attributes.name: time-picker
attributes.description:
Note that Jet framework prohibits setting subset of properties which are object types.
For example myInputDateTime.timePicker = {timeIncrement: "00:30:00:00"}; is prohibited as it will
wipe out all other sub-properties for "timePicker" object. If one wishes to do this [by above syntax or knockout] one
will have to get the "timePicker" object, modify the necessary sub-property and pass it to above syntax.

attributes.name: valid

attributes.name: validators
attributes.description:
List of validators used by element when performing validation. Each item is either an
instance that duck types Validator, or is an Object literal containing the
properties listed below.

Implicit validators are created by the element when certain attributes are present.
For example, if the required
attribute is set, an implicit RequiredValidator is created. If the
min and/or max attribute
is set, an implicit DateTimeRangeValidator is created. If the
dayFormatter attribute is set,
an implicit DateRestrictionValidator is created.
At runtime when the component runs validation, it
combines all the implicit validators with all the validators
specified through this validators attribute, and runs
all of them.


Hints exposed by validators are shown in the notewindow by default, or as determined by the
'validatorHint' property set on the displayOptions
property.



When validators property changes due to programmatic
intervention, the element may decide to clear messages and run validation, based on the
current state it is in. 

Steps Performed Always

The cached list of validator instances are cleared and new validator hints is pushed to
messaging. E.g., notewindow displays the new hint(s).



Running Validation

if element is valid when validators changes, element does nothing other than the
steps it always performs.
if element is invalid and is showing messages when
validators changes then all element messages are cleared
and full validation run using the display value on the element. if there are validation errors, then value property is not updated and the error is shown. if no errors result from the validation, the value property is updated; page author can listen to the valueChanged event to clear custom errors.


if element is invalid and has deferred messages when validators changes, it does
nothing other than the steps it performs always.



Clearing Messages

Only messages created by the element are cleared.
messagesCustom property is not cleared.
