attributes.name: display-options
attributes.description: Specifies the display options for contents of the message.

attributes.name: message
attributes.description: Structured data specifying essential information to display a message on the UI.

attributes.name: translations
attributes.description: A collection of translated resources from the translation bundle, or null if this component has no resources.

attributes.name: display-options.category
attributes.description: Specifies display option for ojMessage#message.category text in this message.

attributes.name: message.auto-timeout
attributes.description:
Specifies the number of milliseconds for which duration the message will be shown before it is
closed automatically.
This attribute can take the number of millisecond or special number values -1 and 0. If the
value is set to "-1", auto-close will be turned off. If the value is set to "0", application wide
value for autoTimeout as specified in a theming variable will be used.

attributes.name: message.category
attributes.description:
Specifies text representing the message category which is shown next to the message icon
If this attribute is not specified, a translated text corresponding to value of
message.severity attribute will be rendered.

attributes.name: message.close-affordance
attributes.description: Specifies the UI affordance provided to end users to be able to close the message.

attributes.name: message.detail
attributes.description: Specifies detail text for the message.

attributes.name: message.icon
attributes.description:
Specifies the URL for the custom image to be used as an icon representing the message.
The icon will be rendered as background image inside a container that is set to size of 16px*16px
in alta-web theme and 10px*20px for all other themes, therefore, the icon chosen must fit this
dimensions.
If this attribute is not specified, a suitable icon corresponding to value of
message.severity will be rendered.

attributes.name: message.severity
attributes.description: Specifies the severity of message.

attributes.name: message.sound
attributes.description:
Specifies the sound to be played when a message is opened. Sound is an accessibility feature
required for low vision users who view a zoomed section of the UI. Because messages may be shown
outside of the zoomed section, such users require sound to be played to notify of new messages.

This attribute can take a URL of the audio file for the custom sound to be played. The
supported formats are mp3, wav and ogg. Browser support should also be considered while choosing
the format of the audio file. Literal string values
"defaults" and "none" can also
be used for this attribute. If the value is set to "none", then the sound will be disabled. If
the value is set to "defaults", then a default sound is played.

The default sound uses Web Audio APIs, which is not yet supported by some browsers, default
sound will not be played in such browsers. Sound will not be played in browsers where auto play
is not enabled. Some of the browsers do not allow auto play, while other browsers may provide a
user preference to enable it.

attributes.name: message.summary
attributes.description: Specifies summary text for the message.

attributes.name: message.timestamp
attributes.description:
Specifies timestamp for the message to be displayed in the message header. timestamp could represent the date and time at which the message was created, or otherwise
could pertain to the event for which the message was created. For example, a timestamp for an
upcoming meeting could be set in the future, whereas a timestamp for a missed message could be set
in the past. This specified value must be an ISOString. A default converter is used to convert and format
the value suitable for displaying in the message. This default convertor used such will be an
implementation detail and could change in future.

attributes.name: translations.categories
attributes.description:
Category text to be displayed for the messages of different severity levels

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.label-close-icon
attributes.description:
Label for the message close button.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.categories.confirmation
attributes.description:
Category text for the 'confirmation' severity level

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.categories.error
attributes.description:
Category text for the 'error' severity level

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.categories.info
attributes.description:
Category text for the 'info' severity level

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.categories.warning
attributes.description:
Category text for the 'warning' severity level

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: on-display-options-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'displayOptions' attribute

attributes.name: on-message-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'message' attribute

attributes.name: on-translations-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'translations' attribute

attributes.name: on-oj-close
attributes.description:
Triggered after the message is closed through user interaction or due to calling
close() method.

attributes.name: on-oj-animate-start
attributes.description:
Triggered when the default animation is about to start for the open or close actions of the message .
The default animation can be cancelled by calling
event.preventDefault.

In order to override open animation, the ojAnimateStart event listener needs to be
registered before the component is created. This means that onOjAnimateStart
cannot be used to register listener for 'open' action because it doesn't exist
until the component is upgraded or created at which time it is open. For the 'open' action, use
the addEventListener method on the associated oj-message elements or
on-oj-animate-start attribute to register a listener instead.

attributes.name: on-oj-animate-end
attributes.description:
Triggered when the default animation is about to end for the open or close actions of the message.
The default animation can be cancelled by calling
event.preventDefault.

tags.name: oj-message
tags.description: Displays a message

attributes.name: display
attributes.description:
Specifies the display purpose of messages. The valid values for display are
general and notification.
General messages are commonly rendered at the page level or section level, relating to the task
the user performed. Notification messages are typically used for reporting asynchronous events,
or to communicate some background activity.

The presentation of the message is inline by default. However, when a
ojMessages#positionproperty is provided, the presentation will be an overlay.
The alignment of the overlay will default based on the display property. The
defaults are defined by the theme.

attributes.name: display-options
attributes.description:
Specifies the display options for contents of all the messages specified for the
ojMessages#messages attribute.

attributes.name: messages
attributes.description:
Specifies the collection of structured message data used to display the individual messages.
Instead of providing multiple oj-message as children, this property can be used to conveniently
specify the required data as a single collection. Individual message will be automatically
created based on this data. See ojMessage.Message for message values. More information about the structured 'Message' data can be found in documentation for
'message' attribute of oj-message element.

The collection can be two types:
an array of oj.ojMessage.Message objects.
oj.ArrayDataProvider of oj.ojMessage.Message objects. Look at ArrayDataProvider for more available options.

attributes.name: position
attributes.description:
The position property defines the presentation style. The default presentation is inline,
defined by a null position property value. When a value is provide for the
property, the presentation style will be an overaly "popup". The aligment of the overaly
is defined by the position sub-properties.

Default position sub-properites are extended by the provided value. Defaults vary
based on the display property and provided by theme. The position
property is used to establish the location where the messages popup overlay will appear
relative to another element.

The "my" and "at" properties defines aligment points relative to the popup and other
element. The "my" property represents the popups alignment where the "at" property
represents the other element that can be identified by "of" or defauts to the launcher
when the popup opens. The values of these properties describe horizontal and
vertical alignments.

attributes.name: translations
attributes.description: A collection of translated resources from the translation bundle, or null if this component has no resources.

attributes.name: display-options.category
attributes.description:
Specifies display option for ojMessage#message.category text in all the messages
specified for the ojMessages#messages attribute.

attributes.name: position.at
attributes.description:
Defines which position on the target element ("of") to align the positioned element
against.

attributes.name: position.collision
attributes.description: Rule for alternate alignment.

attributes.name: position.my
attributes.description: Defines which edge on the messages overlay to align with the target ("of") element.

attributes.name: position.of
attributes.description:
Which element to position the messages overlay against.

If the value is a string, it should be a selector or the literal string value
of window. Otherwise, a point of x,y. When a point
is used, the values are relative to the whole document. Page horizontal and vertical
scroll offsets need to be factored into this point - see UIEvent
pageX,
pageY.

attributes.name: position.offset
attributes.description: Defines a point offset in pixels from the ("my") alignment.

attributes.name: position.at.horizontal
attributes.description: Defines the horizontal alignment of what the messges overlay is aligned to.

attributes.name: position.at.vertical
attributes.description: Defines the vertical alignment of what the messages overlay is aligned to.

attributes.name: position.my.horizontal
attributes.description: Defines the horizontal alignment of the messages overlay.

attributes.name: position.my.vertical
attributes.description: Defines the vertical alignment of the messages overlay.

attributes.name: position.offset.x
attributes.description: Horizontal aligment offset.

attributes.name: position.offset.y
attributes.description: Vertical alignment offset.

attributes.name: translations.aria-live-region
attributes.description:
Various contextual live region texts that oj-messages component will use for accessibility purpose.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.label-landmark
attributes.description:
Label for the landmark region for accessibility.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.aria-live-region.navigation-from-keyboard
attributes.description:

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.aria-live-region.navigation-to-touch
attributes.description:

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.aria-live-region.new-message
attributes.description:
Text representing the new displayed message. This text may contain tokens '{category}' and '{summary}', which will be replaced by the corresponding sub-property values in the data for the new message.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: animation-on-data-change
attributes.description: Specifies the animation that is applied on data changes.

attributes.name: animation-on-display
attributes.description: Specifies the animation that is shown on initial display.

attributes.name: as
attributes.description: An alias for the $current context variable when referenced inside nodeTemplate when using a DataProvider.

attributes.name: cell-content
attributes.description: The content the cells will display. "auto" switches between nodes and cell counts based on available space. "counts" forces the NBox to always render cell counts.

attributes.name: cell-maximize
attributes.description: Whether or not the cell maximize/de-maximize gestures are enabled.

attributes.name: cells
attributes.description: The list of cells. Also accepts a Promise for deferred data rendering. No data will be rendered if the Promise is rejected.

attributes.name: columns
attributes.description: The list of columns. Also accepts a Promise for deferred data rendering. No data will be rendered if the Promise is rejected.

attributes.name: columns-title
attributes.description: The text for the title on the column edge.

attributes.name: count-label
attributes.description: A function that returns custom text for the cell count labels.

attributes.name: data
attributes.description: The oj.DataProvider for the NBox. It should provide rows where each row corresponds to a single NBox node.

attributes.name: group-attributes
attributes.description: An array of attributes to style the group nodes with. Any attributes not listed will be ignored.

attributes.name: group-behavior
attributes.description: Specifies how nodes should be grouped.

attributes.name: hidden-categories
attributes.description: An array of category strings used for category filtering. Data items with a category in hiddenCategories will be filtered.

attributes.name: highlight-match
attributes.description: The matching condition for the highlightedCategories property. By default, highlightMatch is 'all' and only items whose categories match all of the values specified in the highlightedCategories array will be highlighted. If highlightMatch is 'any', then items that match at least one of the highlightedCategories values will be highlighted.

attributes.name: highlighted-categories
attributes.description: An array of category strings used for category highlighting. Data items with a category in highlightedCategories will be highlighted.

attributes.name: hover-behavior
attributes.description: Defines the behavior applied when hovering over data items.

attributes.name: label-truncation
attributes.description: Determines node label truncation behavior. Labels are always truncated if limited by container (e.g. cell, dialog) width. Optionally, NBox can further truncate node labels to increase the number of nodes visible to the user. "on" allows label truncation to increase number of visible nodes. "ifRequired" only allows truncation when limited by container width.

attributes.name: maximized-column
attributes.description: The id of the column to be maximized.

attributes.name: maximized-row
attributes.description: The id of the row to be maximized.

attributes.name: nodes
attributes.description: The list of nodes. Also accepts a Promise for deferred data rendering. No data will be rendered if the Promise is rejected.

attributes.name: other-color
attributes.description: The color for the "other" group nodes.

attributes.name: other-threshold
attributes.description: The threshold for aggregating nodes into an "other" group node.

attributes.name: rows
attributes.description: The list of rows. Also accepts a Promise for deferred data rendering. No data will be rendered if the Promise is rejected.

attributes.name: rows-title
attributes.description: The text for the title on the row edge.

attributes.name: selection
attributes.description: An array containing the ids of the selected nodes.

attributes.name: selection-mode
attributes.description: Specifies the selection mode.

attributes.name: style-defaults
attributes.description: An object defining the style defaults for this NBox.

attributes.name: tooltip
attributes.description: An object containing an optional callback function for tooltip customization.

attributes.name: touch-response
attributes.description: Data visualizations require a press and hold delay before triggering tooltips and rollover effects on mobile devices to avoid interfering with page panning, but these hold delays can make applications seem slower and less responsive. For a better user experience, the application can remove the touch and hold delay when data visualizations are used within a non scrolling container or if there is sufficient space outside of the visualization for panning. If touchResponse is touchStart the element will instantly trigger the touch gesture and consume the page pan events if the element does not require an internal feature that requires a touch start gesture like scrolling. If touchResponse is auto, the element will behave like touchStart if it determines that it is not rendered within scrolling content and if panning is not available for those elements that support the feature.

attributes.name: track-resize
attributes.description: Defines whether the element will automatically render in response to changes in size. If set to off, then the application is responsible for calling refresh to render the element at the new size.

attributes.name: translations
attributes.description: A collection of translated resources from the translation bundle, or null if this component has no resources.

attributes.name: count-label.row
attributes.description: The row value of the cell.

attributes.name: count-label.column
attributes.description: The column value of the cell.

attributes.name: count-label.node-count
attributes.description: The number of non-hidden nodes in the cell.

attributes.name: count-label.total-node-count
attributes.description: The number of non-hidden nodes in the NBox.

attributes.name: count-label.highlighted-node-count
attributes.description: The number of highlighted nodes in the cell.

attributes.name: style-defaults.animation-duration
attributes.description: The duration of the animations in milliseconds. The default value comes from the CSS and varies based on theme.

attributes.name: style-defaults.cell-defaults
attributes.description: An object defining the style defaults for cells.

attributes.description: The CSS style object defining the style of the columns title. The default value comes from the CSS and varies based on theme.

attributes.name: style-defaults.hover-behavior-delay
attributes.description: Specifies initial hover delay in ms for highlighting data items.

attributes.name: style-defaults.rows-title-style

attributes.name: style-defaults.cell-defaults.label-halign
attributes.description: The halign value for the cell label.

attributes.name: style-defaults.cell-defaults.label-style
attributes.description: The CSS style object defining the style of the cell labels. The default value comes from the CSS and varies based on theme.

attributes.name: style-defaults.cell-defaults.maximized-svg-style
attributes.description: The CSS style object defining the styles of the cell background and border when the cell is maximized. The default value comes from the CSS and varies based on theme.

attributes.name: style-defaults.cell-defaults.minimized-svg-style
attributes.description: The CSS style object defining the styles of the cell background and border when the cell is minimized. The default value comes from the CSS and varies based on theme.

attributes.name: style-defaults.cell-defaults.show-count
attributes.description: Determines when to display the cell count label.

attributes.name: style-defaults.cell-defaults.svg-style

attributes.name: style-defaults.node-defaults.border-color
attributes.description: The default color of the node borders. The default value varies based on theme.

attributes.name: style-defaults.node-defaults.border-width
attributes.description: The default width of the node borders. The default value varies based on theme.

attributes.name: style-defaults.node-defaults.color

attributes.name: style-defaults.node-defaults.icon-defaults

attributes.name: style-defaults.node-defaults.indicator-color

attributes.name: style-defaults.node-defaults.label-style
attributes.description: The CSS style object defining the style of the node labels. The default value comes from the CSS and varies based on theme.

attributes.name: style-defaults.node-defaults.secondary-label-style
attributes.description: The CSS style object defining the style of the node secondary labels. The default value comes from the CSS and varies based on theme.

attributes.name: style-defaults.node-defaults.icon-defaults.border-color
attributes.description: The default border color of the node icons. The default value varies based on theme.

attributes.name: style-defaults.node-defaults.icon-defaults.border-radius
attributes.description: The default border radius of the node icons. CSS border-radius values accepted. Note that non-% values (including unitless) get interpreted as 'px'. The default value varies based on theme.

attributes.name: style-defaults.node-defaults.icon-defaults.border-width
attributes.description: The default border width of the node icons. The default value varies based on theme.

attributes.name: style-defaults.node-defaults.icon-defaults.color
attributes.description: The default fill color of the node icons.

attributes.name: style-defaults.node-defaults.icon-defaults.height
attributes.description: The default height of the node icons. If the value is 0, the height will be automatically based on the remaining node contents.

attributes.name: style-defaults.node-defaults.icon-defaults.opacity
attributes.description: The default opacity of the node icons.

attributes.name: style-defaults.node-defaults.icon-defaults.pattern
attributes.description: The default fill pattern of the node icons.

attributes.name: style-defaults.node-defaults.icon-defaults.shape
attributes.description: The default shape of the node icons. Can take the name of a built-in shape or the svg path commands for a custom shape.

attributes.name: style-defaults.node-defaults.icon-defaults.source
attributes.description: The URL of an image to display by default for the node icons.

attributes.name: style-defaults.node-defaults.icon-defaults.width
attributes.description: The default width of the node icons. If the value is 0, the width will be automatically based on the remaining node contents.

attributes.name: style-defaults.node-defaults.indicator-icon-defaults.border-color
attributes.description: The default border color of the node indicator icons. The default value varies based on theme.

attributes.name: style-defaults.node-defaults.indicator-icon-defaults.border-radius
attributes.description: The default border radius of the node indicator icons. CSS border-radius values accepted. Note that non-% values (including unitless) get interpreted as 'px'. The default value varies based on theme.

attributes.name: style-defaults.node-defaults.indicator-icon-defaults.border-width

attributes.name: style-defaults.node-defaults.indicator-icon-defaults.height

attributes.name: style-defaults.node-defaults.indicator-icon-defaults.opacity
attributes.description: The default opacity of the node indicator icons.

attributes.name: style-defaults.node-defaults.indicator-icon-defaults.pattern

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer
attributes.description: A function that returns a custom tooltip for the NBox nodes. The function takes a dataContext argument, provided by the NBox. The function should return an Object that contains only one of the two properties: insert: HTMLElement | string - An HTML element, which will be appended to the tooltip, or a tooltip string. preventDefault: true - Indicates that the tooltip should not be displayed. It is not necessary to return {preventDefault:false} to display tooltip, since this is a default behavior.

tags.name: oj-n-box
tags.description: An interactive data visualization (typically found in Human Capital Management applications) in which employees are grouped and compared across two dimensions.  Each dimension can be split into multiple ranges.

attributes.name: border-color
attributes.description: The color of the node border.

attributes.name: border-width
attributes.description: The width of the node border.

attributes.name: categories
attributes.description:
An optional array of additional category strings corresponding to this data item. This enables highlighting and filtering of individual data items through interactions with other visualization elements.
Defaults to node's id if unspecified

attributes.name: color
attributes.description: The background color of this node.

attributes.name: column
attributes.description: The column id for this node.

attributes.name: group-category
attributes.description: The group category this node belongs to. Nodes with the same groupCategory will be grouped together.

attributes.name: icon
attributes.description: Defines the primary icon for this node.

attributes.name: indicator-color
attributes.description: The background color for the indicator section of this node.

attributes.name: indicator-icon
attributes.description: Defines the indicator icon for this node.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The text for the node label.

attributes.name: row
attributes.description: The row id for this node.

attributes.name: secondary-label
attributes.description: The text for the secondary node label.

attributes.name: short-desc
attributes.description: The description of the node. This is used for customizing the tooltip text.

attributes.name: svg-class-name
attributes.description: The CSS style class defining the style of the node text.

attributes.name: svg-style

attributes.name: animation-duration
attributes.description: The duration of the animations, in milliseconds. The default value comes from the CSS and varies based on theme.

attributes.description: The animation when the data changes.

attributes.name: as
attributes.description: An alias for the $current context variable when referenced inside itemTemplate when using a DataProvider.

attributes.name: column-count
attributes.description: The number of columns that the picto chart has. The number of columns will be automatically computed if not specified.

attributes.name: column-width
attributes.description: The width of a column in pixels. The width of columns will be automatically computed if not specified. Setting this property in a fixed layout (when the element width and height are defined) may cause items to be truncated.

attributes.name: data
attributes.description: The oj.DataProvider for the picto chart. It should provide rows where each row corresponds to a single picto chart item.

attributes.name: drilling
attributes.description: Whether drilling is enabled. Drillable items will show a pointer cursor on hover and fire an ojDrill event on click (double click if selection is enabled). To enable or disable drilling on individual items, use the drilling attribute in each item.

attributes.name: hidden-categories
attributes.description: An array of category strings used for category filtering. Data items with a category in hiddenCategories will be filtered.

attributes.name: highlight-match
attributes.description: The matching condition for the highlightedCategories property. By default, highlightMatch is 'all' and only items whose categories match all of the values specified in the highlightedCategories array will be highlighted. If highlightMatch is 'any', then items that match at least one of the highlightedCategories values will be highlighted.

attributes.name: highlighted-categories
attributes.description: An array of category strings used for category highlighting. Data items with a category in highlightedCategories will be highlighted.

attributes.name: hover-behavior
attributes.description: The behavior applied when hovering over data items.

attributes.name: hover-behavior-delay
attributes.description: Specifies initial hover delay in ms for highlighting data items.

attributes.name: items
attributes.description: An array of objects with the following properties that defines the pictoChart items.

attributes.name: layout
attributes.description: The direction in which the items are laid out.

attributes.name: layout-origin
attributes.description: Defines where the first item is rendered. The subsequent items follow the first item according to the layout.

attributes.name: row-count
attributes.description: The number of rows that the picto chart has. The number of rows will be automatically computed if not specified.

attributes.name: row-height
attributes.description: The height of a row in pixels. The height of rows will be automatically computed if not specified. Setting this property in a fixed layout (when the element width and height are defined) may cause items to be truncated.

attributes.name: selection
attributes.description: An array of id strings, used to define the selected objects.

attributes.name: selection-mode
attributes.description: The type of selection behavior that is enabled on the picto chart.

attributes.name: tooltip
attributes.description: A function that returns a custom tooltip. The function takes a dataContext argument, provided by the picto chart. The function should return an Object that contains only one of the two properties: insert: HTMLElement | string - An HTML element, which will be appended to the tooltip, or a tooltip string. preventDefault: true - Indicates that the tooltip should not be displayed. It is not necessary to return {preventDefault:false} to display tooltip, since this is a default behavior.

attributes.name: track-resize
attributes.description: Defines whether the element will automatically render in response to changes in size. If set to off, then the application is responsible for calling refresh to render the element at the new size.

attributes.name: translations
attributes.description: A collection of translated resources from the translation bundle, or null if this component has no resources.

attributes.description: The tooltip element. The function can directly modify or append content to this element.

attributes.description: The name of the hovered item.

attributes.description: The count of the hovered item.

attributes.description: The color of the hovered item.

attributes.description: The picto chart HTML element.

tags.name: oj-picto-chart
tags.description: Displays information using icons to visualize an absolute number or the relative sizes of the different parts of a population.

attributes.name: border-color
attributes.description: The border color of the item. Does not apply if custom image is specified.

attributes.name: border-width
attributes.description: The border width of the item in pixels. Does not apply if custom image is specified.

attributes.name: categories
attributes.description: An array of category strings corresponding to the picto chart items. This allows highlighting and filtering of items.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description: The color of the item. Does not apply if custom image is specified.

attributes.name: column-span
attributes.description: The number of columns each shape (or custom image) spans. Used for creating a picto chart with mixed item sizes.

attributes.name: count
attributes.description: Specifies the number of times that the shape (or custom image) is drawn. Fractional counts (such as 4.5) are supported; however, fractions other than the multiples of 0.5 should be avoided because the fractional rendering ignores the gaps between shapes and the irregularity of the shapes.

attributes.name: drilling
attributes.description: Whether drilling is enabled for the item. Drillable items will show a pointer cursor on hover and fire an ojDrill event on click (double click if selection is enabled). To enable drilling for all items at once, use the drilling attribute in the top level.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the item. Used for default tooltip and accessibility.

attributes.name: row-span
attributes.description: The number of rows each shape (or custom image) spans. Used for creating a picto chart with mixed item sizes.

attributes.name: shape
attributes.description: The shape of the item. Can take the name of a built-in shape or the svg path commands for a custom shape. "None" will make the item transparent and can be used to create gaps. Does not apply if custom image is specified.

attributes.name: short-desc
attributes.description: The description of the item. This is used for customizing the tooltip text.

attributes.name: source
attributes.description: The URI of the custom image. If specified, it takes precedence over shape.

attributes.name: source-hover
attributes.description: The optional URI for the hover state. If not specified, the source image will be used.

attributes.name: source-hover-selected
attributes.description: The optional URI for the hover selected state. If not specified, the source image will be used.

attributes.name: source-selected
attributes.description: The optional URI for the selected state. If not specified, the source image will be used.

attributes.name: svg-class-name
attributes.description: The CSS style class to apply to the item. The style class and inline style will override any other styling specified with other properties. For tooltip interactivity, it's recommended to also pass a representative color to the item color attribute. Does not apply if custom image is specified.

attributes.name: svg-style
attributes.description: The inline style to apply to the item. The style class and inline style will override any other styling specified with other properties. For tooltip interactivity, it's recommended to also pass a representative color to the item color attribute. Does not apply if custom image is specified.

attributes.name: auto-dismiss
attributes.description:
Defines conditions that will cause an open popup to auto close dismiss. A value of
focusLoss defines the dismissal condition where focus
has left the content of the popup or from the associated launcher or if what the popup
is aligned to is not fully visible within an overflow area.

attributes.name: chrome
attributes.description:
Defines the presents of border, shadow and background color of the root popup dom.
Value of none applies the
oj-popup-no-chrome selector defined by the active
theme to the root dom of the popup to remove the default chrome.

attributes.name: initial-focus
attributes.description:
Determines if the popup should steal focus to its content when initially open. A value
of none prevents the popup from grabbing focus when
open.

attributes.name: modality
attributes.description:
Determines if the popup should block user input of the page behind with a blocking
overlay pane.

The default modality varies by theme. Each theme can set its default by setting
$popupModalityOptionDefault.

attributes.name: position
attributes.description:
Position property is used to establish the location the popup will appear relative to
another element. ojPopup.Position defines "my" alignment "at" the alignment
"of" some other thing which can be "offset" by so many pixels.

The "my" and "at" properties defines aligment points relative to the popup and other
element. The "my" property represents the popups alignment where the "at" property
represents the other element that can be identified by "of" or defauts to the launcher
when the popup opens. The values of these properties describe horizontal and
vertical alignments.

Deprecated v3.0.0 jQuery UI position syntax; Use of a percent unit with
"my" or "at" is not supported.

attributes.name: tail
attributes.description:
Determines if a decoration will be displayed from the popup that points to the element
the popup is aligned to. The simple value enables the
tail defined by the current theme. In addtion, the
oj-popup-tail-simple selector will be applied to the
root dom element. This is to allow the box-shadow, z-index and other chrome styling to
vary per tail decoration.

attributes.name: translations
attributes.description: A collection of translated resources from the translation bundle, or null if this component has no resources.

attributes.name: position.at
attributes.description:
Defines which position on the target element ("of") to align the positioned element
against.

attributes.name: position.collision
attributes.description: Rule for alternate alignment.

attributes.name: position.my
attributes.description: Defines which edge on the popup to align with the target ("of") element.

attributes.name: position.of
attributes.description:
Which element to position the popup against. The default is the
launcher argument passed to the
open method.

If the value is a string, it should be a selector or the literal string value
of window. Otherwise, a point of x,y. When a point
is used, the values are relative to the whole document. Page horizontal and vertical
scroll offsets need to be factored into this point - see UIEvent
pageX,
pageY.

attributes.name: position.offset
attributes.description: Defines a point offset in pixels from the ("my") alignment.

attributes.name: position.at.horizontal
attributes.description: Defines the horizontal alignment of what the popup is aligned to.

attributes.name: position.at.vertical
attributes.description: Defines the vertical alignment of what the popup is aligned to.

attributes.name: position.my.horizontal
attributes.description: Defines the horizontal alignment of the popup.

attributes.name: position.my.vertical
attributes.description: Defines the vertical alignment of the popup.

attributes.name: position.offset.x
attributes.description: Horizontal aligment offset.

attributes.name: position.offset.y
attributes.description: Vertical alignment offset.

attributes.name: translations.aria-close-skip-link
attributes.description:
Label assigned to a hidden anchor tag used for accessibility navigation on platforms supporting VoiceOver. The link is injected as
a sibling to the context area of an open popup and used for ojPopup#close activation.

attributes.name: translations.aria-focus-skip-link
attributes.description:
Label assigned to a hidden anchor tag used for accessibility navigation on platforms supporting VoiceOver. The link is injected as
a sibling to the launcher of an open popup. The launcher is passed as the first argument to ojPopup#open. Activation
of the link will move focus to the content of the associated popup.

attributes.name: translations.aria-live-region-initial-focus-first-focusable

Triggered after the popup is dismissed via the

attributes.name: on-oj-focus
attributes.description:
Triggered after focus has been transfered to the popup. This will occur after the
open() method is called, depending on the value
of the initialFocus property. It's also triggered
when using the F6 key to toggle focus from the associated launcher element
to the content of the popup.

attributes.name: on-oj-animate-start
attributes.description:
Triggered when a default animation is about to start, such as when the component is
being opened/closed or a child item is being added/removed. The default animation can
be cancelled by calling event.preventDefault.

attributes.name: on-oj-animate-end
attributes.description:
Triggered when a default animation has ended, such as when the component is being
opened/closed or a child item is being added/removed. This event is not triggered if
the application has called preventDefault on the animateStart
event.

Form component help information.

The properties supported on the help option are:

attributes.name: help-hints
attributes.description: Represents hints for an oj-form-layout element to render help information on the label of the editable component.

attributes.name: label-hint
attributes.description: Represents a hint for oj-form-layout element to render a label on the editable component.

attributes.name: labelled-by
attributes.description: It is used to establish a relationship between this component and another element. A common use is to tie the oj-label and the oj-radioset together. The oj-label custom element has an id, and you use the labelled-by attribute to tie the two components together.

attributes.description: List of messages an app would add to the component

attributes.description: The renderer function that renders the content of each option.

attributes.description: The option items for the Radioset.

attributes.name: options-keys
attributes.description: Specify the key names to use in the options array. Depending on options-keys means that the signature of the data does not match what is supported by the options attribute.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: Whether the component is readonly. The readOnly property sets or returns whether an element is readOnly, or not. A readOnly element cannot be modified. However, a user can tab to it, highlight it, focus on it, and copy the text from it. If you want to prevent the user from interacting with the element, use the disabled property instead.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Whether the component is required or optional. When required is set to true, an implicit required validator is created using the validator factory - oj.Validation.validatorFactory(oj.ValidatorFactory.VALIDATOR_TYPE_REQUIRED).createValidator(). Translations specified using the translations.required option and the label associated with the component, are passed through to the options parameter of the createValidator method. When required option changes due to programmatic intervention, the component may clears message and run validation, based on the current state it's in. Running Validation if component is valid when required is set to true, then it runs deferred validation on the property value. This is to ensure errors are not flagged unnecessarily. if component is invalid and has deferred messages when required is set to false, then component messages are cleared but no deferred validation is run. if component is invalid and currently showing invalid messages when required is set, then component messages are cleared and normal validation is run using the current display value. if there are validation errors, then value property is not updated and the error is shown. if no errors result from the validation, the value property is updated; page author can listen to the optionChange event to clear custom errors. Clearing Messages Only messages created by the component are cleared. messagesCustom option is not cleared. This property set to false implies that a value is not required to be provided by the user. This is the default. This property set to true implies that a value is required to be provided by user and the input's label will render a required icon. Additionally a required validator - RequiredValidator - is implicitly used if no explicit required validator is set. An explicit required validator can be set by page authors using the validators option. When the option is not set, the element's required property is used as its initial value if it exists.

attributes.name: translations
attributes.description: A collection of translated resources from the translation bundle, or null if this component has no resources.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: The validity state of the component

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of the component. When value option changes due to programmatic intervention, the component always clears all messages and runs deferred validation, and always refreshes UI display value. Clearing Messages All messages are cleared. This includes messagesCustom property. Running Validation component always runs deferred validation

attributes.description: Specifies whether the images provided should show up at their defined aspect ratio. With 'none', the space is allocated evenly, and shapes could be stretched. With 'meet', The aspect ratio of the shape or image is taken into account when space is allocated. When aspect ratios conflict, the aspect ratio of the selectedState will be used.

attributes.name: described-by
attributes.description: described the relationship between this component and another element.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the component is disabled. The disabled attribute is used as its initial value if it exists, when the attribute is not explicitly set. When neither is set, disabled defaults to false.

attributes.name: display-options
attributes.description: Customize how to display to the user the form field's messages, converter and validator hints and help instruction text.

attributes.name: help
attributes.description:
Form component help information.

The properties supported on the help option are:

attributes.name: help-hints
attributes.description: Represents hints for an oj-form-layout element to render help information on the label of the editable component.

attributes.name: label-hint
attributes.description: Represents a hint for oj-form-layout element to render a label on the editable component.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: The maximum value of the slider. The max must not be less than the min, or else an Error is thrown during initialization.

attributes.name: messages-custom
attributes.description: List of messages an app would add to the component

attributes.name: min
attributes.description: The minimum value of the slider. The min must not be greater than the max, or else an Error is thrown during initialization.

attributes.name: orientation
attributes.description: Specify the orientation of the slider.

attributes.name: step
attributes.description: Determines the size or amount of each interval or step the slider takes between min and max. The full specified value of the range (max - min) should be divisible by step.

attributes.name: transient-value
attributes.description: The transientValue is the read-only attribute for retrieving the transient value from the slider. The transientValue updates to display the transient changes of the slider thumb value (subject to the step constraints). The difference in behavior is transientValue will be updated as the thumb is sliding, where as value is updated only after the thumb is released (or after a key press). This is a read-only attribute so page authors cannot set or change it directly.

attributes.name: translations
attributes.description: A collection of translated resources from the translation bundle, or null if this component has no resources.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The slider type determines whether the slider how the value is represented in the UI.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: The validity state of the component

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The numerical value of the slider. Note that the value attribute should be compatible with the type attribute, as described above.

attributes.name: display-options.converter-hint
attributes.description: Display options for auxilliary converter hint text that determines where it should be displayed in relation to the component.

attributes.name: display-options.help-instruction

in relation to the component.

in relation to the component.

this represents advisory information for the component

attributes.name: help-hints.source
attributes.description: Hint for help source URL associated with the label.

attributes.description:
Invalid step value.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.max-min
attributes.description:
Max is greater than min.

tags.name: oj-slider
tags.description: Displays an interactive slider element.

attributes.name: animation-duration
attributes.description: The duration of the animations in milliseconds. The default value comes from the CSS and varies based on theme.

attributes.name: animation-on-data-change
attributes.description: Defines the animation that is applied on data changes.

attributes.name: animation-on-display
attributes.description: Defines the animation that is shown on initial display.

attributes.name: area-color
attributes.description: The color of the area in area or lineWithArea spark chart.

attributes.name: area-svg-class-name
attributes.description: The CSS style class to apply if the type is area or lineWithArea. The style class and inline style will override any other styling specified through the properties. For tooltips and hover interactivity, it's recommended to also pass a representative color to the color attribute.

attributes.name: area-svg-style
attributes.description: The inline style to apply if the type is area or lineWithArea. The style class and inline style will override any other styling specified through the properties. For tooltips and hover interactivity, it's recommended to also pass a representative color to the color attribute.

attributes.name: as
attributes.description: An alias for the $current context variable when referenced inside itemTemplate when using a DataProvider.

attributes.name: bar-gap-ratio
attributes.description: Specifies the width of the bar gap as a ratio of the item width. The valid value is a number from 0 to 1.

attributes.name: baseline-scaling
attributes.description: Defines whether the axis baseline starts at the minimum value of the data or at zero.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description: The color of the data items. The default value varies based on theme.

attributes.name: data
attributes.description: The oj.DataProvider for the spark chart. It should provide rows where each row corresponds to a single spark chart item.

attributes.name: first-color
attributes.description: The color of the first data item.

attributes.name: high-color
attributes.description: The color of the data item with the greatest value.

attributes.name: items
attributes.description: An array of objects with the following properties that defines the data for the spark chart. Also accepts a Promise for deferred data rendering.

attributes.name: last-color
attributes.description: The color of the last data item.

attributes.name: line-style
attributes.description: The line style of the data line. Only applies to line spark charts.

attributes.name: line-type
attributes.description: The line type of the data line or area. Only applies to line and area spark charts.

attributes.name: line-width
attributes.description: The width of the data line. Only applies to line spark charts.

attributes.name: low-color
attributes.description: The color of the data item with the lowest value.

attributes.name: marker-shape
attributes.description: The shape of the data markers. Can take the name of a built-in shape or the svg path commands for a custom shape. Only applies to line and area spark charts.

attributes.name: marker-size
attributes.description: The size of the data markers in pixels. Only applies to line and area spark charts.

attributes.name: reference-objects
attributes.description: An array of objects with the following properties defining the reference objects associated with the y axis of the spark chart.

attributes.name: svg-class-name
attributes.description: The CSS style class to apply to the data items. For type lineWithArea, this style will only be applied to the line if areaClassName is also specified. The style class and inline style will override any other styling specified through the properties. For tooltips, it's recommended to also pass a representative color to the color attribute.

attributes.name: svg-style
attributes.description: The inline style to apply to the data items. For type lineWithArea, this style will only be applied to the line if areaStyle is also specified. The style class and inline style will override any other styling specified through the properties. For tooltips, it's recommended to also pass a representative color to the color attribute.

attributes.name: tooltip
attributes.description: An object containing an optional callback function for tooltip customization.

attributes.name: track-resize
attributes.description: Defines whether the element will automatically render in response to changes in size. If set to off, then the application is responsible for calling refresh to render the element at the new size.

attributes.name: translations
attributes.description: A collection of translated resources from the translation bundle, or null if this component has no resources.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The chart type.

attributes.name: visual-effects
attributes.description: Defines whether visual effects such as overlays are applied to the spark chart.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer
attributes.description: A function that returns a custom tooltip. The function takes a dataContext argument, provided by the chart, with the following properties: parentElement: The tooltip element. The function can directly modify or append content to this element. color: The color of the chart. componentElement: The spark chart element. The function should return an Object that contains only one of the two properties: insert: HTMLElement | string - An HTML element, which will be appended to the tooltip, or a tooltip string. preventDefault: true - Indicates that the tooltip should not be displayed. It is not necessary to return {preventDefault:false} to display tooltip, since this is a default behavior.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.color
attributes.description: The color of the chart.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.component-element
attributes.description: The spark chart element.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.parent-element
attributes.description: The tooltip element. The function can directly modify or append content to this element.

tags.name: oj-spark-chart
tags.description: Displays information graphically, typically highlighting the trend of a data set in a compact form factor.

attributes.name: border-color
attributes.description: The default border color for the data items.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description: The color of the bar or marker for the data item. This override can be used to highlight important values or thresholds.

attributes.name: date
attributes.description: The date for the data item. The date should only be specified if the interval between data items is irregular.

attributes.name: high
attributes.description: The high value for range bar/area. Define 'low' and 'high' instead of 'value' to create a range bar/area spark chart.

attributes.name: low
attributes.description: The low value for range bar/area. Define 'low' and 'high' instead of 'value' to create a range bar/area spark chart.

attributes.name: marker-displayed
attributes.description: Defines whether a marker should be displayed for the data item. Only applies to line and area spark charts

attributes.name: marker-shape
attributes.description: The shape of the data markers. Can take the name of a built-in shape or the svg path commands for a custom shape. Only applies to line and area spark charts.

attributes.name: marker-size
attributes.description: The size of the data markers in pixels. Only applies to line and area spark charts.

attributes.name: svg-class-name
attributes.description: The CSS style class to apply to the data item. The style class and inline style will override any other styling specified through the properties. For tooltips and hover interactivity, it's recommended to also pass a representative color to the item color attribute.

attributes.name: svg-style
attributes.description: The inline style to apply to the data item. The style class and inline style will override any other styling specified through the properties. For tooltips and hover interactivity, it's recommended to also pass a representative color to the item color attribute.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of the data item.

attributes.name: on-border-color-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'borderColor' attribute

attributes.name: on-color-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'color' attribute

attributes.name: on-date-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'date' attribute

attributes.name: on-high-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'high' attribute

attributes.name: on-low-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'low' attribute

attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'markerDisplayed' attribute

attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'markerShape' attribute

attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'markerSize' attribute

tags.name: oj-spark-chart-item
tags.description: ojSparkChartItem

attributes.name: angle-extent
attributes.description: Specifies the angle extent of a gauge with circular orientation. Value should be provided in degrees.

attributes.name: animation-duration
attributes.description: The duration of the animations, in milliseconds. The default value comes from the CSS and varies based on theme.

attributes.name: animation-on-data-change
attributes.description: Defines the animation that is applied on data changes.

attributes.name: animation-on-display
attributes.description: Defines the animation that is shown on initial display.

attributes.name: border-color
attributes.description: The border color of the gauge. Only applies when thresholds are not defined. The default value varies based on theme.

attributes.name: border-radius
attributes.description: Defines the border radius of the indicator and plot area. When set to "auto", the border radius is set to a built-in default. Acceptable input follows CSS border-radius attribute specifications. The plot area border radius can be overwritten with the plotArea borderRadius atribute.

attributes.name: center
attributes.description: An object defining the center content of a status meter with circular orientation.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description: The color of the gauge. Only applies when thresholds are not defined. The default value varies based on theme.

attributes.name: indicator-size
attributes.description: Defines the ratio of relative thickness of the indicator to the plot area.

attributes.name: inner-radius
attributes.description: Specifies the inner radius of a gauge with circular orientation, defined by the distance from the center of the gauge to the innermost edge of the indicator and plot area. Valid values are a percent or ratio from 0 to 1.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: An object defining the label.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: The maximum value of the gauge.

attributes.name: metric-label
attributes.description: An object defining the value label.

attributes.name: min
attributes.description: The minimum value of the gauge.

attributes.name: orientation
attributes.description: Defines the type of status meter to be rendered.

attributes.name: plot-area
attributes.description: Plot Area for Status Meter Guage

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: Defines whether the value of the gauge can be changed by the end user.

attributes.name: reference-lines
attributes.description: An array of objects with the following properties defining the reference lines for the gauge.

attributes.name: start-angle
attributes.description: Specifies the start angle of a gauge with circular orientation. Value should be provided in degrees.

attributes.name: step
attributes.description: Specifies the increment by which values can be changed by the end user when readonly is false. The step must be a positive value that is smaller than the difference between the min and max. If not specified, the default step is 1/100 if the difference between the min and max.

attributes.name: svg-class-name
attributes.description: The CSS style class to apply to the gauge indicator. The style class and inline style will override any other styling specified through the properties. For tooltip interactivity, it's recommended to also pass a representative color to the color attribute.

attributes.name: svg-style
attributes.description: The inline style to apply to the gauge indicator. The style class and inline style will override any other styling specified through the properties. For tooltip interactivity, it's recommended to also pass a representative color to the color attribute.

attributes.name: threshold-display
attributes.description: Controls whether the current threshold is displayed on the indicator, in the plotArea, or if all the thresholds are diplayed in the plot area

attributes.name: thresholds
attributes.description: An array of objects with the following properties defining the thresholds for the gauge.

attributes.name: tooltip
attributes.description: An object containing an optional callback function for tooltip customization.

attributes.name: track-resize
attributes.description: Defines whether the element will automatically render in response to changes in size. If set to off, then the application is responsible for calling refresh to render the element at the new size.

attributes.name: transient-value
attributes.description:
The transientValue is the read-only property for retrieving
the transient value from the status meter gauge. It is triggered when dragging over the status meter gauge.

This is a read-only property so page authors cannot set or change it directly.

attributes.name: translations
attributes.description: A collection of translated resources from the translation bundle, or null if this component has no resources.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The metric value.

attributes.name: visual-effects
attributes.description: Defines whether visual effects such as overlays are applied to the gauge.

attributes.name: center.renderer
attributes.description:
A function that returns custom center content. The function takes a center context argument,
provided by the gauge, and should return an object with the following property: insert: HTMLElement - HTML element, which will be overlaid on top of the gauge. This HTML element will block interactivity of the gauge by default, but the CSS pointer-events property can be set to 'none' on this element if the gauge's interactivity is desired.

attributes.name: center.renderer.component-element
attributes.description: The status meter gauge HTML element.

attributes.name: center.renderer.inner-bounds
attributes.description: Object containing (x, y, width, height) of the rectangle inscribed in the center area. The inner bounds are useful for inserting content that is guaranteed to fit within the center area. If the angleExtent isn't 360 then we will provide the clipped square.

attributes.name: center.renderer.metric-label
attributes.description: The computed metric label.

attributes.name: center.renderer.outer-bounds
attributes.description: Object containing (x, y, width, height) of the rectangle circumscribing the center area. The outer bounds are useful for creating background for the entire center area when used with a CSS border-radius. If the angleExtent isn't 360 then we will provide the clipped square.

attributes.name: label.position
attributes.description: Defines the position of the label for horizontal and vertical gauges. The default position for horizontal gauges is 'start' and for vertical gauges is 'center'.

attributes.name: label.style
attributes.description: The CSS style object defining the style of the label.

attributes.name: label.text
attributes.description: The text for the label.

attributes.name: metric-label.converter
attributes.description: The converter used to format the labels. When using a converter, scaling should be set to none, as the formatted result may not be compatible with the scaling suffixes.

attributes.name: metric-label.position
attributes.description: Defines the position of the metric label for horizontal and vertical gauges. The default position of the metric label is outside of the plot area. If the label is not rendered, then 'withLabel' will render the metric label outside the plot area. When the label is rendered, all positions are treated as 'withLabel' except 'auto' and 'outsidePlotArea' which render the metric label outside the plot area. When the metric label is rendered 'withLabel', the metric label is displayed with the same style as the label. The position in the 'withLabel' case is specified by the label position attribute.

attributes.name: metric-label.rendered
attributes.description: Defines if the label is rendered. If set to auto, the label is rendered if the orientation is circular.

attributes.name: metric-label.scaling
attributes.description: The scaling behavior of the labels. When using a converter, scaling should be set to none, as the formatted result may not be compatible with the scaling suffixes.

attributes.name: metric-label.style
attributes.description: The CSS style object defining the style of the label.

attributes.name: metric-label.text
attributes.description: The text for the label. If specified, text will overwrite the numeric value that is displayed by default. The converter, scaling, and textType attributes are ignored when text is specified.

attributes.name: metric-label.text-type
attributes.description: Defines whether the label is a number or a percentage of the total value.

attributes.name: plot-area.border-color
attributes.description: The border color of the plot area.

attributes.name: plot-area.border-radius
attributes.description: Defines the border radius of the plot area shape. When set to "auto", the border radius is the same as the top level border radius. Acceptable input follows CSS border-radius attribute specifications.

attributes.name: plot-area.color
attributes.description: The color of the plot area. Only applies when useThresholdFillColor is off.

attributes.name: plot-area.rendered
attributes.description: Defines if the plot area is to be rendered. If set to auto, the plot area is rendered if the orientation is circular or if the thresholdDisplay is not onIndicator.

attributes.name: plot-area.svg-class-name
attributes.description: The CSS style class to apply to the plot area. The style class and inline style will override any other styling specified through the properties.

attributes.name: plot-area.svg-style
attributes.description: The inline style to apply to the plot area. The style class and inline style will override any other styling specified through the properties.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer
attributes.description:
A function that returns a custom tooltip. The function takes a tooltip context argument,
provided by the gauge, and should return an object that contains only one of the two properties: insert: HTMLElement | string - An HTML element, which will be appended to the tooltip, or a tooltip string. preventDefault: true - Indicates that the tooltip should not be displayed. It is not necessary to return {preventDefault:false} to display tooltip, since this is a default behavior.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.color
attributes.description: The indicator color of the gauge.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.component-element
attributes.description: The status meter gauge HTML element.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.label
attributes.description: The computed metric label.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.parent-element
attributes.description: The tooltip element. The function can directly modify or append content to this element.

attributes.name: translations.component-name
attributes.description:
Used to describe the data visualization type for accessibility.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.label-and-value
attributes.description:
Used to display a label and its value.

attributes.description:
Label for data visualizations used for accessibility.

attributes.name: translations.label-invalid-data
attributes.description:
Text shown when the component receives invalid data.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.label-no-data

Text shown when the component receives no data.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.state-maximized

Used to describe the maximized state for accessibility.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.state-minimized
attributes.description:
Used to describe the minimized state for accessibility.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.state-selected
attributes.description:
Used to describe the selected state for accessibility.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

attributes.name: translations.state-unselected
attributes.description:
Used to describe the unselected state for accessibility.

tags.name: oj-status-meter-gauge
tags.description: Displays information graphically, highlighting a specific metric value's progress in relation to its thresholds.  Horizontal, vertical, and circular formats are supported.

attributes.name: animation-duration
attributes.description: Specifies the animation duration in milliseconds. For data change animations with multiple stages, this attribute defines the duration of each stage. For example, if an animation contains two stages, the total duration will be two times this attribute's value. The default value comes from the CSS and varies based on theme.

attributes.name: animation-on-data-change
attributes.description: Specifies the animation that is applied on data changes.

attributes.name: animation-on-display
attributes.description: Specifies the animation that is shown on initial display.

attributes.name: animation-update-color
attributes.description: The color that is displayed during a data change animation when a node is updated.

attributes.name: as
attributes.description: An alias for the $current context variable passed to slot content for the nodeTemplate slot.

attributes.name: color-label
attributes.description: Specifies the label describing the color metric of the sunburst. This label will be used in the legend.

attributes.name: data
attributes.description: The oj.DataProvider for the nodes of the sunburst. It should provide a data tree where each node in the data tree corresponds to a node in the sunburst. The row key will be used as the id for sunburst nodes. Note that when using this attribute, a template for the nodeTemplate slot should be provided.

attributes.name: display-levels
attributes.description: The number of levels of nodes to display. By default all nodes are displayed.

attributes.name: drilling
attributes.description: Specifies whether drilling is enabled. Drillable nodes will show a pointer cursor on hover and fire an ojBeforeDrill and ojDrill event on click (double click if selection is enabled). Drilling on a node causes a property change to the rootNode attribute. The displayLevels attribute can be used in conjunction with drilling to display very deep hieracrchies. Use "on" to enable drilling for all nodes. To enable or disable drilling on individual nodes use the drilling attribute in each node.

attributes.name: expanded
attributes.description: Specifies the key set containing the ids of sunburst nodes that should be expanded on initial render. Use the ExpandedKeySet class to specify nodes to expand. Use the ExpandAllKeySet class to expand all nodes. By default, all sunburst nodes are expanded.

attributes.name: hidden-categories
attributes.description: An array of category strings used for filtering. Nodes with any category matching an item in this array will be filtered.

attributes.name: highlight-match
attributes.description: The matching condition for the highlightedCategories property. By default, highlightMatch is 'all' and only items whose categories match all of the values specified in the highlightedCategories array will be highlighted. If highlightMatch is 'any', then items that match at least one of the highlightedCategories values will be highlighted.

attributes.name: highlighted-categories
attributes.description: An array of category strings used for highlighting. Nodes matching all categories in this array will be highlighted.

attributes.name: hover-behavior
attributes.description: Defines the behavior applied when hovering over the nodes.

attributes.name: hover-behavior-delay
attributes.description: Specifies initial hover delay in ms for highlighting nodes.

attributes.name: node-defaults
attributes.description: An object defining default properties for the nodes. Component CSS classes should be used to set component wide styling. This API should be used only for styling a specific instance of the component. Properties specified on this object may be overridden by specifications on the sunburst nodes. Some property default values come from the CSS and varies based on theme.

attributes.name: nodes
attributes.description: An array of objects with the following properties that defines the data for the nodes. Also accepts a Promise for deferred data rendering. No data will be rendered if the Promise is rejected.

attributes.name: root-node
attributes.description: The id of the root node. When specified, only the root node and children of the root will be displayed.

attributes.name: root-node-content
attributes.description: An object defining custom root node content for the sunburst.

attributes.name: rotation
attributes.description: Specifies whether client side rotation is enabled.

attributes.name: selection
attributes.description: An array containing the ids of the initially selected nodes.

attributes.name: selection-mode
attributes.description: Specifies the selection mode.

attributes.name: size-label
attributes.description: Specifies the label describing the size metric of the sunburst. This label will be used in the legend.

attributes.name: sorting
attributes.description: Specifies whether whether the nodes are sorted by size. When sorting is enabled, nodes that have the same parent are sorted in order of descending size.

attributes.name: start-angle
attributes.description: Specifies the starting angle of the sunburst. Valid values are numbers between 0 and 360.

attributes.name: tooltip
attributes.description: An object containing an optional callback function for tooltip customization.

attributes.name: touch-response
attributes.description: Data visualizations require a press and hold delay before triggering tooltips and rollover effects on mobile devices to avoid interfering with page panning, but these hold delays can make applications seem slower and less responsive. For a better user experience, the application can remove the touch and hold delay when data visualizations are used within a non scrolling container or if there is sufficient space outside of the visualization for panning. If touchResponse is touchStart the element will instantly trigger the touch gesture and consume the page pan events. If touchResponse is auto, the element will behave like touchStart if it determines that it is not rendered within scrolling content and if panning is not available for those elements that support the feature.

attributes.name: track-resize
attributes.description: Defines whether the element will automatically render in response to changes in size. If set to off, then the application is responsible for calling refresh to render the element at the new size.

attributes.name: translations
attributes.description: A collection of translated resources from the translation bundle, or null if this component has no resources.

attributes.name: node-defaults.border-color
attributes.description: The default border color of the nodes.

attributes.name: node-defaults.border-width
attributes.description: The default border width of the nodes.

attributes.name: node-defaults.hover-color
attributes.description: The color of the node hover feedback. The default value comes from the CSS and varies based on theme.

attributes.name: node-defaults.label-display
attributes.description: The label display behavior for the nodes. More labels are generally displayed when using rotation, with the trade off of readability. When auto is used, rotated or horizontal labels will be used based on the client browser and platform.

attributes.name: node-defaults.label-halign
attributes.description: The horizontal alignment for labels displayed within the node. Only applies to rotated text.

attributes.name: node-defaults.label-min-length
attributes.description: The minimum number of visible characters needed in order to render a truncated label. If the minimum is not met when calculating the truncated label then the label is not displayed.

attributes.name: node-defaults.label-style
attributes.description: The CSS style object defining the style of the label. The default value comes from the CSS and varies based on theme.

attributes.name: node-defaults.selected-inner-color
attributes.description: The inner color of the node selection feedback. The default value comes from the CSS and varies based on theme.

attributes.name: node-defaults.selected-outer-color
attributes.description: The outer color of the node selection feedback. The default value comes from the CSS and varies based on theme.

attributes.name: node-defaults.show-disclosure
attributes.description: Specifies whether to display the expand/collapse button on hover. If the button is clicked, the expanded attribute is updated with the new array of node ids.

attributes.name: root-node-content.renderer
attributes.description: A function that returns custom root node content.

attributes.name: root-node-content.renderer.outer-bounds
attributes.description: Object containing information on the rectangle circumscribing the root node area. The x and y coordinates are relative to the top, left corner of the element.

attributes.name: root-node-content.renderer.inner-bounds
attributes.description: Object containing information on the rectangle inscribed in the root node area. The x and y coordinates are relative to the top, left corner of the element.

attributes.name: root-node-content.renderer.id
attributes.description: The id of the root node.

attributes.name: root-node-content.renderer.data
attributes.description: The data object of the root node.

attributes.name: root-node-content.renderer.item-data
attributes.description: The row data object for the root node. This will only be set if a DataProvider is being used.

attributes.name: root-node-content.renderer.component-element
attributes.description: The sunburst element.

attributes.name: root-node-content.renderer.outer-bounds.x
attributes.description: The x coordinate relative to the top, left corner of the element.

attributes.name: root-node-content.renderer.outer-bounds.y
attributes.description: The y coordinate relative to the top, left corner of the element.

attributes.name: root-node-content.renderer.outer-bounds.width
attributes.description: The width of the rectangle circumscribing the root node area.

attributes.name: root-node-content.renderer.outer-bounds.height
attributes.description: The height of the rectangle circumscribing the root node area.

attributes.name: root-node-content.renderer.inner-bounds.x
attributes.description: The x coordinate relative to the top, left corner of the element.

attributes.name: root-node-content.renderer.inner-bounds.y
attributes.description: The y coordinate relative to the top, left corner of the element.

attributes.name: on-oj-expand

attributes.name: on-oj-collapse
