attributes.name: on-oj-before-deselect
attributes.description: Triggered immediately before a step is deselected.

attributes.name: on-oj-deselect
attributes.description: Triggered after a step has been deselected.

attributes.name: on-oj-before-select
attributes.description: Triggered immediately before a Step is selected.

attributes.name: on-oj-select
attributes.description: Triggered after a step has been selected.

tags.name: oj-train
tags.description: Displays a navigation visual element that allows an application user to go between different steps of a process.

attributes.name: animation-duration
attributes.description: Specifies the animation duration in milliseconds. For data change animations with multiple stages, this attribute defines the duration of each stage. For example, if an animation contains two stages, the total duration will be two times this attribute's value. The default value comes from the CSS and varies based on theme.

attributes.name: animation-on-data-change
attributes.description: Specifies the animation that is applied on data changes.

attributes.name: animation-on-display
attributes.description: Specifies the animation that is shown on initial display.

attributes.name: animation-update-color
attributes.description: The color that is displayed during a data change animation when a node is updated.

attributes.name: as
attributes.description: An alias for the $current context variable passed to slot content for the nodeTemplate slot.

attributes.name: color-label
attributes.description: Specifies the label describing the color metric of the treemap. This label will be used in the legend.

attributes.name: data
attributes.description: The oj.DataProvider for the nodes of the treemap. It should provide a data tree where each node in the data tree corresponds to a node in the treemap. The row key will be used as the id for treemap nodes. Note that when using this attribute, a template for the nodeTemplate slot should be provided.

attributes.name: display-levels
attributes.description: The number of levels of nodes to display. By default all nodes are displayed.

attributes.name: drilling
attributes.description: Specifies whether drilling is enabled. Drillable nodes will show a pointer cursor on hover and fire an ojBeforeDrill and ojDrill event on click (double click if selection is enabled). Drilling on a node causes a property change to the rootNode attribute. The displayLevels attribute can be used in conjunction with drilling to display very deep hieracrchies. Use "on" to enable drilling for all nodes. To enable or disable drilling on individual nodes use the drilling attribute in each node.

attributes.name: group-gaps
attributes.description: Specifies whether gaps are displayed between groups. Gaps can be useful for drawing attention to the differences between groups.

attributes.name: hidden-categories
attributes.description: An array of category strings used for filtering. Nodes with any category matching an item in this array will be filtered.

attributes.name: highlight-match
attributes.description: The matching condition for the highlightedCategories property. By default, highlightMatch is 'all' and only items whose categories match all of the values specified in the highlightedCategories array will be highlighted. If highlightMatch is 'any', then items that match at least one of the highlightedCategories values will be highlighted.

attributes.name: highlighted-categories
attributes.description: An array of category strings used for highlighting. Nodes matching all categories in this array will be highlighted.

attributes.name: hover-behavior
attributes.description: Defines the behavior applied when hovering over the nodes.

attributes.name: hover-behavior-delay
attributes.description: Specifies initial hover delay in ms for highlighting nodes.

attributes.name: isolated-node
attributes.description: The id of the initially isolated node.

attributes.name: layout
attributes.description: Specifies the layout of the treemap. The squarified layout results in nodes that are as square as possible, for easier comparison of node sizes. The sliceAndDice layouts are useful for animation, as the ordering of the data is maintained. SliceAndDice layouts are also useful for small form factor treemaps.

attributes.name: node-content
attributes.description: An object defining custom node content for the treemap. Only leaf nodes with no child nodes will have the custom content rendered.

attributes.name: node-defaults
attributes.description: An object defining default properties for the nodes. Component CSS classes should be used to set component wide styling. This API should be used only for styling a specific instance of the component. Properties specified on this object may be overridden by specifications on the treemap nodes. Some property default values come from the CSS and varies based on theme.

attributes.name: node-separators
attributes.description: Specifies the visual effect for separating the nodes from each other. This allows for adjacent nodes of the same color to be distinguished.

attributes.name: nodes
attributes.description: An array of objects with the following properties that defines the data for the nodes. Also accepts a Promise for deferred data rendering. No data will be rendered if the Promise is rejected.

attributes.name: root-node
attributes.description: The id of the root node. When specified, only the root node and children of the root will be displayed.

attributes.name: selection
attributes.description: An array containing the ids of the initially selected nodes.

attributes.name: selection-mode
attributes.description: Specifies the selection mode.

attributes.name: size-label
attributes.description: Specifies the label describing the size metric of the treemap. This label will be used in the legend.

attributes.name: sorting
attributes.description: Specifies whether the nodes are sorted by size. When sorting is enabled, nodes that have the same parent are sorted in order of descending size.

attributes.name: tooltip
attributes.description: An object containing an optional callback function for tooltip customization.

attributes.name: touch-response
attributes.description: Data visualizations require a press and hold delay before triggering tooltips and rollover effects on mobile devices to avoid interfering with page panning, but these hold delays can make applications seem slower and less responsive. For a better user experience, the application can remove the touch and hold delay when data visualizations are used within a non scrolling container or if there is sufficient space outside of the visualization for panning. If touchResponse is touchStart the element will instantly trigger the touch gesture and consume the page pan events. If touchResponse is auto, the element will behave like touchStart if it determines that it is not rendered within scrolling content and if panning is not available for those elements that support the feature.

attributes.name: track-resize
attributes.description: Defines whether the element will automatically render in response to changes in size. If set to off, then the application is responsible for calling refresh to render the element at the new size.

attributes.name: translations
attributes.description: A collection of translated resources from the translation bundle, or null if this component has no resources.

attributes.name: node-content.renderer
attributes.description: A function that returns custom node content.

attributes.name: node-content.renderer.bounds
attributes.description: Object containing information on the node area. The x and y coordinates are relative to the top, left corner of the element.

attributes.name: node-content.renderer.id
attributes.description: The id of the node.

attributes.name: node-content.renderer.data
attributes.description: The data object of the node.

attributes.name: node-content.renderer.item-data
attributes.description: The row data object for the node. This will only be set if a DataProvider is being used.

attributes.name: node-content.renderer.component-element
attributes.description: The treemap element.

attributes.name: node-content.renderer.bounds.x
attributes.description: The x coordinate relative to the top, left corner of the element.

attributes.name: node-content.renderer.bounds.y
attributes.description: The y coordinate relative to the top, left corner of the element.

attributes.name: node-content.renderer.bounds.width
attributes.description: The width of the node area.

attributes.name: node-content.renderer.bounds.height
attributes.description: The height of the node area.

attributes.name: node-defaults.group-label-display
attributes.description: The label display behavior for group nodes.

attributes.name: node-defaults.header
attributes.description: An object defining default properties for the node header. Component CSS classes should be used to set component wide styling. This API should be used only for styling a specific instance of the component. Some property default values come from the CSS and varies based on theme.

attributes.name: node-defaults.hover-color
attributes.description: The color of the node hover feedback. The default value comes from the CSS and varies based on theme.

attributes.name: node-defaults.label-display
attributes.description: The label display behavior for leaf nodes.

attributes.name: node-defaults.label-halign
attributes.description: The horizontal alignment for labels displayed within the node.

attributes.name: node-defaults.label-min-length
attributes.description: The minimum number of visible characters needed in order to render a truncated label. If the minimum is not met when calculating the truncated label then the label is not displayed.

attributes.name: node-defaults.label-style
attributes.description: The CSS style object defining the style of the label. The CSS white-space property can be defined with value "nowrap" to disable default text wrapping. The default value comes from the CSS and varies based on theme.

attributes.name: node-defaults.label-valign
attributes.description: The vertical alignment for labels displayed within the node.

attributes.name: node-defaults.selected-inner-color
attributes.description: The inner color of the node selection feedback. The default value comes from the CSS and varies based on theme.

attributes.name: node-defaults.selected-outer-color
attributes.description: The outer color of the node selection feedback. The default value comes from the CSS and varies based on theme.

attributes.name: node-defaults.header.background-color
attributes.description: The background color of the node headers. The default value comes from the CSS and varies based on theme.

attributes.name: node-defaults.header.border-color
attributes.description: The border color of the node headers. The default value comes from the CSS and varies based on theme.

attributes.name: node-defaults.header.hover-background-color
attributes.description: The background color of the node hover feedback. The default value comes from the CSS and varies based on theme.

attributes.name: node-defaults.header.hover-inner-color
attributes.description: The inner color of the node hover feedback. The default value comes from the CSS and varies based on theme.

attributes.name: node-defaults.header.hover-outer-color
attributes.description: The outer color of the node hover feedback. The default value comes from the CSS and varies based on theme.

attributes.name: node-defaults.header.isolate
attributes.description: Specifies whether isolate behavior is enabled on the node.

attributes.name: node-defaults.header.label-halign
attributes.description: The horizontal alignment of the header title.

attributes.name: node-defaults.header.label-style
attributes.description: The CSS style string defining the style of the header title. The default value comes from the CSS and varies based on theme.

attributes.name: node-defaults.header.selected-background-color
attributes.description: The background color of the node selection feedback. The default value comes from the CSS and varies based on theme.

attributes.name: node-defaults.header.selected-inner-color
attributes.description: The inner color of the node selection feedback. The default value comes from the CSS and varies based on theme.

attributes.name: node-defaults.header.selected-outer-color
attributes.description: The outer color of the node selection feedback. The default value comes from the CSS and varies based on theme.

attributes.name: node-defaults.header.use-node-color
attributes.description: Specifies whether the node color should be displayed in the header.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.parent-element
attributes.description: The tooltip element. The function can directly modify or append content to this element.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.id

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.label
attributes.description: The label of the hovered node.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.value

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.color
attributes.description: The color of the hovered node.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.data
attributes.description: The data object of the hovered node.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.item-data
attributes.description: The row data object for the hovered node. This will only be set if a DataProvider is being used.

attributes.name: tooltip.renderer.component-element
attributes.description: The treemap element.

attributes.name: on-oj-before-drill
attributes.description: Triggered immediately before any node in the treemap is drilled into. The drill event can be vetoed if the beforeDrill callback returns false.

attributes.name: on-oj-drill
attributes.description: Triggered during a drill gesture (double click if selection is enabled, single click otherwise).

tags.name: oj-treemap
tags.description: An interactive data visualization in which hierarchical data is represented across two dimensions by the size and color of nested rectangular nodes.

attributes.name: categories
attributes.description: An optional array of category strings corresponding to this data item. This enables highlighting and filtering of individual data items through interactions with the legend and other visualization elements. The categories array of each node is required to be a superset of the categories array of its parent node. If not specified, the ids of the node and its ancestors will be used.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description: The fill color of the node.

attributes.name: drilling
attributes.description: Specifies whether drilling is enabled for the node. Drillable nodes will show a pointer cursor on hover and fire an ojDrill event on click (double click if selection is enabled). To enable drilling for all nodes at once, use the drilling attribute in the top level.

attributes.name: group-label-display
attributes.description: The label display behavior for group nodes.

attributes.name: header
attributes.description: An object defining the properties for the node header.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The label for this node.

attributes.name: label-display
attributes.description: The label display behavior for leaf nodes.

attributes.name: label-halign
attributes.description: The horizontal alignment for labels displayed within the node.

attributes.name: label-style
attributes.description: The CSS style object defining the style of the label. The CSS white-space property can be defined with value "nowrap" to disable default text wrapping.

attributes.name: label-valign
attributes.description: The vertical alignment for labels displayed within the node.

attributes.name: pattern
attributes.description: The pattern used to fill the node.

attributes.name: selectable
attributes.description: Specifies whether or not the node will be selectable.

attributes.name: short-desc
attributes.description: The description of this node. This is used for accessibility and also for customizing the tooltip text.

attributes.name: svg-class-name
attributes.description: The CSS style class to apply to the node. The style class and inline style will override any other styling specified through the properties. For tooltip interactivity, it's recommended to also pass a representative color to the node color attribute.

attributes.name: svg-style
attributes.description: The inline style to apply to the node. The style class and inline style will override any other styling specified through the properties. For tooltip interactivity, it's recommended to also pass a representative color to the node color attribute.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of the node. The value determines the relative size of the node.

attributes.name: header.isolate
attributes.description: Specifies whether isolate behavior is enabled on the node.

attributes.name: header.label-halign
attributes.description: The horizontal alignment of the header title.

attributes.name: header.label-style
attributes.description: The CSS style object defining the style of the header title.

attributes.name: header.use-node-color
attributes.description: Specifies whether the node color should be displayed in the header.

attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'categories' attribute

tags.name: oj-treemap-node
tags.description: ojTreemapNode

attributes.name: current-item
attributes.description:
The key of the item that has the browser focus.
This is a read-only attribute so page authors cannot set or change it directly.

attributes.name: data
attributes.description:
The data source for the TreeView. Accepts an instance of oj.TreeDataSource.
See the data source section in the introduction for out of the box data source types.
If the data attribute is not specified, the child elements are used as content. If there's no
content specified, then an empty list is rendered.

attributes.name: dnd
attributes.description:
Enable drag and drop functionality.
JET provides support for HTML5 Drag and Drop events. Please refer to mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Guide/HTML/Drag_and_drop third party documentation
on HTML5 Drag and Drop to learn how to use it.

attributes.name: expanded
attributes.description:
Specifies the key set containing the keys of the TreeView items that should be expanded.
Use the ExpandedKeySet class to specify items to expand.
Use the ExpandAllKeySet class to expand all items.

attributes.name: item
attributes.description: The item attribute contains a subset of attributes for items.

attributes.name: selection
attributes.description: The current selections in the TreeView. An empty array indicates nothing is selected.

attributes.name: selection-mode
attributes.description: Specifies whether selection can be made and the cardinality of selection in the TreeView.

attributes.name: translations
attributes.description: A collection of translated resources from the translation bundle, or null if this component has no resources.

attributes.name: dnd.drag.items
attributes.description: If this object is specified, TreeView will initiate drag operation when the user drags on an item.

attributes.name: dnd.drag.items.data-types
attributes.description:
(optional) The MIME types to use for the dragged data in the dataTransfer object. This can be a string if there is only one
type, or an array of strings if multiple types are needed.
For example, if selected items of employee data are being dragged, dataTypes could be "application/employees+json". Drop targets can examine the data types and decide
whether to accept the data. A text input may only accept "text" data type, while a chart for displaying employee data may be configured to accept the "application/employees+json" type.
For each type in the array, dataTransfer.setData will be called with the specified type and the JSON version of the selected item data as the value. The selected item data
is an array of objects, with each object representing a model object from the underlying data source. For example, if the underlying data is an oj.Collection, then this
would be a oj.Model object. Note that when static HTML is used, then the value would be the HTML string of the selected item.
This property is required unless the application calls setData itself in a dragStart callback function.

attributes.name: dnd.drag.items.drag-start
attributes.description:
(optional) A callback function that receives the "dragstart" event and context information as arguments:
function(event, context)
All of the event payloads listed below can be found under the context argument.
items: An array of objects, with each object representing the data of one selected item.
This function can set its own data and drag image as needed. If dataTypes is specified, event.dataTransfer is already populated with the default data when this function is invoked.
If dataTypes is not specified, this function must call event.dataTransfer.setData to set the data or else the drag operation will be cancelled. In either case, the drag image is
set to an image of the dragged items on the TreeView.

attributes.name: dnd.drag.items.drag
attributes.description:
(optional) A callback function that receives the "drag" event as argument:
function(event)

attributes.name: dnd.drag.items.drag-end
attributes.description:
(optional) A callback function that receives the "dragend" event as argument:
function(event)

attributes.name: dnd.drop.items
attributes.description: An object that specifies callback functions to handle dropping items

attributes.name: dnd.drop.items.data-types
attributes.description:
A data type or an array of data types this component can accept.
This property is required unless dragEnter, dragOver, and drop callback functions are specified to handle the corresponding events.

attributes.name: dnd.drop.items.drag-enter
attributes.description:
(optional) A callback function that receives the "dragenter" event and context information as arguments:
function(event, context)
All of the event payloads listed below can be found under the context argument.
item: The item being entered.
This function should call event.preventDefault() to indicate the dragged data can be accepted.
Otherwise, dataTypes will be matched against the drag dataTypes to determine if the data is acceptable. If there is a match, event.preventDefault()
will be called to indicate that the data can be accepted.

attributes.name: dnd.drop.items.drag-over
attributes.description:
(optional) A callback function that receives the "dragover" event and context information as arguments:
function(event, context)
All of the event payloads listed below can be found under the context argument.
item: The item being dragged over.
This function should call event.preventDefault() to indicate the dragged data can be accepted.
Otherwise, dataTypes will be matched against the drag dataTypes to determine if the data is acceptable. If there is a match, event.preventDefault()
will be called to indicate that the data can be accepted.

attributes.name: dnd.drop.items.drag-leave
attributes.description:
(optional) A callback function that receives the "dragleave" event and context information as arguments:
function(event, context)
All of the event payloads listed below can be found under the context argument.
item: The item that was last entered.

attributes.name: dnd.drop.items.drop
attributes.description:
(required) A callback function that receives the "drop" event and context information as arguments:
function(event, context)
All of the event payloads listed below can be found under the context argument.
item: The item being dropped on.
position: The drop position relative to the item being dropped on.
Valid values are "inside", "before", "after", and "first" (the first child of the item being dropped on).
This function should call event.preventDefault() to indicate the dragged data can be accepted.
If the application needs to look at the data for the item being dropped on, it can use the getContextByNode method.

attributes.name: item.focusable
attributes.description:
A function that returns whether the item is focusable.
A item that is not focusable cannot be clicked on or navigated to.
See itemContext in the introduction
to see the object passed into the focusable function.
If no function is specified, then all the items will be focusable.

attributes.name: item.renderer
attributes.description:
The renderer function that renders the contents of the item. See itemContext
in the introduction to see the object passed into the renderer function.
The function should return one of the following: An Object with the following property: insert: HTMLElement | string - A string or a DOM element of the content inside the item. Nothing: If the developer chooses to manipulate the item element directly, the function should return nothing.

attributes.name: item.selectable
attributes.description:
A function that returns whether the item can be selected.
If selectionMode is set to "none" this attribute is ignored.
See itemContext in the introduction
to see the object passed into the selectable function.
If no function is specified, then all the items will be selectable.

attributes.name: item.focusable.component-element
attributes.description: The TreeView element.

attributes.name: item.focusable.data
attributes.description: The data object of the item (not available for static content).

attributes.name: item.focusable.depth
attributes.description: The depth of the item. The depth of the first level children under the invisible root is 1.

attributes.name: item.focusable.index
attributes.description: The index of the item relative to its parent, where 0 is the index of the first item.

attributes.name: item.focusable.key
attributes.description: The key of the item.

attributes.name: item.focusable.leaf
attributes.description: Whether the item is a leaf item.

attributes.name: item.focusable.parent-element
attributes.description: The TreeView item element. The renderer can use this to directly append content.

attributes.name: item.focusable.parent-key
attributes.description: The key of the parent item (not available for root item).

attributes.name: item.renderer.component-element
attributes.description: The TreeView element.

attributes.name: item.renderer.data
attributes.description: The data object of the item (not available for static content).

attributes.name: item.renderer.depth
attributes.description: The depth of the item. The depth of the first level children under the invisible root is 1.

attributes.name: item.renderer.index
attributes.description: The index of the item relative to its parent, where 0 is the index of the first item.

attributes.name: item.renderer.key
attributes.description: The key of the item.

attributes.name: item.renderer.leaf
attributes.description: Whether the item is a leaf item.

attributes.name: item.renderer.parent-element
attributes.description: The TreeView item element. The renderer can use this to directly append content.

attributes.name: item.renderer.parent-key
attributes.description: The key of the parent item (not available for root item).

attributes.name: item.selectable.component-element
attributes.description: The TreeView element.

attributes.name: item.selectable.data
attributes.description: The data object of the item (not available for static content).

attributes.name: item.selectable.depth
attributes.description: The depth of the item. The depth of the first level children under the invisible root is 1.

attributes.name: item.selectable.index
attributes.description: The index of the item relative to its parent, where 0 is the index of the first item.

attributes.name: item.selectable.key
attributes.description: The key of the item.

attributes.name: item.selectable.leaf
attributes.description: Whether the item is a leaf item.

attributes.name: item.selectable.parent-element
attributes.description: The TreeView item element. The renderer can use this to directly append content.

attributes.name: item.selectable.parent-key
attributes.description: The key of the parent item (not available for root item).

attributes.name: on-current-item-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'currentItem' attribute

attributes.name: on-data-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'data' attribute

attributes.name: on-dnd-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'dnd' attribute

attributes.name: on-expanded-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'expanded' attribute

attributes.name: on-item-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'item' attribute

attributes.name: on-selection-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'selection' attribute

attributes.name: on-selection-mode-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'selectionMode' attribute

attributes.name: on-translations-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'translations' attribute

attributes.name: on-oj-animate-end
attributes.description:
Triggered when the default animation of a particular action has ended.
Note this event will not be triggered if application cancelled the default animation on animateStart.

attributes.name: on-oj-animate-start
attributes.description:
Triggered when the default animation of a particular action is about to start.
The default animation can be cancelled by calling event.preventDefault().

attributes.name: on-oj-before-collapse
attributes.description:
Triggered before an item is collapsed via the expanded attribute or via the UI.
Call event.preventDefault() to veto the event, which prevents collapsing the item.

attributes.name: on-oj-before-current-item
attributes.description:
Triggered before the current item is changed via the currentItem attribute or via the UI.
Call event.preventDefault() to veto the event, which prevents changing the current item.

attributes.name: on-oj-before-expand
attributes.description:
Triggered before an item is expanded via the expanded attribute or via the UI.
Call event.preventDefault() to veto the event, which prevents expanding the item.

attributes.name: on-oj-collapse
attributes.description: Triggered after an item has been collapsed.

attributes.name: on-oj-expand
attributes.description: Triggered after an item has been expanded.

tags.name: oj-tree-view
tags.description: Displays hierarchical relationships between the items in a tree.

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description:
The current validity state of the
oj-validation-group element.

The oj-validation-group's
valid property value is calculated from all the
enabled components it tracks. The most 'invalid' component's
valid property value will be
oj-validation-group's valid property value.
For example,
if all the components are valid except one is "invalidShown", then oj-validation-group's
valid value will be "invalidShown". If one is "invalidShown" and one is "invalidHidden",
then oj-validation-group's valid value will be "invalidShown" since "invalidShown" is more
invalid than "invalidHidden".


When any of the enabled tracked component's valid value changes, oj-validation-group will
be notified and will update its own valid value if it has changed.
There is no default value for the valid property
since it is a read-only property that is calculated on initialization
and kept updated if any of its tracked component's valid value changes.


The oj-validation-group does not filter out components that are hidden.
Hidden components will be considered
in oj-validation-group's valid calculation as long as they are enabled.
A hidden enabled component's valid state is no different
than a visible enabled component; if there
is an error that isn't a deferred error, its valid value is "invalidShown".
You can disable any components you do not want
considered in oj-validation-group's valid value. Note: New valid states may be added to the list of valid values in future releases. If so, we will keep the convention where if it is valid, it will start with "valid". If it is invalid, it will start with "invalid". If it is pending, it will start with "pending".

attributes.name: on-valid-changed
attributes.description: Property change listener function for 'valid' attribute

tags.name: oj-validation-group
